title.rendered: Need For Discernment, Inspired by Pastor Gregg Johnson

content.rendered:
Good morning,

My pastor on Sunday was speaking on a subject that has been in my heart for sometime. I have shared along the lines in which he preached on. I took notes from his teaching and studied some more. Due to time, I would like to take a portion of the message and share with you.
There is a great need for discernment in the 21ST century church. In the Pentecostal movement where souls are being added to the kingdom of God in thousands everyday, there is a great need for INTEGRITY and CREDIBILITY demonstrated by pastors, preachers, teachers, prophets to mention a few. The reason for this is because as the Pentecostal movement continues to rise and great things are happening, we are also seeing a lot of damage being done in the name of Christianity and integrity and credibility are lacking in some of the lives of the individuals who call themselves Christians especially in the leadership arena. The integrity of the word is compromised through twist and manipulation on the word of God causing many to live in error and heresy.

 As born again believers, we must have discernment which is the ability to distinguish between right and wrong, especially when conditions are obscure, ambiguous or even misrepresented. Of all the things Solomon asked for when God gave him a blank check to ask for anything he wanted, he asked for wisdom to discern, 1 Kings 3:9, “﻿Therefore give to Your servant an ﻿understanding  (wisdom) heart ﻿﻿to judge Your people, that I may ﻿discern between good and evil”, three more scriptures to strengthen the discerning spirit, Ezekiel 44:23, Luke 12:56, Hebrews 5:12-14. Why is discernment so key to our Christian lives? We want to live in truth. John 8:32, “And you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.” No one likes to be deceived by anyone and what a tragedy it is when you discover you have been deceived just because you couldn’t discern what was presented to you especially when you did not know the word. Eve was deceived because the serpent manipulated God’s word and she could not discern, Genesis 3:1, Now the serpent was more crafty … He said to the woman, “Did God REALLY say, ‘You must not eat from any tree in the garden’?”

 In the light of too many preaching going on in our land, we have to be very careful what we feed to our spirit and mind because many of today’s preaching may appear sound but when you apply wisdom that brings about discernment through the word of God you find that there maybe SOME truths and a lot of errors, misinterpretation and manipulation that comes with it. Four areas where great discernment is needed are. 1. Discern CHARACTER over CHARISMA, 2. Discern DOCTRINE over DECEPTION, 3. Discern PROPHESY over PRESUMPTION, 4. Discern MIRACLES over MANIPULATION. I only have time to share on the first two.

 1. Discern CHARACTER over CHARISMA. A person of charisma could be a person with gifts, talents even good looks. Charisma appeals to the flesh. Remember Saul who was appointed king when the Israelites demanded for a king?. They did not receive a king with character but a king with charisma to be like other nations, 1 Samuel 9:2, “And he had a choice and handsome son whose name was Saul. There was not a more handsome person than he among the children of Israel. ﻿From his shoulders upward he was taller than any of the people”. Absalom the son of David was another man with charisma who tried to elevate himself. Is it not true today that we have many preachers with charisma (likeable, articulate, charming, good looking) but the big question is, do they have character?  There is nothing wrong with Charisma yet Character should supercede charisma. Charisma can put anyone on top, Character will keep them there. In this age, many prefer what they like to hear rather than what they should hear. You know the end of Saul and Absalom. 2 Timothy 4:3-4, “For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears; And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables”.

 2. Discern DOCTRINE over DECEPTION.  Paul addresses this with his spiritual son Timothy in 1 Timothy 4:1 where he says “Now the Spirit ﻿expressly says that in latter times some will depart from the faith, giving heed ﻿ ﻿to deceiving spirits and doctrines of demons” Which means, moving away from preaching the essential doctrines of Christianity and the whole counsel of God. Teachings appearing to be powerful but lacking the power fueled through the truth of God’s word. It’s easy to catch something that is wide open, when you talk about deception, it’s subtle, covered with some truths or may appear to be truth. Paul tells Timothy to be grounded in the word and teach the word, then says In vs. 6 “If you put these instructions before the brothers and sisters,﻿ you will be a good servant﻿ ﻿ of Christ Jesus, nourished on the words of the faith and of the sound teaching that you have followed (NRSV). Without discernment, many Christians are being led by doctrines that are not sound”. Remember all teachings are judged by it’s agreement with the words of our Lord Jesus Christ. Read 1Timothy 6 and the entire 2 Peter which are eye opening to discerning between Doctrine and Deception.

As the spirit leads, I will share some more.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good Morning,

It gives me great pleasure to share a devotion which was done by one of my close friends Jemima Elizabeth (in India) who God used to open the door to our ministry in India. She has been such a great great blessing and God has honored her by elevating her to greater levels. Whenever you remember, say prayer for her as she taken a new challenging assignment. Be blessed as you read her devotion. Ev.

It gives me pleasure once again to share my learning of the word with you all . for today I chose the topic “Attitude of gratitude”

When do we give thanks unto the Lord – how do we give Him thanks – what do we give Him thanks for  ???

       When someone does something good for us, it maybe even a little thing, we cant just sit there and ignore the fact that he has done this favor or a good deed to us, we would want to express our gratitude to that person, tell him /her how thankful we are. Sometimes it makes us so happy but just saying “thank you, I really appreciate your help”. When we can do it so easily and naturally without any effort to people around us, it is even more easier for us to keep letting the Lord know how much we are thankful to Him for every little act He is performing in our lives. And later It would become so difficult for us to just sit and keep receiving everything from Him and not letting Him know how much that meant to us. We develop an attitude of gratitude.

       David is a perfect example to us for the way he gave thanks to the Lord for just anything and in everything. He would say “Give thanks to the Lord for He is good and his love endures forever” as in Psalms 118:1 and 107:1, simply giving thanks for His goodness. If we like a person, whenever we get a chance to meet him or her we just let them know how nice they are or how happy we are to meet them, or appreciate them in something or the other, its just a human reflex. Likewise David used to keep on praising and thanking the Lord for His unfailing and everlasting love, his kindness, his mercy, his grace.

       Paul is another who teaches us how to be grateful to God in everything. As he says in 1 Thess 5:18 – “Give thanks in all circumstances, for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus“. this answers two of our questions – when do we give thanks and the basic reason why we need to give thanks. So whenever we seek God’s will in our lives for anything we should always remember that His will for us is also to give Him thanks in everything . No condition in this world is so bad where there is nothing to give thanks for. Now lets look at some reasons for telling Jesus “Thank You”, we shall look into just three reasons out of the many, today.

1. Thanks for bread: In our every day walk in life we as usual thank the Lord for the food we eat. Jesus himself thanked the Father in heaven before he broke the bread as in 1 Corinth 11:24. We see Paul giving thanks for the bread in Acts 27.35. 

2. Thanks for eternal life through Jesus Christ: This is God’s indescribable gift to us which no man can give unto us and that makes us special children of the Most High God. As in 2 Corinth 9:17 we should give thanks unto the Lord for his gratitude.

3. Thanks for the victory over death: Death is something common man is afraid of, but we know that if we die hereon earth, we get to live with Him in Heaven. 1 Corinth 15: 35 to 58 explains very clearly the Resurrection Body. A very powerful teacher of the word once explained that when a bee stings once, it loses its second sting, so it becomes harmless after the first sting. All it can do is buzz around you and scare you but this time you know that it is not going to harm you. Likewise Jesus took that sting of death for us so it is not going to affect us anymore nor scare us. Death can only buzz around us but it is powerless to hurt us. So we see another reason to thank Him for His victory over death. As in 1 Corinth 15:55 and 56, “Where O death is your victory? where O death is your sting?”.

You can find so many reasons to thank the Lord. Its a never ending list.
Praise the Lord !!! Blessings Jemima

title.rendered: Shackled Feet on the Move by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them. 26 And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one’s bands were loosed.”  (Acts 16:25 – 26)

Have you ever lost the use of your legs?  I recall a time when I was on crutches temporarily from a martial injury.  However, maybe you know someone that has permanently lost the use of their legs, or perhaps that is part of your story.

Paul and Silas were preaching the Gospel on Philippi, and in the midst of their preaching a demoniac girl began to interrupt their preaching.  Paul cast the demon out of the girl which, but her masters were livid, as the girl brought them much financial gain through her demonic soothsaying which was forbidden by God (Lev. 19:31; 20:6).  When her master brought Paul and Silas before the magistrates, they charge that was placed upon them was not, casting out a demonic spirit, but rather they said these men “teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans (v. 19-21).”  Paul and Silas are beaten with rods, and their feet were placed in stocks (a device for publicly punishing offenders consisting of a wooden frame with holes in which the feet or feet and hands can be locked (Merriam-Webster’s collegiate dictionary).  Paul wrote in Eph 6:15, “And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace…,” concerning the armor of God, and in Rom. 10:15, “How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!”  Paul and Silas sat in prison with their physical feet causing immobility, however the guards could not shackle the gospel shoes of peace, their beautiful feet, from preaching the gospel.

“At midnight they sang praises to God and the prisoners heard them (v. 25).”  The world cannot stop the message of the Gospel from going forth when the Christian walks in the gospel shoes of peace.  I believe the praises Paul and Silas sang to the Lord, was their way of having an open – air gospel meeting to which not only they praise God, but they also preached the gospel.  These were obedient and educated men, knowing full well they were doing with a captive audience (no pun intended) within the sound of their voice.  Notice they were not “sensitive” to the midnight hour when perhaps many would have wanted to sleep.  The world is asleep in their sins loving the darkness, having feet in the bondage stocks of their sins.  Too many Christians wait for the “right time” to share the gospel, usually waiting until the sinner asks the Christian about their faith, which is rare at best.  I was told to stop preaching one time when on a NYC train, because a women proclaimed that I was stealing her right to read.  Notice this not what Paul and Silas did, they let their voice be heard at the midnight hour even if perhaps it was “inconvenient” for the prisoners who were perhaps tired and weary.  There are too many stationary soldiers that feel that any evangelistic movement is too painful for them.  If they are not seeing to win the lost, they are not advancing ground for God’s Kingdom. This is the will of Satan, to keep Christians busy, hesitant, and shackled to anything that will hinder them from using their evangelistic feet to go into the enemy’s camp and warn Satan’s prisoners of God’s wrath.  Matthew 25, in the parable of the virgins (which speaks about true and false conversions), the bridegroom (Jesus) came at a time no one expected, AT MIDNIGHT!  Perhaps this was an inconvenient time for the virgins; however the Lord will come when he chooses.  Paul wrote, “Preach the Word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage—with great patience and careful instruction (2 Tim 4:2).  Paul and Silas preached at midnight, the bridegroom returned at midnight. 

Let’s speak the Word of God to the prisoners (unsaved) held captive in bondage of their sins at this midnight hour, because we don’t know when that person will die, and we surly do not know when the Lord will return.  Be faithful, be obedient, even though Satan may try to shackle our feet with fear, business, tolerance, hesitant, etc…, walk in the boldness and obedience of the Lord Jesus, and “Go into all the world and preach the good news to every creature!”   

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: After This I Want My Stuff Back, Part 5

content.rendered:
Good morning,
1Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from them; David recovered all”.

Does it get on your skin when the you see how the enemy takes your family, friends, young people captive, I mean spiritually?. They should be growing in the Lord only to find the god of this world has held them captive? We fight the enemy of the flesh who wants or has stolen away our purity, discerning spirit, joy, strength, peace, blessings from the Lord. It’s time to give the enemy these five D’s (Your Double Dealing Days are Done Devil).

1Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from them; David recovered all”. David mastered the seven strategies I had mentioned earlier and he knew that if he was going to get back anything, it wasn’t going to be through pleading but by applying force. 2Tim 1:7, “For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind“. Again he could not recover all without first defeating the enemy. If you are going to go to a strong man’s house to take away stuff, you have to bind him first before taking anything from his house. No recovery without fighting and binding the enemy first otherwise I believe we will be fighting a loosing battle.

Thank God for the equipping and letting us know that our weapons are mighty through Him to the pulling down of strong holds. We’ve wept for a while, let the weeping now cease. We have inquired of the Lord, let the good steps of righteous man be ordered by of the Lord. Not in our own strength we have come but in His name. By God’s grace, He will help us recover all and then some. By faith, God will give us double for all the trouble the devil caused us.

Of all I desire to recover are lost souls, I have my friends and family members who the god of this world has held them captive, I desire the boldness from above to fight for them through prayers and step out and rescue them with gospel.  The devil has put so much fear in our lives that we have found it easy to tell God about men and hard to tell men about God. May the passion that David had to pursue the enemy recover all be our passion too.

David and his men recovered everything they had lost from wives to children to possessions, none was missing. All I’m saying is, we need our stuff back. Someone may help you fight but they will not fight for you. I’m tired of the enemy taking away what does not belong to him and leaving me with what belongs to him. When will we say enough is enough, stop crying over what we lost and instead execute God’s word?. Health, purity, righteousness, hope, peace, confidence, trust, love, unity, innocence, money, children, husbands, wives, brothers, sisters need recovery through His word. Know who you are in Christ, John 1:12, “Be sober, be vigilant, 1Peter 5:8, Submit to God’s authority, James 4:7,  understand that the weapons are not fleshly weapons, 2Corithians 10:4, “, get equipped with the word, Hebrews 4:12, put on the war gears, Ephesians 6:11, and be ready to fight, Mark 16:17 , After this I want my stuff back

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: After This I Want My Stuff Back, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,
1Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from them; David recovered all”

In part three we see David exercising strategies to be able to win the enemy in his game. Yesterday we saw how he knew who he was in Christ and also how he identified who the enemy was when no one else could

1Samuel 30:8, “And David inquired (asked)  the Lord, saying, shall I pursue after this troop? Shall I overtake them? And He Answered him, pursue: for thou shall overtake them, and without fail recover all”. Another strategy for him to win this battle was to involve God,  submitted God’s authority and leading, James 4:7, “Submit yourselves therefore to God, resist the devil and he will flee from you”. I don’t see any way someone can win a battle without involving the One who was who is and is to come. He knows the enemy in and out and so when we submit to His Lordship as He is the captain of host, He will direct us in the right path. As for David, he had had come to the chief of the armed forces seeking approval, direction and help to fight the enemy. He sought the Lord after calming himself, encouraging himself and his soldiers.

1Samuel 30:9, “So David went, he and his six hundred men that were with him…” How is it that men who wanted to stone David were ready to go with him to pursue the enemy under his leadership? Gentleness in handling a tough situation, then turning around to build them up. Upon encouraging himself in the Lord, he became sober and vigilant under the guidance and permission of God which is an indication of victory. Calling those things which are not as though they were because the one who sends you and I has already promised victory. David wasn’t going in his might, he was going under the power of HIS might with an already guaranteed victory. Though the weapons they had were natural, they understood the victory was in the spiritual level. His weapons were mighty through God to destroy the enemy. David left with 600 men to win a battle, 200 became weary and could not advance to the battle field. David did not get discouraged for his hope was built on nothing less than the Lord. He had been guaranteed victory with less soldiers or more.

David and his men could not leave even one man behind for they were men on a mission. We have no need to spare an enemy when we have the call to destroy; we are out to bruise his head for we are at war with the enemy. 1Samuel 30:17, “Then David attacked them from twilight until the evening of the next day. Not a man of them escaped, except four hundred young men who rode on camels and fled” There is a quote that Shaka Zulu made, “Strike an enemy once and for all. Let him cease to exist as a tribe or he will live to fly in your throat again” David had mission was to destroy the enemy just like the enemy had a mission to destroy him too.

The battle might not last just a few minutes or hours, it could last days, months, years but there is no retreat and no surrender. You may sense promise of victory but haven’t seen it come to pass yet, don’t stop fighting the battle. You may look like you are failing but keep God’s word in the back of your mind that no matter what happens, you the outcome is in His hands. This is like taking an exam paper you have already passed, though the exam may be tough and complicated, just knowing that you have an “A” will make you do it anyway. To pass means taking it as opposed to passing because you have the answers. We are not fighting a loosing battle if our weapons are mighty through God and if God has asked us to fight who can be against us. To continue…
Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: After This I want My Stuff Back, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,
1Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from them; David recovered all”

1Samuel 30:4, “So David and the people who were with him lifted up their voices and wept, until they had no more power to weep”. A few years back thieves broke into our house when no one was home and cleaned out our living room. Upon coming home and finding out what had happened, I couldn’t help but weep until there was no more strength left in me. What my parents had worked for for years was gone in less than one hour. The blessing of hard work had gone like that. This kind of news will put you into tears and that is okay for it reminds you of the fact that you are flesh and blood and you have feelings. Jesus wept at Lazarus grave but the weeping was just for a season. Just like David, he lost someone dear to his heat, this resulted into weeping.

1Samuel 30:6, “Now David was greatly distressed, for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved… But David strengthened himself in the Lord his God“. As per what I indicated in part one, our enemy is not flesh and blood and if we don’t identify the real enemy, we are in trouble. How many families have been divided because they never identified the real enemy? here are men who had stood with David all through, in the midst of tough situation all of a sudden David become their enemy. Think about it, David already had enough enemies, Saul had driven him from his country, the Philistines had driven him from their camp, the Amalekites had plundered his city, his wives were taken prisoners, and now, to complete his woe, his own familiar friends, in whom he trusted, whom he had sheltered, and who did eat of his bread, instead of sympathizing with him and offering him any relief, lifted up the heel against him and threatened to stone him. Why him any way? the accusations could have come in this form, “It’s because of you David we lost everything, if we had not gone from here, none of this could have happened”, “you tricked us, you betrayed us”. Instead of comforting David and speaking life into him and telling him that they are there for him, or even asking him what they should do, all they thought about under distress and confusion was to stone David. Under this kind of pressure in situations, it is very possible to make silly mistakes to be regretted at a later time.

Under distress, calm yourself down. Weep if you must but don’t make hasty decisions and actions until you have pulled yourself back together. David realized he could not rely on his men to encourage him. But David strengthened (encouraged) himself in the Lord his God. I ought to be my best encourager because I do it in the Lord and you too should be if you are not. Yes people can come and encourage you, but if a ground of encouragement is not laid by you, whatever they give you might not last for long. David could not be ready for the next step until he encouraged himself. I said this in part one as one of strategies to win the battle know who you are in Christ, John 1:12, “As many as received Him, to them gave ye the power to become the sons of God”. Knowing who you are in Christ like David allows you to put your trust in Him and not man. Psalm 118:8, “It is better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man..”. Man whom you could count on will fail you, God will not. People change their minds and opinions about men but God is steadfast. I believe that instead of him getting Hysterical, he became Historical. By that I mean, he may have remembered the many things God had delivered him from and that became his encouragement. I pray that we will not be hysterical but historical in dealing with tough situations that we may be encouraged. To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: After This I Want My Stuff Back, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning, 

1Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from  them; David recovered all”

 From the time David was crowned king, he become a target. He killed Goliath, fought many wars, Saul plan was to kill him. Crowned to be the next king yet running for his life as a fugitive for the next 17 years before he makes it to the throne.  The moment we get saved and chosen, automatically you and I qualify for attacks. The first time I came to Christ I thought that would mark the end of my troubles only to be a target to the enemy. We do people injustice when we tell them that when they come to Jesus all their troubles will be gone. Trials, temptations and tribulation hits a true believer for sure. David tells us in Psalms 34:19, “Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord delivers him from them all”. Knowing this, I need to remember that many are the battles that I should be aware of and be prepared for and the Lord will help me through it.

In the book of 1Samuel 30, David and his strong men had just come back home from a battle field. They went to help the Philistines to fight Saul’s kingdom. They knew how David by God’s help defeated. The Philistines were afraid that David might end up helping the Israelites and fight them back. With that rejection, they came back home. Coming home, they found that an enemy had invaded Ziklag where David, his men and families had camped. If you think the enemy is not afraid of you (because of God in you), how come he shows up when you are not there? I’m not talking about being physically absence but spiritually absence. He has flesh under control without the Spirit of God present. The bible says that after Satan tried to tempt Jesus three times and failed, he left Him for a season. When you talk about for a season, that means that he is bound to come back. This is where putting on the armor of God comes in for you are always prepared for attack.

Remember the mission of the enemy? 1Samuel 30:1, “…that the Amalekites had invaded … Ziklag, attacked Ziklag and burned it with fire vs. 2 and had taken captive the women and those who were there, from small to great“. We see stealing and destruction. Men who were suppose to be there their families were not there to protect when they were needed and with that the enemy attacked. Even with us today at times when we should be aware of what the enemy is doing, we are not there spiritually to fight. Talk about what has been lost, health, purity, righteousness, hope, peace, confidence, trust, love, unity, innocence, money and you name it. Parents are under attack so are the children, husbands, wives, brothers, sisters, churches, jobs. Think about the time you had something good and now you don’t. Wondering what happened to it? well it was stolen away from you while you were not there spiritually to do something about it..

Know that you have changed sides no longer on the devil’s side the reason you are such a great target.  Many are our afflictions the bible tells us. Someone is under major attacks right now and you feel like giving up and dying. You feel like this Christianity thing is not what you expected it to be. Let this be a word of encouragement to you, you are a threat to the devil, why? because he knows God has set you up as a seed planted that will provide fruits to many. The enemy tried to kill Jesus when He was born. He knew the Jesus‘ destiny, a seed that God would use to change the world and so are you. Keep fighting the good fight of a soldier. To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: After This I Want My Stuff Back, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Samuel 30:1-31, “So David recovered all that the Amalekites had carried away, and David rescued his two wives. And nothing of theirs was lacking, either small or great, sons or daughters, spoil or anything which they had taken from them; David recovered all”

Before the fall, man had no enemy for there was a continuous fellowship between God and man. God supplied man with everything he needed. In the garden of Eden, there was only one tree in the middle of the garden they were not to touch. This tree had good looking fruits but the instructions were clear not to touch it. It’s interesting how the forbidden fruit always looks attractive and tempting but it’s a death trap. Instructions not to touch it preceded with an explanation, so our first parents were not ignorant of this particular tree. After the fall of man, God set enmity between the seed of man and the serpent, that lying old devil. Genesis 3:15, “And I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your seed and her seed; He shall bruise your head, And you shall bruise His heel“. We are the result of the seed of the woman and there is an enmity between us and the devil. I wish I could tell you have no enemies but that will be a lie because after the fall of man, we began to have enemies. The bible also says that a friend of the world is God’s enemy.

Here we have an enemy but the question is, what is the mission of the enemy? John 10:10, “The thief does not come but except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy…” These are the three main missions of the devil we need to be aware of. He is not coming to be a friend, he may start on a friendship level but know that He is coming to kill, steal and destroy. The bible says again that he appears as the angel of light. I expect him to appear in any form or size but I need to be aware of his presence. I believe that without knowing you have an enemy and without knowing his mission, you are bound to be take to be kicked around.

Not only do we know we have an enemy, we also have to know who our enemy is, 2 Corinthians 10:3, “Though we walk in the flesh, we war not after the flesh”, Ephesians 6:12, “For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places”. Our enemy is not flesh and blood meaning people but something else greater than people. Understand that the enemy is powerful and cannot be under estimated. The word says we wrestle against principalities, powers, rulers, spiritual wickedness, where? in high places. He is not settled in hell, he has his dwelling in the high places. He is roaming throughout the earth with the aim to fulfill his mission. 1 Peter 5:8, “… your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour“

So we know we have an enemy, we have identified his mission, we’ve ruled out that our enemy is not flesh and blood but a powerful being who is every where looking for souls. Now we need to understand what our weapons are because there is no way you are going to escape encountering with him. What is needed to win the devil in his war game, 1. know who you are in Christ, John 1:12, “As many as received Him, to them gave ye the power to become the sons of God”, 2.If you know who you are, you will be 1 Peter 5:8, “Be sober, be vigilant“, 3. Submit to God’s authority, James 4:7, “Submit yourselves therefore to God, resist the devil and he will flee”, 4.understand that the weapons are not fleshly weapons, they are prayer weapons, 2 Corinthians 10:4, “The weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God to the pulling down strong holds”, 5. Equip yourself with God’s word, Hebrews 4:12, “The word of the Lord is living and powerful, sharper than double edged sword…”, 6. Put on the war gears, Ephesians 6:11, “Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand the whiles of the devil” and 7. Be ready to fight, Mark 16:17, “… in My name they shall cast out devils…”

We have an enemy constantly on our case and it’s because we have allowed him so much to push us around and terrorize us. He has stepped into our camp and taken away what God bestowed upon us and we just let him do it. Because of that we are no threat and match to him ’cause he’s got us where he wants us. He comes to us and we tell me, “go a head and take what you want”. There are times God will not fight for us, then there are times He will equip us to fight the battle, this is what we are going to be sharing on. I first needed to bring some things to light about the devil, his mission, where the enmity started from, how we are tied to it and how we will over come. The bible says in 1 John 5:4, “He that is born of God overcomes the world and this is the victory that overcomes the world even our faith”. To continue!!!

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Jesus then added “I tell you the truth, you will see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man” in John 1 : 51. How can angels descend and ascend ” ON THE SON OF MAN”

We can see how this happened to a person in a dream, running away due to fear of death, in a very tensed state, Jacob, tired fell asleep on the way and had a dream. Bible states in Genesis 28 : 12 “He had a dream in which he saw a stairway/ladder resting on the earth, with it’s top reaching heaven, and the angels of God were ascending and descending on it. Let’s meditate on this STAIRWAY /ladder…When a person has to climb or get onto a position higher than himself, he definitely needs something, a boost, in this case a ladder needed. A ladder comprises of steps, which have to be climbed one at a time, to reach the top of the ladder.
Our Lord Jesus Himself is the ladder, (Heaven is his throne and earth is His footstool) who came down from heaven to this earth. As He rightly said “I am the way , the truth, and the life” , so only through Him can we reach our destination -heaven.. The seven sayings on the cross are like seven steps of the ladder to reach our heavenly abode…First step being forgiveness, without which our prayer of repentance and faith in God, will not reach God. Secondly after forgiving our trespassers, showing way to salvation and the process to enter the eternal kingdom. Thirdly to be considerate to our fellow beings, loving our neighbors as ourselves. Fourth step is to always have thirst for the lost souls /dying world. Fifth always remembering the pain when Jesus was forsaken by the Father as He was deemed to be a sinner for each one of us. Sixth step is finishing the task which we have been sent to earth for/ complete the mission. Lastly we need to learn to commit ourselves into His mighty and trustworthy Arms …

Last but not the least, the support which the ladder gives while a person is in the process of climbing is so very comforting. Since the ladder is properly fixed, we can trust it and hold firmly to it so that we will not fear falling, failing or drifting away. “Let us hold firmly to the faith we profess” Yes, once we make an attempt to start the journey in Jesus, climbing this ladder, Holy Spirit of God will help us reach our God, the Father.

Though we are like Jacob running away from fearful circumstances/tough situations in life , we can still look to Jesus, who is our only HOPE -our way for eternal happiness

In Christ
Sis Sarah

Thanks,
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning
Matthew 17:5, “…This is My beloved Son, ﻿ ﻿in whom I am well pleased”
Parents love to brag about their children especially when they are doing well. I have seen bumper stickers that says “proud parent of …”, I know of no parent who would brag about their stubborn, rebellious, ungrateful, un loving, unforgiving child. They love them for sure, they just don’t have something in their lives to brag about. Like I said before in my previous devotion, parents take pride in their children when they honor them by how they live their lives.

Imagine our Heavenly Father bragging about His Son and not just His Son but His beloved Son. As Jesus was getting baptized, the Holy Spirit descended on Him in form of a dove and God spoke, Matthew 3:17, and said, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased”, then just before Jesus is taken away to suffer and be crucified, a voice comes from heaven again to three His disciples Peter, James and John and we hear it again, Matthew 17:5, “…This is My beloved Son, ﻿in whom I am well pleased”. The Son pleased the Father by representing Him here on earth and doing what the Father sent Him to do. I don’t hear Him talk about Adam the same way. That is why Adam was God’s son, Jesus was(is) His only begotten Beloved Son. He brought Glory and Honor to the Father. He did that which pleased the Father in deed, thought and word.

Let’s take a few lessons from a blessed father because of his son. If you remember Joseph in Genesis, he was a slave in Egypt after being sold by his brothers. After many years, he became the ruler of all Egypt (like a prime minister), he encounters with his brothers who sold him, forgives them, he asks for his father well being, they tell him everything about his father is doing. The father gets the news. Here are my points in relation to Jacob and his son Joseph.

1. Christian fathers spirits are revived and stay revived when they know their children are spiritually alive (saved) Proverbs 23:24, “The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice…” Read how Joseph’s living made an impact in Jacob’s life, Genesis 45:27, “But when they told him all the words which Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the carts which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit ﻿of Jacob their father revived. ﻿28﻿ Then Israel said, “It is enough. Joseph my son is still alive….” .. It was hard for my parents to see their son (me) not saved while the rest of my family was, but when I became a Christian, I could tell their spirit was revived, their son who was once dead in sin, was alive in Christ.

2. Fathers take pride in knowing their children are blessed by God in every aspect of their lives (spiritually, economically, health wise, socially, emotionally etc). Hard work, diligence, striving to maintain a good name blesses the Father.

3. Fathers delight in knowing their children will be a blessing to each other and to him. In other words, a father never desires division in the family. It’s a blessing for a father to see his children work out things he has taught them. Jacob did not tell Joseph to forgive his brothers, Joseph saw everything through the eyes of God, forgave them and blessed them. Genesis 46: 11 And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded. 12 And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father’s household, with bread, according﻿ to their families”

4. Fathers take pride in respect from those who have encountered with their children. Genesis 47:7 Then Joseph brought in his father Jacob and set him before Pharaoh; and Jacob blessed Pharaoh. 8 Pharaoh said to Jacob, “How old are you?” 9 And Jacob said to Pharaoh, “The days of the years of my pilgrimage are one hundred and thirty years; few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, and they have not attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.” 10 So Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from before Pharaoh. I believe that through the life of Joseph, Pharaoh the king had tremendous respect for Jacob though he had just met him and Jacob blessed the king.

Jesus brought honor to His father, so was Joseph and so should we today. I want my father to take pride in my salvation, delight in God’s favor and blessing upon my life, be blessed through God’s blessing in my life, blessed by the unity among us his children and respect from those I have encountered with because I represented him well. What is your prayer?

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: And the Heavens were Opened 2 – by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

But being ﻿﻿full of the Holy Spirit, he ﻿gazed intently into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing ﻿at the right hand of God; and he said, “Behold, I see the ﻿a﻿heavens opened up and ﻿b﻿the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”  But they cried out with a loud voice, and covered their ears and rushed at him with one impulse.” (Acts 7:55 – 57)

Have you ever participated in a protest, or picketed outside with signs for a cause?  I recall when I was in middle school; the school was going to fire one of our teachers who we all loved.  Some of the students organized a walkout, and most of the students emptied out of the school and rallied at the football field bleachers.  The news reporters showed up and began interviewing students.  We stood up for a teacher because we cared deeply for her.  How much more should you and I as Christians stand up for Jesus Christ, the One who died for our salvation.

In Acts 7, we read the account of Stephen, one of the deacons in the church which was chosen (Acts 6) to help widows that were being overlooked in ﻿﻿the daily serving of food, about to be stoned for Christ.  Stephen preaches the history of Israel to the Sanhedrin, and then brings God’s Law against them.  Stephen said, “Ye stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do you. 52 Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? And they have slain them which showed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers: 53 Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept it.”   Wow, I bet your pastor never preached like that in church!  The Sanhedrin were cut to the heart (7:54) and they stopped (covered) their ears, and rushed him to kill him.  Recall Acts 1:8 where Luke wrote the words of Jesus to the disciples, “8 But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.”  Are you a witness for Christ?  The actual word witnesses in Acts 1:8 is not the word for one that merely proclaims God’s Word, but the word is actually MARTYR.  Stephen was being a witness for Jesus, one willing to die for his savior.  Jesus said that Stephen would be in the category of one that was blessed, “Blessed are ye, when men shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake. 12 Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.”  Every one reads about Jesus’ position to God in the Bible it read that Jesus is sitting at the right hand of God (Matthew 26:64, Mark 14:62, Heb. 10:12), however in this account of Stephen as he is being a martyr witnesses, when he sees the heaven open, he doesn’t see Jesus sitting at the right hand of God but standing at the right hand of God.  Stephen was standing for his Savior because he so loved Jesus.  He shared the truth no matter who it offended wanting all to be saved.  Stephen stood for Jesus, and Jesus therefore stood for Stephen, and I believe was going to give Stephen a standing ovation when he entered into the halls of heaven.  In what way to you stand for Jesus, or do you shy away, act ashamed toward Him around others.  The heavens opened for Stephens, if that were you would the heavens have opened, or would you have recanted to save your life? 

 Until the nets are filled…
Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 30:11, “11 There is a generation that curses its father, And does not bless its mother..” .

As we shared on honoring our parents, today I will take the some little time to share on blessing the mothers. Hope to share on blessing on the fathers too.

Everyone has a story to tell about their mothers and everyone will agree with me that our mothers have played key roles in who we are today and we ought to thank and bless them. In this age, it’s hard to hear children regardless of their age sitting down to think about how God through their mothers have played huge part in their upbringing. Yes they were not perfect but they gave all. Let’s see some of the mothers in the bible.

Moses’ mother Jochebed hid him when there was a decree in Egypt that all new male born children were to be killed. In the process of killing all boys, Jochebed had a sense that God had a plan for her son and with the wisdom she had, she hid the son in a place where he could be found and not harmed. God used Moses later mightily. Hannah prayed for a son when no one else could understand the longing and the desire of her heart. She knew her desires could only be met by God, so year after year she prayed. Finally she prayed a prayer that caused God to step into her situation and bless her. Her prayer was that God would bless her with a son and she would give him back to God. Samuel becomes a Prophet unto the Lord. God used him mightily. How can we forget Elizabeth the mother of John the Baptist, who was born to her in her old age, John became the voice in the wilderness preparing the way for the Lord. God used him mightily. Mary the mother of Jesus, a young woman yet pregnant with destiny, willing to take a stand to do that which she was not good at, raising up the Son of God who later died on the cross for the sins of the world. There are many more mothers in the bible I could talk about like Eunice the mother of Timothy, Samson’s mother, Isaac’s mother, Joseph’s mother and many more. God entrusted these mothers with these children and you can see that each of them raised their children in the fear and the knowledge of God, advising, protecting, praying for them in advance, dedicating them back to God and standing by them through thick and thin. Raising these children was not an easy task and so was raising each of us.

I believe these men learnt to bless their mothers. Solomon took seriously the lessons on ho to handle parents and the book of Proverbs is full of them. This is what He is saying about a virtuous woman, Proverbs 31:28, “Her children rise up and call her blessed; … ” 29″Many daughters have done well, But you excel them all.” Just in America, over 40 million babies have been aborted since abortion was legalized in 1973, thank God my mom did not abort me. She may have not known how I would turn out to be but she trusted God with me and raised me in spite of. Those days dad had to be a way to work and provide for the family, mom took the responsibility of instilling what dad had taught. I have deep honor and gratitude for my mom and I bless her. She may have not been perfect but she gave it all. I wish I was in a position to do everything for her to make her comfortable. Do you know that many have aborted the leaders of tomorrow, thank God these women in the bible did not abort.

How does this apply to us today, many times children forget the sacrifices their mothers have made for them over the years. Some even concentrate on what their mothers should have done better. It started long time ago and that is why Proverbs 30:11, “there is a generation that does not bless their mother”. Blessings are powerful and our mother’s honor is in us blessing them. I don’t need to wait for mother’s day to bless mom. You might say your mother does not deserve it, it’s not all about deserving, it’s about honoring God by blessing your mother through prayers, support, encouragement, time, living a life pleasing to God cause that is how she raised you, doing things that will not shame her, not causing her to worry and panic in this time of her life. She has done the sacrifice, let her now sit and enjoy the fruits of her labor.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning
Exodus 20:12, “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long upon the land which the LORD your God is giving you”.

I find it fascinating how God outlined the 10 commandments, He started with commandments in relation to Him, then right after that, He gives one that relates to parent(s) and then the rest that relates to others. Right where it’s placed gives me an indication how vital it is right after Him first. On top of the commandment that relates to parent(s), He adds an element of a promise and a threat (will explain the threat part). Take a close look at the 5th commandment in Exodus 20:12, “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long upon the land which the LORD your God is giving you”.

We have a generation rebellious towards parent(s) to which extends right into rebellion towards authorities and against the law. Matthew Henry puts it this way, “a generation that is such as abusive to their parent(s), give them bad language and wish them ill, call them bad names and actually injure them. There is a generation of such; young men of that dark character commonly herd together, and irritate one another against their parent(s)” This has kicked out the 5th commandment or has reserved it to only honoring fathers and mothers when they deserve which is contrary to the commandment. Honor means to prize highly, to show respect to exalt. No parent will ever be good enough to deserve an honor. God has put the commandment to by pass what they don’t deserve to what He has commanded. I believe God has put it there primarily for children to honor the position rather than the person and here is why. I believe that the moment a child honors the position of a parent, there will be no problem honoring the parent. It doesn’t matter how good or bad a parent has been or is, they still should receive the honor because God says so, period.

Part of the commandment completes with this line, “…that your days may be long upon the land which the LORD your God is giving you”, this is the promise; the threat I mentioned earlier is the opposite of the promise. If children will not honor, obey, respect their parent(s), their days will not be long on the face of the earth. Children will be honoring God by honoring their parent(s). Parent(s) take pride in being honored by their children. If children regardless of the age would understand the tremendous sacrifices the parent(s) have made for them to be where they are today, they would have great respect and admiration for their parent(s). The cost of raising a child is not cheap, parent(s) have put aside some of their great dreams to give their children the best life they can afford, loving them, caring for them even when children feel the parent(s) never understand or are standing on their way of happiness. I have learnt that parent(s) know their children very well. They know their strengths and their weakness. They know what to allow and what to restrain. For the older kids (for we will always be children in the eyes of our parent(s) regardless of our age), their wisdom and advise can play big part in our lives. I believe God blesses children who honor their parent(s) through respect, heading to their advise, their counsel, helping them in whichever way to make their lives comfortable as they get older

Listen to Jesus addressing this commandment, Matthew 15:3, “And why do you, by your traditions, violate the direct commandments of God? 4 For instance, God says, ‘Honor your father and mother,’﻿ and ‘Anyone who speaks disrespectfully of father or mother must be put to death.’﻿﻿ 5 But you say it is all right for people to say to their parent(s), ‘Sorry, I can’t help you. For I have vowed to give to God what I would have given to you.’ 6 In this way, you say they don’t need to honor their parent(s).﻿﻿ And so you cancel the word of God for the sake of your own tradition. (NLT). The Pharisees and the teachers of the law were so concerned about traditions they made law but could not take time to teach God’s law to their children like honoring their parent(s).

I believe the whole of children’s duty to their parent(s) is included in this of honoring them, which is the spring and foundation of all the rest, Our Savior here supposes it to mean the duty of children’s maintaining their parent(s), and ministering to their needs, if there be occasion, and being every way serviceable to their comfort. Would you say you have truly honored you parent(s)? have you set up an example to your children by showing your honor to your parent(s), may you share this message with your children too. To continue under a different title.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: And the Heavens were Opened 1 – by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Peter went up on the housetop to pray, about 5the sixth hour. 10 Then he became very hungry and wanted to eat; but while they made ready, he fell into a trance 11 and I saw heaven opened and an object like a great sheet bound at the four corners, descending to him and let down to the earth. 12 In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air. 13 And a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.” (Acts 10:10-13)

The next time you see someone using a cell phone, look at the waves that are sent to the cell phone towers.  Perhaps you can describe the waves that go from a remote control to a radio, television, video game system, etc….  Perhaps you are thinking to yourself, “I cannot see these things with my eyes, but they are surely real waves flying through the air.  One must admit that our sight is certainly limited.  Imagine if you could gaze just for a moment into the spiritual realm.  Would you want to do such a thing?  I imagine that it would depend on if you were on the Lord’s side or the Devil’s side.   1Ki 18:21 Elijah went before the people and said, “How long will you waver between two opinions? If the LORD is God, follow Him; but if Baal is God, follow him. But the people said nothing.”  Who do you follow?  Peter went up onto the roof to pray at 12:00 noon, a non-traditional time to seek the Lord.  Peter feel asleep on that roof, at which time God opened the heaven to allow Peter to see something that he could not see with his natural sight.  Peter had refused to bring the gospel to the Gentiles (non – Jews) because of the prejudice in his heart but seeing an open heaven would change Peter.  What was it that Peter actually saw?  Peter sees “an object like a great sheet bound at the four corners, descending to him and let down to the earth. 12 In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air. 13 And a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”  Perhaps this seems like a strange way for God to communicate the prejudice in Peter’s heart.  Even Palestinian Jews most lenient in other regards kept kosher. Thus this vision would present a horrifying situation for any first-century Palestinian Jew (and the vast majority of foreign Jews as well): God commands Peter to eat all these unclean, forbidden creatures. Hungry he may be (10:10), but he is not that hungry! (The IVP Bible background commentary). 

God opened the heavens to expose Peter’s prejudice, as the Jews were called to be a light to the Gentiles, yet they failed to do so.  Peter was an Apostle, a leader, in the church, and the Lord would not allow Peter’s prejudice to flow downward.  The heaven’s opened to allow Peter to gain a Heavenly perspective on his issue, because our ways and thoughts are not naturally like the Lord’s (Isaiah 55:8-9), as His are higher then ours.  Ultimately God opened the heavens for Peter, to change his perspective, and therefore his ways, and the gospel would go forth to the Gentiles.  Is there any prejudice in your heart toward any people group?  We are one race, the human race (Acts 17:26), and if any man hates his brother he is a murder (1 John 3:1).  The heaven’s were opened for Peter, so the gospel would reach Gentiles  (you and I, if you are non-Jewish).  God opened the heavens for His Word to go forth, now go and carry it as you were commanded.      

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: A Man In The Making, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Exodus 3:1-12, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consume”

﻿Exodus 3:6﻿ Moreover He said, ﻿“I am the God of your father—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for ﻿he was afraid to look upon God”. This was a solemn declaration God made of his name, by which he would be known to Moses: “I am the God of thy father”, He lets him know that it is God who speaks to him, to engage his reverence and attention, his faith and obedience; for this is enough to command all these: I am the Lord. What was about to happen in the life of Moses had to be of God and had to be revealed to him.

Exodus 3:10, “Come now, therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh, and that you may bring My people, the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt”. As I had shared, a man in the making sees, desires, draws closer, gets a revelation of who God is, His heart and what God requires of that individual He has called. My next point, a man in the making will receive a calling in his life not based on background check but based on what God will make him/her be. God clearly announced His intention of fulfilling His promises to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob about the land of Palestine. He was fully aware of their plight in Egypt, and the time had now come for their REDEMPTION. To make this point clear, our salvation is not the end but the beginning of preparation to be used back in Egypt where we came from with the aim to seek and to save that which is held captive by the power of Pharaoh (sin). It’s scary return to where you came from but when you understand that someone’s life is at stake, you will cry out like Isaiah who said, “Here I am O Lord send me“. The qualification for this job is very simple, “I CAN’T”. When you say those words, you have just qualified yourself for the job.

A man in the making has someone very important backing him up, the presence of the One who is sending him. Exodus 3:12, “So He said, “I will certainly be with you. And this shall be a sign to you that I have sent you”. What a promise that wherever God sends any of us as His witnesses, He has promised to be with us Mathew 28:19, “Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost: vs. 20 Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you: and, lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world.”

Those who are safe would rather stay away from Egypt but when you get a glimpse of what is in the heart of God like Moses, you will move from the comfort zone to where He would lead you. You have found freedom in Christ, you have escaped the wrath to come, what about those still bound in ?. Someone said, “If you don’t care much about the salvation of the sinners, you are not saved yourself be sure of that“, (paraphrased), scary thought for me to. I am getting more desperate for souls still trapped in Egypt but I am scared silly of going back to be the deliverer God wants me to be. Thanks be to God, I am a man in the making. I have seen, desired, drew closer, had revelation of who He is, His heart and what He requires of me, he is equipping me, sending me and promising to be with me all the way. When was the last time you told someone about Jesus? how about, “Lord here I am send me“?

Pray to God today that He will cause you to be a man or woman in the making in readiness to the calling He already has for you. A calling for the lost is not for some but all believers. His desire is that no one perish and because of that He is sending us. If you are going to worship God, desire also to reach people for God. It’s easy to talk to God about people but hard to talk to people about God. A man/woman in the making is ready for change, are you?. Blessings Evans

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: A Man In The Making, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

 Exodus 3:1-12, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consume”

  

Angels are supernatural creatures that exist in the heavenlies serving as messengers from God and as protectors for His chosen people. In this case, the Angel of the Lord was a visible manifestation of God, possibly the preincarnate Christ. The flame of fire was the glory of God’s presence, the Shekinah, which transformed everything and everyone it touched. This fascinated Moses that he drew closer to see. Exodus 3:3, “And Moses said, “I will now turn aside and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt“. As God draws you out, His drawing creates a thirst  in you to want to know more, and the more you draw closer, the more He shows you what later becomes the desires of your heart.

 

First point, I have learnt that even the desire to worship and serve the Lord is not my own but His, He plants it there . John 6:44, says, “No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him,..”. Had the Lord not drawn Moses through the burning bush, he would have not seen it.  Second point, God came to where Moses was. God came to Moses through the commonplace, which becomes special and holy when touched by God. Spontaneous combustion was not unusual in the desert, but a non consuming flame was an extraordinary and commanding event. God had to come to us to save us.

 

Moses desired to come closer and explore this magnificent sight not knowing what to expect. This is what I call beginning in the flesh not really knowing what awaits you or knowing who is behind this awesome sight.. Exodus 3:4, “And when the Lord saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said here I am“. Is it possible the Lord could show us something only  for us not show any sign of interest? We get used to every day’s life, get comfortable and anyone who might want to disrupt our comfort is someone we want to distance ourselves from. Just comfortable coming to church to worship,  that’s about it, not involved in any ministry, not reaching the lost who are still in Egypt under bondage because you and I are safe in the land of the Medianites where God has appeared to these people and to us many times. He turned to see and God called him out.

 

 A man in the making is a man who sees, desires, draws closer to see clearly what is there, if you watch closely through each step, you will find that God is in control of every step, He is the  One that draws.

 

Exodus 3:5 “Then He said, “Do not draw near this place. ﻿Take your sandals off your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.” I believe the first thing God taught Moses was His nature, His Holiness right before introducing Himself. The ground was holy because God who is Holy was present in it. This is also an indication that where God’s presence is, He makes that ground holy. I can now understand why born again Christians can be called holy,  the God lives in them is holy. Wow. A man in the making learns that God is holy and therefore comes in reverence in His presence.  To continue

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: A Man In The Making, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Exodus 3:1-12, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consume”

Always people want to be in comfortable places, comfortable home, job, ministry etc. When you talk about comfort, you will be referring to being set, nothing else to worry about, relaxed nothing further to pursue. I love comfort just like anybody else but I believe God brings us to certain levels that our comfort is disrupted not by what He tells us but by what He reveals to us to see.

It can be comforting to be in a place where you don’t have to deal with the past and that is the case with Moses. He was a special child to some capacity. In the times when Moses was born, the male born children to the Israelites were in danger as many of them were killed Moses being targeted too. He was hid to prevent him from being killed and was discovered by Pharaoh’s daughter who had him raised for her as her son. From almost being killed, to being raised by Pharaoh’s daughter as a prince. As a prince, he had everything he could have wanted. Later he discovers he was a child of the slave, he chooses to suffer with his people. Later he kills someone from the kingdom he served in as a prince to defend his people then ran for his life. Coming to the Medianites, he has a chance to get his life back together, no more enemies after him and the life is now too good to be true. Exodus 2:21, “Then Moses was content to live with the man (Jethro), and he gave Zipporah his daughter to Moses, and she bore him a son”. Moses was like the CEO of Jethro’s flock, he had a good wife, a healthy son,  and everything is very normal and okay. What else would you desire, well you have your job that may be paying well, good family, living in good neighborhood, good car, money in the bank account, healthy, what else to live for? Just like Moses, it’s easy to be content with this kind of life to forget where you came from.

Be very careful about what you pray for. Pray for God to use you and your life can be disrupted but the question is, are you ready for change? Exodus 3:1, “Now Moses was tending the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian. And he led the flock to the back of the desert, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God” I can’t say Moses had been to this other part of the dessert before but I believe God was setting him up for something extra ordinary. See the desert was an ordinary place, a place where you never saw the unusual. And out of the ordinary, . Exodus 3:2, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consume“. Sounds like the Lord was waiting for him, because out of the ordinary, Moses sees a burning bush and I can imagine him saying, “may be it’s one of the wild fire”, but what fascinated him was the fact that the bush was not being consumed. Anytime God begins to reveal Himself to us, we see things in the ordinary because He appears to us like that, the more you keep looking, you will begin to see that there is an extraordinary aspect of Him. All of a sudden Moses takes a closer look and he sees that bush is burning yes, but there is something about this bush, it’s not being consumed. He would have seen the bush and continued doing his stuff, and I know times we see something the Lord is doing and we conclude that it’s ordinary but look deeper, set your eyes upon Him, focus on Him, see far beyond the ordinary and natural and see the extra ordinary. See what you believe, don’t believe what you see!!!.. Moses comfort is about to be interrupted. To continue.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Let Go Of What You Are Holding Onto

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Numbers 12:1-16, “So Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “Please heal her, O God, I pray”
Just to add from Friday’s sharing before sharing today’s word, Yahweh’s revelation to Moses was unique. It was direct (plainly) and immediate (face to face); the prophets’ revelations were mediated forms. The clear lesson is that even prophets cannot presume to claim that their message is equal to that of the scriptures. Prophesies do not have the equal authority the bible has. Some prophesies have failed, God’s word has never failed.

Numbers 12:9, “So the anger of the Lord was aroused against them, and He departed, vs. 10. “….suddenly Miriam became leprous, as white as snow”. In the Old Testament brazen sin was often punished by God through leprosy. We can conclude that because of what they did, she was cursed. Another incident where I see God defending His servant after he was despised is in 2Samuel 6:14, “Then David danced before the Lord with all his might…., vs. 16, “Now as the ark of the Lord came into the City of David, Michal, Saul’s daughter, looked through a window and saw king David leaping and whirling before the Lord; and she despised him in her heart“. Michal was David’s wife and when she saw him worshipping the Lord, she despised him and the Lord was not happy about it why? in vs. 23, “Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no children to the day of her death”, the Lord shut her womb. It’s clear to me that the Lord cares about people who serve Him in spirit and in truth and because of that, Isaiah 54:17, “No weapon formed against you (them) shall prosper, and every tongue which rises against you in judgment, You shall condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, And their righteousness if from Me“, Says the Lord”. If you speak or despise someone else who is busy doing the work of God, it will not work out and if it is you who is doing what the Lord requires of you, anything that someone speaks against you or despises you will not work for the Lord will defend his own because their righteousness is from Him.

Numbers 12:11, “So Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord! please do not lay this sin on us, in which we have done foolishly and in which we have sinned“. Aaron and Miriam understood their need to ask for forgiveness over their rebellion. Tough to reconcile with someone you have wronged or has wronged you but that is where the healing is. James 5:16, “Confess your faults one to another, pray for one another that you may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much“. Instead of crying out to God to do something, they went to the one who they spoke against to reconcile with him that the healing could take place. Numbers 12:13, “So Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “Please heal her, O God, I pray“, same Moses spoken against is the same Moses who interceded for his sister’s healing. See the humble have mercy and compassion simply because they have received it at one time. They do not hold any grudges against people who wrong them. They are like Stephen who said, “Father forgive them, do not hold this against them” while being stoned to death, Jesus who said, “Father forgive them for they do not know what they are doing“. Can you and I reach to that place where we cry, “Father forgive them for doing it whether they meant to or not?”. The key is to release them, drop the charges and forgive. Forgive is to let go what you are holding onto. His prayer to God was his sister would be healed and God honored the cry of His servant. Surprisingly enough, there are family members who have been separated for years because of un-forgiveness, no talking to each other, no crossing each other’s paths but this is what Jesus said, Matthew 6:14 “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. vs. 15,”But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses“. Roots of bitterness and un-forgiveness will cause you to continue to have leprosy without being healed. Miriam had to confess and her brother had to cry out to God for the healing would take place. Thank God for men like Moses who forgives and let’s go of what he should have been holding on to. Blessings Evans
Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Numbers 12:1-16, “Now the man Moses was very humble (meek), more humble than all men who were on the face of the earth”

The game of life is always two sides, the opposing side and the proposing side. Not everyone will agree to one thing equally, there will be some who will oppose it. At times what is allowed to win is what the majority have voted for regardless of whether it’s good or bad. The vastly voted for will be used to silence what it’s voted against but when you know what is right, who will stand with you when they have voted against you?

Miriam and Aaron are Moses’ blood sister and brother. Aaron was appointed by God to be Moses’ spokes man and later a priest to which he was faithful in his calling. Miriam on the other hand helped keep in keeping Moses safe when a decree was passed that all male children would be killed and she protected her little brother. God did excellent things through the life of Moses. Let’s see what happened, in Numbers 12:1, “Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Ethiopian woman he had married“. What constitutes to what is good in your life, must it be approved by people for it to be good? The bible does not say they spoke with Moses or spoke about Moses or spoke for Moses, the bible says they spoke against Moses. They opposed his marriage to someone they did not like, from a tribe they did not approve of. I’m puzzled a bit because not at any time did Moses do anything that was against the will of God. If God did not want him to marry the Ethiopian woman, God would have rebuked Moses for his actions. At times people want to conform you into what they want you to be and when you don’t, they will speak against you. They don’t care much about what is good for you, they care about what is good to them for you. Everything Moses had done by God’s helped worked for them and the Israelites but now here is someone God brings into his life and these two were against it.

vs. 2, “So they said (Miriam and Aaron), “Has the Lord indeed spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us also? and the Lord heard it“. What would you say about this scripture? I will point out that according to them, Moses had not done the will of God and another point is that they were as good as Moses was because God had spoken to them too. They became arrogant as they bragged about how the Lord had also spoken to them too. Moses was chosen by God when he did not even see himself as a leader and then given a task bigger than him. He knew that if he was going to do a good job, God had to be on his side therefore he humbled himself. Point to make, Those who are meek do not fight back in life. They learn the secret of surrender and yielding to God as God fights for them“. Note that Moses did not try to defend himself, try to explain even how God might have spoken to him about his marriage, he did not even reason with them for God who had brought him this far was the only one who could defend him. Psalm 118:6, “The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do to me?”. Those who know their God will not fight things in the flesh, they will surrender it to God. Numbers 12:3, “Now the man Moses was very humble (meek), more humble than all men who were on the face of the earth“. With this line someone would think that Moses must have been a weak person to allow people to walk all over him but that is not what it says. The bible says that Moses was meek (humble) which is means HIS STRENGTH WAS UNDER CONTROL. His meekness allowed God to deal with him differently. The prophets, God spoke to them in visions and dreams but to Moses vs. 7, “Not so with My servant Moses; He is faithful in all My house, vs. 8. “I speak to him face to face, even plainly, and not in the dark sayings; And he sees the form of the Lord”. The manner of relationship God had with Moses was because of his meekness and faithfulness that God would speak to him face to face.

God was angry with Miriam and Aaron because of what they said against God’s servant Moses. He brought the three of them before Him and God defended Moses that day. Be careful not to speak things against God’s anointed, they may speak truth you may not want to hear. You might feel more qualified to do the job better than the anointed one but God who appointed them knew what He was doing. God has chosen them for a reason to accomplish things you and I could never accomplish. You don’t know what they have to go through to be where they are, not everyone is on their side but they are chosen. The meek ones doing God’s work not for personal gain. Some are under pressure because one day they will give an account to their leadership. TOUCH NOT GOD’S ANOINTED.

Thanks
Evans
