content.rendered:
Good morning friends,

Philippians 3:13&14, “Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended; but this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before, I press towards the mark of the high calling of God in Jesus Christ Jesus”

I think that one of the greatest struggles for a Christian is trying to keep up with the Lord. Often times as we walk with the Lord we get distracted on the way and we loose focus and it takes us time to get back to where we need to be. Also few people get beaten by their own opinion about themselves especially affected and infected by their past and so they cannot progress. We know for sure that there is nothing good in man except Christ and in as much as we have failed miserably and we ought to be throne into the lake of fire, Christ in us cannot deny Himself but casting us away. The fact is we don’t deserve to live but the truth is He has called us His own. We are adopted to be sons and daughters of God.

In Romans 7, Paul talks so much about struggling with sin, how he learnt what sin is all about, he tells us of what sin does and then he concludes the chapter in Romans 7:24, “O wretched man that I am, who shall rescue me from this body of death? 25, “Thanks be to God-through Jesus Christ our Lord!. So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God’s law, but in the sinful nature a slave to the law of sin”. He has discovered how he is vulnerable to sin but he does not leave it there for he is transitioning from what he knows about himself and puts everything aside and begins a new chapter on a positive thought because of who God is to him. Romans 8:1, “There is therefore no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus”. It’s very easy to dwell on who you used to be  instead of looking at what the Lord is doing right now. We can’t deny the fact that we all have histories, we are all from the past, good things and bad things happened but mostly we concentrate on the bad things that happened. We keep on bringing to remembrance what the Lord forgave us of and forgot about. Instead progressing to the healing part of our growth, we keep falling back to the same things we thought we dealt with.

Have you ever assassinated victories in your life because you still dwelt on who you used to be? cried yourself to sleep, couldn’t reach level of trusting someone again with your life because of what they did to you, haunted by a memory, an incident, an accident and you can’t see clearly where you are going. I am terrified of becoming who I used to be, just the thought of it makes me sick but I cannot undo what’s been done, I cannot change where I have come from and I cannot waste my time trying to fix what has been broken. I am too wise for that, every time I bring to remembrance my past failures, I want them to remind me that they were the bridge the Lord would use to tailor me to become who I am today. If I don’t see my past as bridge, it’s time leave it in the sea of forgetfulness. As long as the past haunts you, ask the Lord for strength to put it behind you otherwise you will not move far in Christ. Paul tells us how wretched he was then he moves to the next verse and thanks the Lord for he is reminded that what he is not, he can be if Christ is in his life.

Philippians 3:13&14, “Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended; but this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before, I press towards the mark of the high calling of God in Jesus Christ Jesus“. In NIV it says, “Brothers, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it”. What an indication that the struggle continues, he knows where he’s come from, he used to persecute Christians and then he got saved and the struggle continues. But this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before. He knows that for him to progress, he has to put all the past failures behind otherwise his next move will be hindered. I press towards the mark of the high call calling of God in Christ Jesus, meaning, I have a destiny and so I press on. The word press does not mean walk into it, but fight and pushing your way through, pressing also means applying some force and that is resisting the past that tries to assassinate your move. Mark how he puts it, pressing TOWARD (FORWARD) toward the mark, the goal Christ set for me from the beginning. I am looking at the end result while I am still moving towards it. Talk to God about who you used to be and who you are and He will talk to you about the mark of His high calling in your life. We as believers have received a calling and not just a calling but a HIGH CALLING and with that in mind, YOU CAN’T CHANGE WHERE YOU COME FROM, BUT YOU CAN CHANGE WHERE YOU ARE GOING BECAUSE OF THE HIGH CALLING. YOU CANNOT UN DO WHAT’S BEEN DONE, YOU CAN UN DO WHAT’S NOT BEEN DONE. Break out of what is putting you down and forget those things which are behind and begin to press on towards the mark.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Phil 3:1-16, “That I may know Him and the power of His resurrection and the fellowship of His suffering. Being made conformable unto His death”

I believe that for us to be over comers in the flesh we have to seriously be in tune with God. Each and everyone knows that thing that if they do, will cause them to get out of the natural into the supernatural where it’s no longer about the flesh exalting itself but Christ. Galatians 2:20, “I am crucified with Christ nevertheless I live but not I but Christ lives inside of me, the life that I now live in the flesh I live by faith through Him that loved me and gave Himself a ransom for me”. This is where it all begins, dying to self, crucifying the flesh for the flesh does not want the things from above. Paul tells us in the scripture in vs. 2 of the things we need to be aware of especially those who will try to deceive us, evil workers in fact he says be aware of dogs and the main thing he talks about is “have no confidence in the flesh”. Flesh is the no. 1 enemy of the Sprit that’s why we hear over and over again crucify the flesh. Paul had every reason to trust in the flesh because of his background but after learning more about Christ he counted all the knowledge, success, and where he came from as rubbish. King James version uses the word dung to describe which indicates worthless. My flesh surprises me many times, the reason I don’t trust it even for a minute. Just when you think you have it under control, it will surprise you with something else. The bible says, “flee youthful lusts”, it does not say deal with it, fix it, pray over it or stay strong, it simply says “flee for your life“. Samson thought with the anointing of God in his life he could play with sin to overcome it, well sin is not a respecter of persons. We all know what happened to him but we can be like Joseph who ran for his life.

Vs. 10, “That I may know Him and the power of His resurrection and the fellowship of His suffering. Being made conformable unto His death”. Knowing all that you know about your life and discovering that it’s nothing compared to what Christ is, you will be like Paul who saw himself and began to desire what Christ had. You will never desire what Christ has until you have you have counted all that you have (education, money, success as rubbish) not that they are but in comparison to Christ.  He realizes that he needs more and he says, “that he may know him not about Him and the power of His resurrection meaning the power that He has to do the impossible things and feel a little bit of pain that He felt and through this he maybe made conformable unto His death”. This should be our desire too.

Vs. 12-14, He reminds us that with all that he counted loss and he gained more of Christ. His desire at this moment is to forget those things which are behind and press on for the things which are before and that is Christ. To reach Christ is the goal that he had set for himself to gain Christ is the prize he would have attained. It all comes back to Phil 2:12, “Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Vs. 15&16 are self explanatory, “Therefore let us, as many as are mature, have this mind; and if in anything you think otherwise, God will reveal even this to you. Nevertheless, to the degree that we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us be of the same mind.” I desire to know Him more and the only way is to decrease that He may increase, less of me and more of Him, none of me and whole of Him as I press on.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Romans 6: 3, “Or do you not know that ﻿as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus ﻿ ﻿were baptized into His death? ﻿4﻿ Therefore we were ﻿﻿buried with Him through baptism into death, that ﻿just as Christ was raised from the dead by ﻿the glory of the Father, ﻿even so we also should walk in newness of life”

Today someone gave me an idea to ask devotion team members topics they would desire Pastor Phil and I to share on. I think it will be beneficial for you and for us as God expands us through this ministry. Believe me when I say, I have grown more in the word through the devotion ministry. Someone in the team asked me to share on the importance of water baptism.

First, water baptism is not another form of salvation, it accompanies salvation. Second, it’s not sprinkling of water, it’s immersion a sign of burial. It’s a demonstration or symbol of a believer’s union with Christ in His death, burial and resurrection. Anyone who gets baptized and is not saved goes into the water a dry sinner only to come out a wet sinner with water baptism doing him or her nothing. I believe babies should not be baptized but dedicated. The reason being, baptism is left for those who are old enough to understand their sinful state, repents of their sins and puts their trust in Jesus Christ alone for their eternal salvation. They publicly demonstrate their trust in Christ by being baptized. To be baptized symbolizes the old man dies and buried and the new man is resurrected. Burial with Christ symbolizes that sin no longer has hold upon a believer.

The ordinance of Christian baptism beautifully portrays this burial into Christ in which the old order of a death-controlled life comes to an end and the new order of a Christ-controlled life begins. Therefore, having already been justified, a believer tells that fact to the world by submitting to the ordinance of water baptism.

It is vital to be baptized into Christ Jesus but only after repenting of our sins and putting our trust in Jesus alone for our eternal salvation and desiring to walk with Him only after we have been raised from the dead by the glory of the Father and now we walk not according to our old ways but according to the newness of Christ. To me it serves a reminder of what it means to live a new life. May I repeat again, baptism is not another form of salvation. You can go to heaven because you are saved yet not baptized but every believer is encouraged to be water baptized in the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit. If you’ve not been baptized and you are saved, I urge you to consider it a priority and if you are baptized and not saved, baptism is not your salvation, repent and be saved.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 1:12, “As many as received Him, to them gave ye POWER to become the sons of God, even to them that believed in His name”

Ever had those days you just couldn’t function effectively like you should? Before day break, you are tossing on your bed back and forth wondering what the day will bring. Previous days were tough and your conclusion is, today will present the same if not worse. Fear has gripped your heart and you just can’t seem to get past it and move on. Don’t fret for God is present with a solution. In school we would give the teacher the right answers in math question only to learn that he was interested in how we arrived at the answer. Most of the time the answer was right but we couldn’t tell the teacher how we arrived at it because we cheated. See the teacher wasn’t concerned about the answer being correct, he was concerned about how we arrived at it. The process to get to that answer is more important than the answer itself. So praying that God would lead you to that destination is better than praying, God let me find myself there.

POWER is authority, ability, right, strength, control, influence. In short, power is the energy one receives to do greater things they couldn’t do without it. God Empowers His people, in other words, gives them ability, right, strength to influence their day to day living. 2Tim 1:7, “For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of POWER…” Give anyone power and they will function even more. In positions, people are not respected much because they are people, they are respected because of their ranks. Their ranks give them power to rule. The officers have power to enforce laws because of their positions and ranks. If you are stopped, their badge is what shows you that they have power to do what is right and if you were going to go against it, that badge will stop your mouth from saying, “You can do nothing to me”. “As many as received Him, to them gave ye POWER to become, first a son and as a son, an over comer”. Your rank and position gives you the Power to face things and people everyday. Everyone and every situation sees the uniform (Jesus Christ) and the badge on your chest (the blood of the Lamb) and that stops everything from coming against you cause they respect the Power in you.

As long as you have the power, you will lay and sleep, Psalms 3:5&8, “I lay down and slept, I awoke, for the Lord sustained me. I will not be afraid of the ten thousand people who have set themselves against me all around”, Psalms 23:4, “Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You (My POWER) are with me; Your rod and Your Stuff (badge), they comfort me”. Only God can empower you and I to become what we couldn’t be by ourselves and with that power, we can face and conquer fear, doubts, difficulties, and life obstacles. Often times we face the day without wearing our uniform and putting on that badge to give us power and that is why Paul writes to the Romans in Romans 13:14, “But Put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision to the flesh, to fulfill it’s lust thereof”. Without the uniform, we are exposing ourselves to many day to day stuff we could overcome if we wore our uniform otherwise we are vulnerable to attacks. Purpose in your heart to wake up, take the power given to you through prayer and His word, put it on, have your badge in a place where it can be seen and face the day under that POWER.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 1:1-6, “… He shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that brings fruit in it’s season…”

I believe the opening chapter in the book of Psalm, down to a few verses is a guideline to being blessed of God. I don’t know about you but I have learnt that God has no shortcuts for His people to get blessed despite the many teachings we hear especially with televangelists. I believe God would want us to move from expecting miracles to being blessed. Being blessed to me is a working progress. Let’s see what Psalm 1 teaches us how to be blessed.

Vs 1, Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, Nor stands in the path of sinners, Nor sits in the seat of the scornful”. It’s interesting to note that the bible already calls you blessed when you are set apart from the world. This verse puzzled me for a very long time as I was not sure whether it meant I should not walk with the unbelievers. The verse does not mean we cannot walk with the unbelievers, it says we cannot go by their counsel (wisdom), thinking or their ways. To grow, your counsel and their  counsel has to be replaced by His. The primary reason we should hang out with the unbelievers is to witness to them.

To be blessed is vs. 2, to delight in the law of the Lord, and on His law, meditate day and night”. Though we know the law is to tell what sin is, God uses it also to keep and safe and sound but you have to delight in it.

Vs 3, “ He shall be like a tree Planted by the rivers of water, That brings forth its fruit in its season, whose leaf also shall not wither; And whatever he does shall prosper.  Every tree is planted for a reason. Trees don’t just grow for nothing and no one also plants trees for nothing. Some plant trees for beauty, shade, timber, fruits. God does plant His trees for fruit. He wants to see us grow. As a tree, we are planted by the river of the living water to bring forth fruit and as a branch in John 15  we abide in Him that we may bear fruit. You can see that to be blessed you have to be connected to the right source. So what kind of fruit is the bible talking about, Galatians 5:22, “But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, 23 gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law”. I don’t see how one can bear the fruit real quick. It takes time and growth. Do you realize the bible does not say produce fruit or grow fruit? It’s because if we are planted by the river and are abiding, the fruit will come. Our leaves will not dry and whatever we do, we will prosper.

God has planted us by His rivers and as He living water, He continuously flows in us. The river is not stagnant water but moving water always bringing in the fresh water. When the word of God dwells in our hearts daily and we pray and meditate on His word daily, we get continuous supply for our day to day. I believe that when we are planted by the His river, we get our nourishment everyday. We don’t need to struggle to stay good or be fruitful because it will happen without any struggle. Many will see the change in us and would desire to know where we are planted. Remember that everyone is planted by a certain river, the question is, which one? Christ gave the Samaritan woman the living water and she went back to be a witness in Samaria. She did not struggle to do it as she was now planted by the river of life. The more I see the fruit of the Spirit in my life, the more I consider myself blessed. It takes time because of the growth process but it’s worth it.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 6:1-9, “In the year king Uzziah died, I saw the Lord…”

At the introduction of the book of Isaiah chapter 6 shows us the preparation of Isaiah’s life to respond to the call God had for him. “In the year King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord”, I am yet to study who king Uzziah, let me for now say by looking at the scripture that he looks like a king who blocked men like Isaiah from seeing God as He is. Can’t tell how he might have done it. I believe Isaiah was raised under his leadership and he must have looked up to him. Through that, Isaiah may have had self righteousness in that compared to his people he talks about in the earlier chapters. He had not had a revelation from above to the true the holiness of God, therefore as the bible puts it in Romans 10:3, “For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God”. Any time you can think to yourself that, “I’m a little bit better” will be a sign of establishing your own righteousness.

If you have someone or something blocking your view of the true thing, it’s easy to get satisfied by what is there. Why would I want to progress in my spiritual walk if I feel I have arrived? I am going to heaven, sounds good. I feel a little bit better compared to those who have not received Him. I give to the Lord, I make it to church, what more could the Lord require of me? I use to feel this way, I was comfortable about being saved and going to heaven that I did not want to do anything else besides that. Just when you feel comfortable, God will disrupt your life causing you to see something extraordinary. Something that has been clouding your way has to die and be removed. Remember there are two kingdoms here, King Uzziah’s and King Jesus’. As king Uzziah faded from the picture, Isaiah began to encounter with the God of holiness. Isaiah 6:1, “…I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe filled the temple”. I believe that you can never see who you really are until you see who He really is. Seeing who He really is exposes you to who you really are in His light. As long as king Uzziah was alive, Isaiah had no understanding of who God was (is) because king Uzziah’s living clouded his  eyes to see Who He was (is)). Isaiah in this case first saw Him sitting on the throne, HE is the King. High and Lifted up, Worshipped; train of His robe filled the temple, covering everything exposed. vs. 2, “Above it stood seraphim; each with six wings: with two he covered his face, with two covered his feet, and with two he flew”, Holiness. If Seraphim is a heavenly being, a type of an angel, I would say he must be holier than us. Bowing before God, covering his face, everything that Isaiah may have known about holiness was shattered at that moment. And the angels cried one to another, “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts, The whole earth is full of His glory”. Of all the things that describe the nature of God, none has been repeated more than once as the word “holy”. You don’t hear, faithful, faithful, faithful  but “Holy” always mentioned three times. Holiness is what God requires of us, 1Peter 1:16 “Be holy for I am holy”. The holiness is not based on men’s standard but God’s. The holiness of God humbles me to the fact that I’m undone. Not only did Isaiah see the holiness of God, he also saw that he had not worshipped the God of holiness. I am always reminded by God that I am not there yet even though He has used me mightily. I am grateful to be reminded to keep pursuing more and more. So Isaiah’s standard of holiness has been disrupted, what will he do about it?.

His response, Isaiah 6:5, “So I said, “woe is me for I am undone!..”. Just like I Isaiah, we are not complete yet, whether God has used us mightily or not, we are not there yet. Why drift back when you haven’t reached yet? why relax and be comfortable because you established your righteousness by looking at someone’s life? Pray that God will let all the king Uzziah’s in your life die that you may see Him as He is and in turn open your eyes to see yourself in His true light and confess just like Isaiah did. I will finish this tomorrow.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

There are some specific animals in the bible with some characteristics that are symbolic to a message it’s passing across and for us to learn and to relate to. We hear about the Lamb of God, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, The righteous are as bold as a lion, a dove descending on Jesus as a sign of the Holy Spirit, etc. Let’s talk about deer and it’s characteristics that applies to us.

Song of Songs 4:5 speaks about fawns (deer) of the gazelle that browse among the lilies. How is the deer described in the bible and it’s symbol? Let’s find out

1 Psalms 18 : 33 states” He makes my feet like that of a deer; He enables me to stand on the heights“. What is making of our feet as that of a deer? Just imagine the feet /running of a deer – the swiftness, the speed, the strength, etc are the highlighting features. When a tiger runs towards it, the rapid speed at which it runs is simply superb. In spiritual terms, when there is sin enticing (symbolic of the tiger), are we galloping like the deer or faltering or stumbling? How are our feet in this wicked world? Can be they compared to that of a deer? Isaiah 40: 30 says that even the young men may stumble and fall, they may grow weary. This is the order of nature. But verse Isaiah 40:29 states ,it is God who gives strength and increases the power of the weak. He can strengthen our feet like that of a deer and enable us to stand on the heights..

2. Psalms 42:1 “As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, O God, My soul thirsts for God, the living God, When can I go and meet with God?” Are we like the deer panting for streams of water, for the springs of water welling upto eternal life- Jesus the source of the living water?? What are we panting for? King David, with his vast army, kingdom ,wealth, mansions and what not, was panting for meeting God…What an awesome experience !

3. Job 39:1-4 God speaks to Job about the doe bearing her fawn, their young thrive and grow strong in the wilds. This verse speaks about the young of the doe which thrive, or rather prosper, succeed ,luxuriate. How do they thrive? And then become strong in the wilds… We also ought to gain strength from the Lord and thrive. The next point in the verse is that they leave where they are born and do not return. Yes, at last, we ought not to return the wicked world but to our dear Lord…  Our hope is for our eternal Home…There are some instances in the Bible where His children were asked to leave certain situations. Abraham in Genesis 12:1 was asked to leave his father’s household, his country. There is a usual tendency to become complacent in our own place. May be, we have to move/leave some places according to God’s direction to learn dependence on Him, rather than our own household, kith/kin. Psalms 45: 10 also explains this context.

4. Dueteronomy 14:3-5 certifies deer to be a clean animal. Bible classifies animals as clean and unclean based on certain characteristics- split hoof which is completely divided and that which chews the cud. Chewing the cud is to eat initially and later draw the food back to the mouth to be thoroughly chewed, bit by bit, rather enjoyed in a cool manner- for better digestion/ absorption of the nutrients. Deer does this . We also ought to read the Word of God and also keep meditating on it , enjoying it, rethink it , digest as we draw the full strength /nutrition of it.

5. Strong antlers (horns) of a deer are basically for its protection against  the enemy. While fighting, it first attacks the enemy with its antlers (horns) to bruise it’s attacker that it may flee. We too should possess the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God so that the enemy cannot attack us. The deer in Song of Songs is found to be browsing among the lilies, rather grazing on the pastures. What are we browsing ???Where are we grazing? Is it on the green pastures of the Lord- church with sound doctrine??

Every minute thing in nature, created by the Wonderful Almighty speaks /narrates His greatness, His wisdom, which none can fathom.  

In Christ
Sis Sarah

content.rendered:
Good morning friends,

John 11:17-27, “…I am the resurrection and the life…”

Congratulations to Pastor Phil and Stephanie who are proud parents of their baby girl born last night around midnight. They are doing well and blessed. Full details to follow. Let’s get to the word,

The world is full of chaos, confusion, murder, hatred in short, a scary world. It’s a world  that God’s hand has to be on for the sake of His people living in it. Many have prayed that they would be taken out of it but Jesus said in John 16:33, “These things have I spoken unto you, that in Me you might have peace, in the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world. Hymn “Because He lives, I can face tomorrow, because He lives, all fear is gone. Because I know He holds the future and life is worth a living, just because He lives” We need Jesus now more than ever.

In order for us to make it in life, we got to have faith in God. Faith in God can move mighty mountains and calm troubled seas. Faith is the wheel that allows God to accomplish what He has promised. Many are not willing to let go off step two to move to step three because of fear and doubt. You have to let go of a then to hold on to a now faith.

Faith is good for us but when and where do we apply it? All of us have faith but what kind of faith is the question? Lazarus was dead, mourners assembled to mourn his death and burry his body. Jesus had been told earlier that His friend Lazarus was sick to a point of death. Jesus did not come immediately when He heard of Lazarus condition until he died and was buried. Here comes Jesus and some of the questions that might have ran through the minds of those who knew how close He was to Lazarus might have been, “where was He when His friend was sick”?, how come He did not show up when he died or even help bury His friend if there was nothing He could do. Jesus let Lazarus die for a reason, He knew what He was doing. Lazarus resurrection was going to be bigger than healing he may have received had Jesus come when he was sick. Have you ever been in a situation where you trusted God for something and as time went by, the situation got worse and worse and you still called on Him? That is what Mary and Martha felt. Jesus was their best friend but when they needed Him the most, He wasn’t there to help.

He makes all things beautiful in His time says the bible. You know what? whether He came or not when I needed Him the most doesn’t matter anymore, His presence right now matters a lot. Let’s look at Martha’s first response when He sees Jesus, “Lord if you had been here, my brother would have not died” This is past faith, don’t allow yourself to live in the past faith. Jesus tries to bring her into the present and she jumps to the future faith “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection in the last days” There is nothing wrong with the future faith, currently you need the “NOW” faith. Jesus talked of the “NOW” faith when He said, “I am the resurrection and the life”,. Mark the word “I am” not “I was” or “I will be”, He is Jehovah Shammah meaning present, God of now therefore transfer your faith from the past and from the future and allow Him to be the Lord of your “now” situation. Keep on talking to Him about your past and what could have happened if this and that took place, He will talk to you about now. He is not intimidated by yesterday’s things as He is such a Master craftsman, He knows that He can take what is broken and set it on the wheel that it might become what He said it will be despite the condition in which it is in right now. Lazarus was sick then died but that still did not intimidate the Master. He may delay but He will not be defeated. The delay is not assign He couldn’t make it on time, the delay is to get more glory in the situation. He is the Lord who calls those things which are not as though they were. Stop living in the future too as you will be wasting today’s blessings that come through today’s faith. Do not wait till you get to heaven to enjoy what God has for you down here on earth. He has said be of good cheer, I have overcome the world. I want to trust Him today as today’s faith tailors me for tomorrows victories.

My desire is to always have faith in God at a given moment and trust Him with the condition of my situation. It’s not easy to trust God when something that you knew could turn out good is dead especially dreams and desires but who else can we run to? I can’t give up now, I have come from too far to give up and give in. I have invested too much in my faith just to let it go. I know where he pulled me out of, I Him today to take me that far.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Leviticus 17:11, “For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.
We understand the power of the blood a life. Anytime someone is bleeding, they try as much as possible to stop the open wound from bleeding why? Because blood is precious, without it in the body, a person can die. What is the work of the blood that makes it precious? Blood carries gases, nutrients and waste products throughout our bodies. Blood also fights infections, heals wounds and performs many other vital functions. There is no substitute for blood. It cannot be made or manufactured.

In the old testament time, there was something about the blood sacrifice. People who sinned gave blood sacrifice of bullocks, sheep and goats to make atonement for their souls. All this pacified God but did not satisfy Him. The blood in the old testament only covered sin until the Lamb of God, who was, who is and is to come came down on the face of the wrapped in flesh and blood and offered Himself as a sacrifice by shading His blood precious blood on the cross for the sins of the world. He was the offerer and the offering and He came to take care of what other bloods only covered. While hanging on the cross, a Roman soldier pierced Him on the side and out of His side came water and blood for the sins of world. His blood was so powerful that it washed away our sins. “What can wash away my sin?, nothing but the blood of Jesus; what can make me whole again?, nothing but the blood of Jesus; Oh precious is that flow, that makes me white as snow; no other fount I know, nothing but the blood of Jesus” What other bloods could not screen, the blood of the Lamb screened it and took care of it. Not only did the blood take care of what we did, it also took care of what we could have done, what we thought about doing. If it were not for the blood, think about it for a moment, do you know who you would be today? I don’t know who and where I would be today had it not been for the blood. For sure I would be bleeding to death in my sins. The bible makes is clear, “The life of the flesh is in the blood” and the life of the gospel is in the blood the makes atonement for the flesh. Hebrews 9:22, “…without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness” (NIV)

The life of the flesh is in the blood, if the body stops functioning like Abel’s, the blood will still speak out of the body because the blood can speak. And God hears the blood when it speaks. The devil knows the blood is against him and he knows that he has no power over those with the blood of the Lamb marked on the doorpost of their hearts. I remember a another song we would sing, “I’m gonna hide right under the blood where the devil can do me no harm”. “There is power, wonder working power in the blood” The blood of Jesus is what ties the blacks and the whites together, the rich and the poor, the young and the old. God does not look at who we are in the natural, He is looking for the color of the blood (RED)) and as long as we have the blood of His son marked on the door post of our hearts

Choose to apply the blood of the Lamb on the doorpost of you heart, bring all your activities under the blood, bring your thoughts, actions, destiny, family, friends, work colleagues under the blood. God said to the children of Israel, “When I see the blood, I will pass over you”. Meaning that the angel of death, destruction, confusion shall have no power over you when you are under the blood. The devil is extremely afraid of the blood cause the blood is against Him. So hide right under the blood where the devil can do you no harm. I also believe that when God sees the blood on us, He will bless us, minister to us and encourage us. Rev 12:11, “And they overcame him by the blood of the lamb and by the words of their testimony”, The blood of the Lamb is highly recommended.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Cor 12:9, “… My grace is sufficient for you……”

Hymn: “Amazing grace, how sweet that sounds that saved a wretch like me, I once was lost but not I am found. Was blind but now I see”. What so amazing about the grace that the writer of the hymn had just to begin it that way. Yesterday the message of grace kept on pondering in my mind heart  I had to find out what it’s all about. Yes I know what it does but my question was, “What’s so amazing about it?”

The good news in the NT is God’s acceptance of us by grace alone. The word “GRACE” in Hebrew are hesed and hen which means undeserved love and favor. God is love, and grace is the out flowing of His love toward undeserving sinners. Grace is love in action. For God so loved the world that He gave (action word). We are making it because of the favor of God. Eph 2:8&9, “For it’s by grace that we’ve been saved through faith and not of ourselves, it is the gift of God and not of works lest any man should boast of”. I did not earn salvation by myself but by grace. Now you will say wait a minute Ev, I am the one who went to church that night, when they made the altar call, I said well since I am here and it doesn’t cost me anything to go to the front, I will go and kneel down and say the sinners prayer and I will be saved”. As you can see there are a lot of “It’s” meaning I did all until I gave my life to Christ. No, it’s God who drew you to church that day or wherever you got saved, He planted the right brought His conviction on you, place words of truth into your heart and He caused you to believe, He put a desire for you to go to the front and He got you saved by His grace. The bible says that a man cannot come to the Lord unless he is drawn of the Father, John 6:44. So we need to be reminded that we’ve been saved by the grace of God, grace fought for us in the courts of law when the judgment had been passed that we were guilty. Were it not for grace and mercy, we would still be dead in sin.

2Cor 12:9, “But He said to me, My grace is sufficient for you, my strength is made perfect in weakness”. This is a message that came to Paul while He was going through something that he did not understand. He had no proper words to describe it, he called it a thorn in the flesh. The bible says that he prayed three times that it would be removed and instead of God removing it, He gave him the grace to endure. The amazing grace will cause you to endure hardship, making you comfortable and not happy in the situation you are in. His grace is more than enough to keep you intact until He has rescued you. After knowing that His grace would keep him, he rejoiced in his infirmities as he understood that this too would pass. Lord if you do not change the situation and circumstances I am in, please let your grace be more than enough to keep me on hold position.

Heb 4:16, “Therefore approach the throne of grace with boldness that you obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need”. Already we have established a foundation about grace being a favor not something worked for or earned. Anytime we deal with grace, we understand that we have a debt that we need to pay but because of the favor of the Lord, we are exempt from it as Jesus paid it on the cross when He died. The grace of God makes it possible to be real. We can stand before God in our fig leaves, knowing we are accepted and beloved. Listen to this, the grace of God does not compromise the holiness of God but provides a way out. Now that we have been accepted as beloved we have been given the keys to access the throne of grace when we need mercy and grace to help in time of need. I always go to the throne of Grace for I am a working progress in this life being perfected everyday, growing in holiness. When you have grace, you will not disgrace yourself and the people around you.

To sum up, God in His kindness saved me a dirty wretched sinner by His grace through His Son without compromising His Holiness by providing a way out, that’s what makes grace so amazing. Would you like to share with me what makes grace amazing in your life?

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 3:1-18, “But no man can tame the tongue…”

Ever said something you wish you did not say? or said something you wish you could take back? Said something that was taken out of context? or people misunderstood what you said?. There is power in the little thing in our bodies called the tongue. The tongue has landed so many people into trouble. As much as what people do can destroy, what people say can do even a greater damage and it’s because what has been done can quickly heal unlike what has been said stays in the memory. Friendships have been broken due to what came out of the tongue. Husbands and wives have ended up in greater fights because of the tongue.

Proverbs 18:22, says “Death and life is in the power of the tongue…”, as you can see, the tongue is a very small instrument in our bodies but has power. James gives us an example of how powerful the tongue is vs. 4 where he says, “…ships: although they are so large and driven by fierce winds, they are turned by a very small rudder wherever the pilot desires” and so is the tongue, it has power to control the entire body. The tongue can start fire spreading like wild fire and very fast. The fire is never satisfied when it is consuming and so is the tongue. In school as a teenager, my mouth always landed me into trouble. I never had strength to physically fight the reason I fought with my tongue. I always got beaten because of my mouth. Had I watched my tongue…. James again says in vs. 6, “And the tongue is a fire of world of iniquity. The tongue is so set among our members that it defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature”. It’s by the tongue that cussing and swearing comes about; backbiting and gossip; all lies are spread by the tongue; deception and misleading mostly come through the tongue; persuasion is another result of what the tongue can do. There is so much that the tongue can do and yet James 3:8, says “But no man can tame the tongue”. We use the tongue to scold, to nag, to slander, to quarrel, can no man tame. Under pressure and anger, people have said things that should have not come out of their mouths at all. What was released by the tongue damaged big time in small a mount of time.

The bible does not say that the tongue cannot be tamed, it only tells us man cannot tame it Each of us has a tongue and a voice. These instruments of speech can be used destructively or employed constructively. Death and life is in the power of the tongue the bible tells us and that shows me that I can either speak life or speak death in my life or in someone’s life. But we cannot use the same tongue to speak death and life, James 3:9, “With it (tongue) we bless our God, and Father, and with it we curse men, who have been made in the similitude of God” vs. 10 “Out of the same mouth proceeds blessing and cursing”.

I’m not just talking about what you say that affect others but what you say that affects you. Many speak death in their own lives, they speak defeat, and they speak curses in their lives. Instead of taking that precious little thing the tongue and using it to speak destiny, hope and courage, they use it as knife cutting their own throats. No wonder many fall in depression and sickness for they have taken their tongue and used it as a lethal weapon to bring destruction to themselves. You can tell the outworking of the internal by what someone has inside. Luke 6:45, says “…of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks” and with this verse you can tell what someone has inside as that is what will come out. The tongue is the manifestation of what is inside for it’s used to bring out what is harbored inside. As said earlier, man cannot tame the tongue but God can for what gets out of men’s control does not get out of God’s control. We need to bring our tongue under God’s control and make it an instrument of blessing and praise. Only God can control it if we yield to Him. I hate to destroy with my tongue, and I hate to say things that will hurt my friends, family or anyone for I know the damage the tongue can bring. I have regretted many times to have said something that to me was okay but to someone else it wasn’t for it hurt them dearly. At times I tend to think that what I can take, someone else too can take it but that is a lie from the pits of hell. My tongue and your tongue ought to be used to build and not tear; bless and not curse; promote and not demote; uplift and not bring down. It’s in the process of yielding to the Lordship of Jesus Christ that we learn the art of using our tongue the Godly way.

You will never bring your tongue under God’s control until you realize you need it controlled. Isaiah 6:5, “So I said, woe is me, for I am undone! Because I am a man of unclean lips (tongue), And I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts”. Isaiah could not see what the damage his tongue was doing until his eyes saw the Lord of hosts and how Holy He is and then realized who he was. Isaiah 6:7, “And he touched my mouth with it (live coal), and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; Your iniquity is taken away, and your sin is purged”. With his admission and confession, he humbled himself and the Lord touched his lips (tongue) with a live coal. Live coal will burn but it will do you and I good. Isaiah was not ready for service until a transformation took place in his life. Where are you with your tongue? what damages has it done? have you asked for forgiveness from those that you hurt with your words? are you gossiping behind someone’s back? “Remember that he/she who tells you about others, tells others about you”. In short, is your tongue under God’s control, BRING IT UNDER HIS CONTROL.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: I Reported What Impacted Me, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 26:7, “A woman came to Him having a lambasted flask of very costly fragrant oil…”

The other day we looked at a woman who comes in and teaches everyone what worship is all about. This was no rehearsed, practiced, scripted worship, this was a decision made, action taken type of worship holding nothing back. Once again four gospels reported what they witnessed in their own words and reporting what impacted them.

Let’s talk about a problem that arose when she worshiped. Mathew is very lenient, he brings all the disciples to the same level without pin pointing one person. Read what he says, Mathew 26:8, “But His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “Why waste? Vs 9, “For this fragrant oil might have been sold for much and given to the poor”.  It appears that the people’s reaction was that Jesus was not worthy of this kind of worship. He did not deserve an expensive worship. The truth of the matter is, worshipping Christ will cost you something. That is why we sing “We bring the sacrifice of praise”.  Sacrifice goes with surrender. David was given a piece of land to offer sacrifice to the Lord, he refused to take it for free and offered money to buy it. Listen to what he said to the king who offered to give him the land for free, 2 Samuel 24:24, “Then the king said to Araunah, “No, but I will surely buy it from you for a price; nor will I offer burnt offerings to the LORD my God with that which costs me nothing.” Worshipping the Lord is costly.

Luke is different, he gets into more details, Luke 7:39, “Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this, he spoke to himself, saying, “This Man, if He were a prophet, would know what manner of woman this is who is touching Him, for she is a sinner”. The moment she walked in through the door, she had already been labeled and despised therefore anything good that she was going to do from then forward was not going to considered at all. By listening to the Pharisee speak, to him Jesus being in his house gave him an idea that he was a good righteous man. Paul tells us in Romans 7:18, “For I know that nothing good dwells within me, that is, in my flesh…” This sums up the life of human beings that nothing good dwells in the life of man. To say more, the Pharisee changed his mind about Christ when he said “This Man, if He were a prophet…” To him being a prophet suggested handling only a certain class of people. He also had a wrong perception of Jesus for Jesus was more than a prophet.

To talk more about the Pharisee, he no longer referred to him as Jesus but this Man. It was  no longer Christ but some questioned prophet who does not discern or create boundaries as to who He should be in contact with. Mark responds to people’s action differently, he does not mention the Pharisee neither does he mention the disciples, all he says is that some people questioned it. He goes a head and even talks about the price of the oil to show how expensive it was. He continues to say that they criticized her sharply.

John says something about people’s reaction; remember that John is very specific. At first, he identified the woman, and then identifies someone else who questioned the act of this woman. John 12:4, “But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot….said, vs. 5, “Why was this fragrant oil not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?” This is what I call having people tell you what you should and shouldn’t do when it comes to worshipping the Lord.

This woman Mary had counted the cost of worshipping, she knew it was an expensive worship. She was sacrificing something precious to her, having learnt like David that she will not offer to the Lord what cost her nothing. No one could define how she needed to worship for it was not about the people but Jesus. With that said, who defines how you worship Him? When you worship, is it costing you? Are you giving the Lord what is LEFT (remaining) or what is RIGHT (just)? To finish Be blessed

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: I Reported What Impacted Me, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 26:7, “A woman came to Him having alabaster flask of very costly fragrant oil…”

We looked at four disciples present at a time a woman came to Jesus but how they responded or wrote about the story is somehow the same but there are some info given by each gospel that the other did not report. As Mathew, Mark, Luke and John gave the account of what happened based on what I believe impacted them. Let me also pick out something out each of their report to show what impacted me.

All the four gospels say the woman came in with an alabaster flask of very costly spikenard. Mark goes on to add in Mark 14:3, “..Then she broke the flask…”, this is something that I don’t take lightly because it has really taught me what worship is all about. This woman who John tells us is Mary teaches us what worship is all about. The fact that she broke the flask has a lot to say about worship. In church it’s easy to be cool, calm, and collected, and by that I mean, it’s easy to control how you worship. That is like opening a flask and pouring the amount of oil you want to pour out and closing it back. You have the power to control what comes out meanwhile a broken person like the flask (jar) has no time to control. You break a jar with liquid in it, it’s impossible to control the flow, you cannot even collect what has been poured out, you try it this way, and it comes out the other way. You cannot save what you have broken but He can. If you open it then I assure you that you can save it. Any thing you carefully open may be something you are not ready to loose. What comes out of something broken does not stay in one place, it spreads out finding paths to flow in. Is this not the case with worship, it flows freely from a broken heart, Psalm 34:18, “The LORD is near to those who have a broken heart, And saves such as have a contrite spirit”. They are not ashamed to look foolish worshipping the Lord, they do not care about who sees them and what they say about their style of worship. They are just glad that Jesus saved them when they were a wretched sinners and this is their way of showing gratitude to the one who deserves all worship.

Here comes Luke telling us more about what she did. Of all the people that were in that house, Jesus was the one who deserved to be worshipped, instead of the rest learning and joining the woman in worshipping, they got caught up in what she was doing. Luke 7:38, “and stood at His feet behind Him weeping; and she began to wash His feet with her tears, and wiped them with her tears, and wiped them with her hair and she kissed His feet and anointed them with the fragrant oil”. Doesn’t sound like a woman who is cool, calm and collected, sounds like a woman who is ready to do whatever it takes to glorify the Son of God regardless of who is around her. We tend to be cautious about who is around us when we worship, trying to be dignified and looking holy. At times tempted to stop someone who is pouring him or herself to the Lord because we are not comfortable with the way they worship. Everyone wants to stop this woman from doing what she is doing but is not kicking her away or ordering her to be taken away, why? because He loves the worship. Giving all that she’s got and then some when no one else could. What more does John have to tell me that will impact me, John 12:3, “…And the house was filled with fragrance of the oil“. Her act changed the atmosphere of the house, her worship drew every one’s attention not just to the woman but Jesus because I believe many saw how they had walked with Jesus but never actually worshipped Him the way He should have been worshipped. What does this very simple woman have to teach us about worship? Brokenness causes you to give all. Anyone around you shouldn’t define how you worship, only Jesus deserves worship, and what you give could be a fragrance that would fill the room affecting everyone and impacting everyone. To continue. Blessings Evans

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
 
 Mark 14:3, “.as He sat at the table, a woman came to him having an alabaster flask of very costly oil of spikenard.”

I present to you a series I put together in 2003 that impacted me in a very special way. Hope you are blessed. By the way, My wife and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary yesterday. We thank God for this far He has brought us.

 
Of the four gospels, Mathew, Mark, Luke and John we have four writers who are writing what they witnessed under the ministry of Jesus. The four were impacted in different ways and you will see how they were each impacted by the account of their story. Though they all may have seen the same thing, they did not report exactly the same way. Yes there are different accounts each of them give of certain incidents but there are some incidents that all of them did not report. In what I will share is about an incident that involves a woman who came Jesus with an alabaster flask of very costly oil of spikenard.

Mathew reports this incident in Mathew 26:6 going forward, while Mark reported it in Mark 14:3 going forward; Luke takes the time to report it in Luke 7:36 going forward while John reports it in John 12:1. Reading all the four accounts of their report, the story is the same but each of them takes the time to address certain things that others did not report.

 
Why would each record the same differently with some leaving things out and add some stuff in? Here is my thinking every was impacted and touched differently and that is what they reported. What captures your heart is what you are most likely to report. What you respond to the most is what you will work towards. How you are really impacted may not be the way I will be impacted but we still report about the same story. I would like to address each of their accounts and we will arrive at the common denominator.

Mathew says, they were all in the Bethany in the house of Simon the leper. He first identified where they were and whose house they were in. He also tells us the condition of the owner. He doesn’t’ take time to tell us who Simon the leper’s background was, his tribe, the condition of his heart. Mark comes along and reports the same thing Mathew reports in his first line. Luke comes along and does not give us the man’s name but tells us that he was a Pharisee. Mathew and Mark’s were touched by the fact that Jesus was hanging out with the sick, as for Luke, he was touched by the fact that Jesus was in the

house of a Pharisee, the people who really opposed Jesus. What does John have to say? John starts by talking about the presence of Lazarus who had died and had been raised from the dead by Jesus, he was impacted by the fact that a man who was once dead was a live seating with them at the table for Passover. Four same first accounts but different beginnings.

 
Their report is on a woman who came in with an alabaster flask of. Whether she was invited or not we are yet to find out. As she comes in, I don’t believe that she is noticed until she does something that takes everyone’s breathe away. Mathew, Luke and Mark just refers to her as the woman, a sinful woman, what she did blew their mind but when John takes the time to report, I can imagine him going to do an interview to find out who this woman was, “please give me her name” and discovers that the woman’s name was Mary. Different accounts and different stories and how they have been reported give us a better understanding of what really happened. Putting those pieces together gives us a full picture of where they were, whom they encountered with, their names, the incidents etc.

Is it possible not to always rely on one side of the story? You figure it out.
 
My first point as I close today, what you have seen and experienced and has impacted your heart, is what you are likely to report but there will always be a common denominator where all will touch on or agree on. Like we have said before, we are not the same, God has given us individualities that each of us has a way to be impacted and impact others by our stories of life and how He has brought us this far. To be continued. Blessings Evans

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: What Gospel do you believe 5? By Pastor Phil and Ray Comfort

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Friendship Evangelism that doesn’t seek a way to quickly tell people about their eternal fate is the ultimate betrayal of trust.  How can we call ourselves a friend of someone we don’t bother to warn of terrible danger?  Friends don’t let friends go to hell   (Ray comfort).”

I realize that these messages are longer than usual.  It has been a challenge both in the study, because the topic is so vast, and a challenge communicating effectively to you, those we deeply care about.  May you stay aware of the dangerous, false gospels being preached, and hold fast to the Gospel According to Jesus Christ (see Bible for complete text).  For further study on the emergent church please check out, www.apologeticsindex.org and click on the right side bar, emergent church.  Today we will look at the Mormon Gospel.

“But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed (Gal 1:8).”

In Paul’s defense of the true gospel he does not fail to mention that “an angel from heaven” may come and preach to you another gospel.  In Paul’s day the Mormon belief systems did not exist at the time.  However it certainly is preaching its false gospel today.  Perhaps you have Mormon friends, or have been approached by Mormons.  We should run away from them, but rather give them the Biblical gospel, their lives depend on it. 

In 1823, the angel Moroni allegedly visits a man named Joseph Smith in his bedroom three times one September night. These visits are the start of a series of lessons that results in Joseph’s getting gold plates that were allegedly buried in Hill Cumorah, just a few miles south of Palmyra, in Manchester, New York.  In 1827, Joseph allegedly receives from the angel Moroni the gold plates that were buried in Hill Cumorah. Written on them in “Reformed Egyptian” is the history of a previously unknown New World people. With the help of God Joseph translates the writing into what is now the Book of Mormon.  What the book of Mormon teaches is that Salvation, a word that Mormons qualify in one of three ways: unconditional or general salvation is simply resurrection from the dead, granted to all through Christ’s atonement; conditional or individual salvation involves entering the celestial kingdom through works of Mormonism; full salvation means exaltation to become a God as a result of temple ceremonies and other works (Farkas, J. R., & Reed, D., A. (1997, c1995). Mormonism: Changes, contradictions, and errors (electronic ed.).  An angel of God would not contradict the Word of God, and we certainly cannot become a god ourselves, that is idolatry!

Mormonism is a self – righteous system that can earn their own salvation through good works.  If one could earn salvation then who needs Jesus Christ to die for the sin of the world.  John 3:16, 1 Peter 3:18, and numerous other verses of Scripture make this plane.  ﻿“For by grace you have been saved ﻿﻿through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God, not of ﻿﻿works, lest anyone should ﻿﻿boast (Eph 2:8, 9).”

Remember that Satan masquerades as an “angel of light” (2 Cor. 11:14).  There is only one God, not many, as the Mormons propose, (Isaiah 43:10 – 11; 44:6, 45: 5 – 6, 21b – 22) all other “gods” are idols (1 Cor. 16:26, Exodus 30:3, 23).  The God of the Bible created the entire universe (Gen 1:16; Psa. 8:3; Jer. 31:35).  Jehovah (translated as “LORD” in all caps) and Elohim (translated as “God”) are the same being (Duet 4:35; 1 Kings 8:60; Psalm 100:2).  Jesus and Satan are not brothers, as put forth in Mormonism.  Jesus is surely the only way to Heaven. “Nor is there salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”

May you help Mormons find their way to the truth lest they end up in Hell for all eternity!
Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <>< 

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: What Gospel do you believe 4? By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel: 7 Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ (Gal 1:6-7).”

Paul was marveled at those that decided to jump ship from the real gospel to a false gospel.  As I have been going through this series, God has put this series on my heart to convey His heart about false gospels as compared to the only true gospel.  How does one know that although God is not surprised by yet angry with these other gospels?  Recall this occurrence of Jesus in the gospel of John.  “And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables” (John 2:15).  It is clear that God opposes all while God opposes error and sin, he is especially passionate about expressing this opposition when error and sin come into his house and when his children are affected.  Another error, false gospel that has become very popular at this time is the gospel of the emergent church.  “The Emerging Church movement consists of a diverse group of people who identify with Christianity, but who feel that reaching the postmodern world requires us to radically reshape the church’s beliefs and practices to conform to postmodernism.

Postmodern rejects the fact that words have meaning which causes them to “deconstruct” the language of texts (including Scripture), redefining the words and reinterpreting the texts to mean whatever they feel as they have an encounter with the text’s language” (Apologetics index).  Ravi Zechariahs in his message postmodernism and philosophy brings out a question that was asked on a TV program,  “Do words have meaning, or does the speaker reserve the right to fuse his or her own words, with his or her own meaning?  Is there a point of reference for language, or does the speaker determine the right to say whatever he or she wants, and mean whatever he or she wants?  The program put out a survey to hear from the world on this issue.  If words have no meaning how can one see meaning in the question itself?  The surveyors responded that words do not have any meaning the speaker reserves the right to fuse in his or her own meaning.  A second question asked, does morality have any meaning or does each individual reserve the right to choose his or her own morality?  The surveyor respondents to hear from the world at large, morality doesn’t have any absolutes, one reserves the right to create his or her own.  The third item was that if Saddam Hussein didn’t stop playing word games over the airwaves, the US was going to start bombing.”    

If words and morality have no meaning then what does the Christian do with the words of the Scripture, especially those spoken in the gospels by Jesus Christ, who used words to convey meaning about our bankruptcy of morality and our need for God’s forgiveness?  We are born dead in our sin and transgression and then proceed as we grow older to break God’s moral Law (the Ten Commandments).  The emergent church gospel does not subscribe to words having absolute meaning nor absolute truth.  Also there is no moral absolute because a Christian can then assume moral superiority over a non-Christian.  Furthermore, they do not seek to save the lost like Jesus did, because they use modern methods of evangelism, also known as “friendship evangelism”.  Satan is not creative but rather deceptive.  A faithful brother in Christ of mine named Ivan shared with me, Satan will use our need for sleep and try to lead us to be lazy, he will use our design for work and try to cause us to become “workaholics”.  The emergent gospel has its roots in Satan back in the Garden of Eden when the serpent said to Eve, “Did God really say, ‘You shall not eat of every tree of the garden’?”

﻿2﻿ And the woman said to the serpent, “We may eat the ﻿﻿fruit of the trees of the garden; ﻿3﻿ but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God has said, ‘You shall not eat it, nor shall you ﻿touch it, lest you die.’ ” ﻿4﻿ ﻿Then the serpent said to the woman, “You will not surely die. ﻿5﻿ For God knows that in the day you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil (Gen 3:1-4).” Did God really say?  If the emergent gospel can redefine things, then humanity can play God and redefine both good and evil.

     The emergent gospel wants everyone to be accepted and for everyone to feel good about oneself.  So when Jesus makes a statement such as in Luke 14, “If anyone comes to Me ﻿﻿and does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, ﻿yes, and his own life also, he cannot be My disciple. ﻿27﻿ And ﻿whoever does not bear his cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple,” this is extremely exclusive, it excludes some people who fail to do what Jesus is commanding as a prerequisite. 

The emergent gospel really wants Christ-less Christianity.  Brian McLaren, one of the emergent gospels leaders said, “Good evangelism is the process of being friendly without discrimination and influencing all of one’s friends toward better living, through good deeds and good conversations…Christian commitment is where I’m coming from…This is not to say that there isn’t a place for Buddhist or Jewish evangelism, but someone else will be better suited to write on these topics.”  Compare this to the beginning of Jesus’ ministry, “From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”  Perhaps the following dialog will put the unbalanced, “friendship evangelism,” which perhaps many of you subscribe to in its true light: 
Preacher’s Progress (by ray Comfort)

Christian Loveless: “Hi, Mrs. Smith. How are you doing? Is Erik in yet?”
Mrs. Smith: “Lunch again, huh? I haven’t seen him come through the lobby today. He came into work last week with a bad hangover. Probably the same thing has happened today. How was church?”

Christian Loveless: “It was really good. We had Brother Don Waterdowns come in and do a series of healing meetings. Hundreds gave their hearts to the Lord. I’m in charge of the follow-up program. Man, I didn’t realize how easy it is to get people saved. Lots were getting healed and people were coming to the altar without even being preached to.”

Mrs. Smith: “What a blessing. We had him at our church too. He advocates ‘friendship evangelism,’ doesn’t he?”
Christian Loveless: “Yes. I like that. It’s what I’ve been using on Erik. We’ve become good buddies over the years.”
Mrs. Smith: “I like that approach. It’s so much better than shoving the gospel down people’s throats.”
Christian Loveless: “True. That can alienate them. I’m waiting for the right time to mention the things of God to Erik; I don’t want to make him feel uncomfortable. Erik came to one of the meetings, and he really seemed to enjoy it. That’s the good thing about non-confrontational evangelism. He didn’t give his heart to the Lord, though. Maybe today he will bring up the subject. I never do, because I don’t want to offend him. I’m just a good friend, and I think that’s the right approach.”

Mrs. Smith: “I agree. I’ll call the Third Floor and speak to his secretary. Perhaps she will know why he’s late.”
Christian Loveless: “Okay.”
Mrs. Smith: “Jeannie, Rose Smith. Is Erik Tuday in yet? Christian Loveless is here to see…”
Christian Loveless: “What’s wrong? Your face has gone pale!”
Mrs. Smith: “I’m afraid Erik died during the night. He had an aneurysm in his sleep and was pronounced dead at 8:17 this morning…”

title.rendered: What Gospel do you believe 3? By Pastor Phil and Ray Comfort

content.rendered:
Good morning,

I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel: 7 Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.” (Gal 1:6-7)

The Gospel means good news.  Paul states that some have moved to another gospel, which is not another.  The false gospels, such as the Prosperity Gospel, is a false gospel, therefore it is bad news, because it does not teach the way of salvation through Christ.  Let’s examine this next “gospel” in this series, which is perhaps brothers with the prosperity gospel, hence the feel good gospel.  The question is asked, “Why not preach that Jesus gives happiness, peace, and joy.”  Jesus didn’t initially come to bring us happiness, but rather holiness. 

My brother in Christ that I look up to very much has done an incredible job with this, so I will defer by sharing brother Ray Comfort’s sound teaching on the happiness, feel good “gospel”.

“Two men are seated on a plane. The first is given a parachute and told to put it on as it would improve his flight. He’s a little skeptical at first, since he can’t see how wearing a parachute on a plane could possibly improve his flight, he decides to experiment and see if the claims are true. As he puts it on, he notices the weight of it upon his shoulders and he finds he has difficulty in sitting upright. However, he consoles himself with the fact he was told that the parachute would improve his flight. So he decides to give it a little time.  As he waits he notices that some of the other passengers are laughing at him for wearing a parachute on a plane. He begins to feel somewhat humiliated. As they continue to point and laugh at him, he can stand it no longer. He slinks in his seat, unstraps the parachute and throws it to the floor.  Disillusionment and bitterness fill his heart, because as far as he was concerned he was told an outright lie.

The second man is given a parachute, but listen to what he is told. He’s told to put it on because at any moment he’ll be jumping 25,000 feet out of the plane. He gratefully puts the parachute on. He doesn’t notice the weight of it upon his shoulders, nor that he can’t sit upright. His mind is consumed with the thought of what would happen to him if he jumped without the parachute.  Let’s now analyze the motive and the result of each passenger’s experience. The first man’s motive for putting the parachute on was solely to improve his flight. The result of his experience was that he was humiliated by the passengers, disillusioned, and somewhat embittered against those who gave him the parachute. As far as he’s concerned, it will be a long time before anyone gets one of those things on his back again.  The second man put the parachute on solely to escape the jump to come. And because of his knowledge of what would happen to him if he jumped without it, he has a deep-rooted joy and peace in his heart knowing that he’s saved from sure death. This knowledge gives him the ability to withstand the mockery of the other passengers. His attitude toward those who gave him the parachute is one of heartfelt gratitude.

Now listen to what the modern gospel says: “Put on the Lord Jesus Christ. He’ll give you love, joy, peace, fulfillment, and lasting happiness.” In other words, Jesus will improve your flight. The sinner responds, and in an experimental fashion puts on the Savior to see if the claims are true. And what does he get? The promised temptation, tribulation, and persecution—the other “passengers” mock him. So what does he do? He takes off the Lord Jesus Christ; he’s offended for the Word’s sake; he’s disillusioned and somewhat embittered…and quite rightly so.  He was promised peace, joy, love, and fulfillment, and all he got were trials and humiliation.  His bitterness is directed at those who gave him the so-called “good news.” His latter end becomes worse than the first, and he’s another inoculated and bitter “backslider.”  Instead of preaching that Jesus improves the flight, we should be warning sinners that they have to jump out of a plane. That it’s appointed for man to die once and then face judgment (Hebrews 9:27). When a sinner understands the horrific consequences of breaking the Law of God, he will flee to the Savior, solely to escape the wrath that’s to come. If we are true and faithful witnesses, that’s what we’ll be preaching—that there is wrath to come—that God “commands all men every where to repent: because he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness” (Acts 17:30,31).

The issue isn’t one of happiness, but one of righteousness. It doesn’t matter how happy a sinner is, or how much he is enjoying the pleasures of sin for a season, without the righteousness of Christ, he will perish on the day of wrath. Proverbs 11:4 says, “Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivers from death.”. Peace and joy are legitimate fruits of salvation, but it’s not legitimate to use these fruits as a drawing card for salvation. If we continue to do so, the sinner will respond with an impure motive, lacking repentance.

Can you remember why the second passenger had joy and peace in his heart? It was because he knew that the parachute was going to save him from sure death. In the same way, as believers we have joy and peace in believing because we know that the righteousness of Christ is going to deliver us from the wrath that is to come.  With that thought in mind, let’s take a close look at an incident aboard the plane.  We have a brand-new flight attendant. It’s her first day. She’s carrying a tray of boiling hot coffee. She wants to leave an impression upon the passengers and she certainly does!  As she’s walking down the aisle she trips over someone’s foot and slops the hot coffee all over the lap of our second passenger. What’s his reaction as that boiling liquid hits his tender flesh? Does he go, “Man that hurt!”? Yes, he does. But then does he rip the parachute from his shoulders, throw it to the floor, and say, “The stupid parachute!”? No, why should he? He didn’t put the parachute on for a better flight. He put it on to save him from the jump to come. If anything, the hot coffee incident causes him to cling tighter to the parachute and even look forward to the jump.  If we have put on the Lord Jesus Christ for the right motive—to flee from the wrath that’s to come—when tribulation strikes, when the flight gets bumpy, we won’t get angry at God, and we won’t lose our joy and peace. Why should we? We didn’t come to Christ for a better lifestyle, but to flee from the wrath to come.  If anything, tribulation drives the true believer closer to the Savior.

Sadly, we have multitudes of professing Christians who lose their joy and peace when the flight gets bumpy.  Why? They are the product of a man-centered gospel. They came lacking repentance, without which they cannot be saved.”

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings,
Pastor Phil
