title.rendered: What Gospel do you believe 2? By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“As we have said before, so I say again now, if any man is preaching to you a gospel contrary to that which you received, let him be anathema (accursed).”  (Galatians 1:9)

In part one of what gospel do you believe, some groundwork was laid showing the framework of the real gospel is not the gospel that everyone is following these days.  Paul was greatly disturbed recognizing that the Galatians in fact so quickly deserted the biblical Gospel for a different gospel.  Paul rebukes the Galatians for their departure of the true gospel for the false.  Perhaps through these messages, if you have left the biblical gospel for a false one, you too may hear the words of Paul rebuking you as well, and repent quickly.  

One of the “different gospels” in our day that is preached is surely the prosperity gospel.  What is the basis for the prosperity gospel?  Anyone who watches “TV evangelists” has no doubt heard the Prosperity Gospel.  A central tenet of the prosperity gospel is that God wills the financial prosperity of every Christian. If a believer lives in poverty, he/she is living outside God’s intended will. “You must realize that it is God’s will for you to prosper” (Copeland, Laws of Prosperity, p. 51).- Source: Word-Faith Movement , “Other Doctrines,” a Watchman Fellowship profile

Those that preach a prosperity gospel make some grave errors.  First, isn’t it interesting that many of these preachers don’t preach this gospel in the poorest areas of the world, where “financial blessing” it most needed, places like Calcutta India.  Secondly, the preachers are selfish and have vein conceit desiring you to send your faith seed (your money) to their ministry, or should I say their bank account?  Thirdly, they actually make it harder for people to get into the Kingdom, because the Kingdom of God then comes with a financial price tag, not simply laying one’s life down to follow the Christ.  It would follow suit then, that Hollywood celebrities don’t need Jesus, because they are wealthy already.  Is that a sign of God’s blessing on Hollywood out of their right relationship with the Father?  Fourthly, why are these prosperity preachers most often not using the financial gifts they receive through manipulating people with the World of God, to help the needy, to reach the unsaved?  God can certainly flow finances through a believer, for what end?  If anyone should have modeled a wealthy life, if according to the prosperity gospel, shouldn’t it have been Jesus?  He was born in a stable not a palace, as he grew up in common Jewish family.   Jesus made replied to one desiring to follow Him, “…The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head” (Matt,. 8:20).  This hardly sounds like the words of a wealthy man. Jesus said, “From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.”  Where are the prosperity preachers in their personal giving?  Recall Peter when He was asked to give alms by a needy person, to which Peter replied, “…Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.”  Peter gave the man the biblical gospel and demonstrated it in faith and power!  Proverbs 11:4 states, “Riches profit not in the day of judgment, but righteousness delivers from death.”  If a millionaire dies without the Savior his money will not impress God.  Jesus told the rich young ruler to sell all he had to follow Christ.  It wasn’t until the prodigal son lost all his money that he was humbled to repent toward God and his father.  The prosperity preachers are not preaching the biblical gospel.  Recall Simon the Sorcerer wanting to buy the power of the Holy Spirit.  Peter said, “Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.”  Perhaps you have been financially blessed of God, use it for His Glory and not your own.  W are not to “name it and claim it!”  He tells me what to do, not the reverse that is why He is Lord! 

Here are some links to further investigate the dangers of the Prosperity Gospel and the preaches associated with this false gospel.  Please be wise, let God be the Lord of your heart and finances.  Perhaps there is someone that you could financially bless, expecting nothing in return.  Our Father has a way of taking care of all of our needs, not our greeds  To be continued….

Until the nets are filled…Be watchful…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: What Gospel do you believe? By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Galatians 1:6–9 is a curse on anyone who distorts the gospel of Christ:

“I am amazed that you are so quickly deserting Him who called you by the grace of Christ, for a different gospel; which is really not another; only there are some who are disturbing you, and want to distort the gospel of Christ. But even though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you a gospel contrary to that which we have preached to you, let him be accursed. As we have said before, so I say again now, if any man is preaching to you a gospel contrary to that which you received, let him be anathema (accursed).”

We live in a world with the genuine and the counterfeit, the true and the false, the real and the fake.  We have genuine currency (monies) and counterfeit.  There are genuine works of art, and then there are frauds.  Ask any magician and he will tell you that fooling people is certainly possible as they use optical illusion to illustrate that the hand is quicker than the eye.   Therefore it should not be a surprise that there are false gospels in our time that attempt to go against the true gospel.  Paul gave a sober warning that anyone that preaches a distorted gospel will be anathema, that is to say accursed.  The gospel did not originate with man but with God, therefore who are we as humanity to come up with our own version of the gospel?  We must under any circumstances veer off from the gospel that Jesus preached.  The opening line of Paul’s warning states,” I am amazed that you are so quickly deserting Him who called you by the grace of Christ, for a different gospel; which is really not another; only there are some who are disturbing you, and want to distort the gospel of Christ.”  Turing to other gospels are always for selfish ambition and vain conceit as it puts the word of man above the Word of God.  Many in evangelicalism having certainly gone off the beaten path that our Lord paved by His blood, His life and His Word, and have abandon it for a different gospel.  This was happing in Paul’s day, hence the reason that he writes, therefore it should be of no surprise that the false gospels still corrode many lives today.

We live is a world that at one time used John 3:16 as the staple verse from the Word of God.  Now many use a new verse as the staple verse, “Do not judge, or you too will be judged (Matt 7:1).  This is said because many don’t want to call sin for what it is, sin.  These same people have not looked to the balance of this verse out of John’s gospel which reads, “Stop judging by mere appearances, and make a RIGHT JUDGMENT!”  When we use the Word of God we can call one that steals a thief, and one that tells lies, a liar.  I close part one with a quote from author and Pastor, John McArthur from His book the gospel according to Jesus writes, “The gospel in vogue today holds forth a false hope to sinners. It promises them they can have eternal life yet continue to live in rebellion against God. Indeed, it encourages people to claim Jesus as Savior yet defer until later the commitment to obey him as Lord.  It promises salvation from hell but not necessarily freedom from iniquity. It offers false security to people who revel in the sins of the flesh and spurn the way of holiness. By separating faith from faithfulness, it teaches that intellectual assent is as valid as wholehearted obedience to the truth.

Thus the good news of Christ has given way to the bad news of an insidious easy-believes that makes no moral demands on the lives of sinners. It is not the same message Jesus proclaimed.”  Is the gospel you believe, what Jesus preached?  Is the gospel your pastor preaches, the one that Jesus preached?  Examine your Bible, and your belief, do they line up?  In the following messages, I will share on some of the different gospels that many are embracing today such as the prosperity gospel, happiness gospel, the emergent gospel, the racist or prejudice gospel, the Mormon gospel, the Jehovah’s Witness gospel, the Muslim gospel and of course the Biblical Gospel (the one Jesus preached).  Please, examine the gospel you believe, is it truly the Gospel Jesus proclaimed, died for, and the one many today still die for?  If not repent, and believe the gospel, and be transformed by the truth of Christ.  Because of the seriousness of this issue, I welcome any responses to the crucial issue facing our lives today.

Until the nets are filled,
Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ephesians 4:32, “And be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God in Christ forgave you”

Sometime back someone gave us something he considered a joke, he said, “when a man meets a special woman who he develops a relationship that will hopefully lead to marriage, it reaches a point where the man gives the woman an Engagement RING, then on the wedding day, they exchange vows topped with wedding RING, then right after that you have suffeRING begins. It was funny and we laughed about it but later when I sat down to think about it, I wondered, is that what most men think that is what marriage is all about, suffering?

I want to present us with a ring that will replace the so called suffeRING and that is the CaRING that very necessary in a marriage. It’s easy to try and show that you care for your spouse in the presence of everyone but does it happen the same at home, in the absence of everyone. Would you be the same out there as you are in your home? The amplified version says 32, “And become useful and helpful and kind to one another, …”. Three words used “USEFUL”, “HELPFUL” and “KIND” all falling under the “CaRING”. How can you show you care if you are not useful, helpful and kind? You will only be deceiving yourself. Being useful would mean always ready for service and being advantageous to your spouse and not a burden or liability. Helpful would be to render assistance or service as sign that you care. Kind is you being considerate.

This is just a small encouragement to us in those little things we at times forget to do for each other to show that we care. Remember that you and your spouse are one. I see a way of having a CaRING is having a tender heart and not rigid heart. A heart of flesh and not a heart of stone. Stony hearts bounce things off, tender hearts accommodates, absorbs, evaluates, is willing to change, willing to learn. Tender to me would also mean, a ready heart already worked on. Out of this tender heart, forgiveness also flows. If you have a CaRING heart, even forgiving your spouse who has wronged you or you asking for forgiveness when you have wronged becomes easy.

In the light of CaRING, we can change the course and the direction of our marriages for those who are because we are not looking at it as SuffeRING as some do but CaRING as God would want us to do. Our marriages are what we make it. Today think about the last time you gave your spouse a CaRING then start to undo what you have done and start doing what you have not done. With this CaRING, I vow to…

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 6:8-23, “And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them”
To strengthen what I shared on yesterday, I would like to go off the scripture verse above and use a different scripture that ties to this. In Mark 4 from vs. 35, after Jesus had been teaching on the parables, He told the disciples to cross with Him to the other side. This required a boat and as they journeyed something happened, Mark 4:37, “And a great windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already filling. 38 But He was in the stern, asleep on a pillow”

Like Elisha, I believe Jesus knew that the moment they started crossing to the other side there was going to be a great windstorm. And knowing of what awaited them which was life threatening, He went to sleep at the bottom of the boat.  He was fast a sleep in the midst of the storm beating the boat and the water beginning to fill the boat. He must have been very comfortable in the storm and instead of the disciples being encouraged of Jesus in the boat despite the storm, they panicked and became hysterical.

Something to ponder on, how would you have dealt with the same situation?. You have the storm beating and filling the boat with water while Jesus is in the boat? Would you have been like the disciples? Here are some of the things if they had thought about would have made them comfortable in the storm. One, Jesus was present in the boat, that alone should have been comfort to make them comfortable. Two, did they think Jesus could drown? He was (is) God.  Three, did they think the wind had power over Him? But no, they went to find Jesus where He was a sleep and launched a complaint and this is what they said Mark 4:38, “…“Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”. In the midst of the storm they felt left alone and hopeless with the assumption that Jesus did not care but come to think about it, Jesus cared enough for them to be present right in the midst of the storm. HIS PRESENCE WAS ENOUGH WITHOUT HIS ACTS.   When they woke Him up from the sleep, He dealt with the situation. He said, “Peace, be still”.  The storm was not defeated when He spoke, it was defeated the moment He was present in the boat.

This should be an encouragement to us that when Jesus is in this boat (US), we can never sink and drown simply because He cannot drown. I know for myself when the windstorm comes the first thing is panic then try to find ways to calm the storm instead of calming my nerves and encouraging myself that Jesus is present in this boat. What a comfort we have that Jesus is ever present even the times we feel we are facing storms that try to display His absence. He has said that He will never leave us, nor forsake us, that is His promise. Greater is He that lives inside of us than He that is in the world.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
2 Kings 6:8-23, “And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them”
1John 4:4, “Ye are of God ye little children for you have overcome them, for greater is He that is in you that he that is in the world”. Elisha was an ordinary man with an extraordinary anointing. There is nothing good in him but the Power and the presence of God and so when you begin to see enemies scattered and put to shame, it’s not because they are threatened by you, it’s because of the one greater in you. The bible says, in Psalm 68:1, “Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered”.

In the passage on 2 Kings 6, the king of Syria discovered that Elisha did not have an army, just his servant. Why would a king who has discovered that Elisha has no army send an army on horses and chariots to pursue after him? Of course they knew Elisha was not even wearing combat gear to face the Syria’s army. They could have sent maybe like 10 people or less and they would captured him without any problem. I believe the reason why they sent an army is because of what they had seen in Elisha. We face situations like that, facing the enemy of our soul but because of Him in us, we are at peace. It amazes me how we constantly bind an enemy whose existence is already threatened by the existence of the Savior. Yes there are days to bind him, not always. What did Jesus tell Peter, “upon this rock I will build my church and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it”. Let’s not forget who we are  and whose we are

In the morning in vs. 15 the servant of Elisha woke up and went out and behold there was a great army surrounding the place where he and Elisha camped. Now let’s back up here for a minute, if you look in the previous vs. you will find that Elisha knew things that were done or said in secret, he was a prophet. I believe he already knew they were surrounded yet he was still able to sleep peacefully till morning. What an amazing thing, the presence of God made him comfortable in a situation that would make his servant terrified. I saw this with Peter who was able to sleep peacefully in jail and so was Daniel in the lion’s den. This is where we are different from the unsaved, they can only sleep peacefully or be calm when they know for sure that everything is okay. Their peace comes when everything is going the right way for us believers we get it in both ways whether things be good or bad for it’s not even us but God inside of us. The bible says that the peace of God surpasses all human understanding. Mark the word the peace of God, it’s not even our peace but His peace. That is why I don’t get surprised when I see some Christians go through some things and yet they are still maintain peace, they should be worrying about it but they are not in fact they go to sleep. Hysterical people use more energy trying to worry and fix stuff but someone who has the peace of God inside has nothing to worry about. He can speak out peace because he has it in. Someone once said, “NOTHING IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A MAN WHO DOESN’T HAVE TO DO IT HIMSELF”. That is comfort to me.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 6:8-23, “And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them”

Our God is a mighty man of war that is something that we can never forget. He knows how battle His enemies in the battlefield. He does not fight according to Men’s ways but His. There are days He battles for us and there are days He teaches us to battle. Many times we may not be prepared for the battle but He is, we may be caught un aware, He is always aware. Psalm 46:1, “…He is a very PRESENT help in trouble”.

Elisha in our text was a prophet of God and not a warrior. I’m not sure if he even knew how to use an arrow but he is feared of men in every land. In our text we see him as a prophet in Israel but during this time, Syria and Israel were at war. What has helping Israel was God on their side and that made Syria to really fear Israel. Now I understand why Moses would not go anywhere without the presence of God, Exodus 33:14. God had made a covenant with Israel that He would fight and defend them. He would go before them by day as a cloud of wind and by night as a pillar of fire. Everywhere they went, they took over the land because God was with them and as long as the Lord was with them, their forces and powers doubled. Can you imagine everywhere you go and everything that you deal with, your enemies become subject to you simply because the presence of God is upon you? I believe that I can go anywhere, be anyone God wants me to be and survive anything as long as the presence of God is with me. I can cross the sea, climb the mountain, face the committee, face situations and survive, be a good leader as long as His presence is with me for without Him, I can do nothing, John 15:5. Putting our trust and submitting to God allows His presence to accompany us everywhere for we give Him permission to be the Lord of our lives and not just the Savior alone. Psalm 37:23, “The good steps of a righteous man are ordered of the Lord”, Prov 3:5, “Trust in the Lord and lean not on thy own understanding, in all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your path”. How can one order our steps and direct our paths if He is not with us? We constantly need to seek His presence that we may overcome. Moses could only deliver the children of Israel because the presence of God was with him. He was not a warrior, he did not have an army, all he had as a stave of a shepherd and the Lord. That is all He needed to deliver the Israelites from their enemies. If you are ever going to do the impossible, it will happen because the Lord is with you. Lord let your presence be with us every single day that we may live and be over comers for you.
Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Timothy 4:12, “Let no man despise your youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in purity”

According to the dictionary definition, an ambassador is a diplomatic official of the highest rank appointed and credited as representative in residence by one government or sovereign to another. Also an ambassador can be defined as an authorized messenger or representative. Let’s look at how it is presented to us in the bible, this name is used by the apostles as designating those who are appointed by God to declare His will”.

To sum it, an ambassador is a representative mostly for a country in another nation. An ambassador is not APPOINTED and not ELECTED. By that I mean, there are no ballots cast to be one. Within the fences of ambassador’s offices in other countries are considered as the country they representing.  We have been allowed an awesome opportunity as Christians to be Ambassadors for Christ here on earth, it’s a high rank. We are representing the Kingdom of God. We have not been elected but appointed by God, 1Peter 2:9, says “9 But you are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, His own special people, that you may proclaim the praises of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvelous light;”. We are chosen to represent the Kingdom of God every where we go and we have been allowed to have some type of dwelling that those who are running looking for shelter can find refuge in our midst for there is safety within. Paul writes to Timothy and shares with him a few things that he needs to keep in mind as a representative. As a representative, what you portray out there is what people will think of the kingdom you are representing. Paul encourages him number one not to allow any man to despise his youth. When we understand that we are not called on the merit of age or knowledge, we begin to look at ourselves the way God does. When God approached Jeremiah and told him that He had appointed him to be an ambassador, what did he say, “I am just but a child” and God tells him in Jeremiah 1:5, “5 “ Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; Before you were born I sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet (ambassador) to the nations”. He already predestined each of us and He tells him not to be afraid for the calling was already .

After Paul’s tells Timothy not to allow any man to despise his youth, he encourages him by telling him to be an example of the believers in other words, be a model, a pattern of the believers. You know what, it’s hard to represent the kingdom when your life is not right with God and that is because you will not know what is accepted by Kingdom of God. The bible says that a man’s ways are right in his own eyes but the end is destruction and that is why my prayer is as an ambassador is in, Psalm 25:4&5, “Teach me Your paths.

5 Lead me in Your truth and teach me, For You are the God of my salvation; On You I wait all the day”, Psalm 86:10, Teach me Your way, O LORD; I will walk in Your truth; Unite my heart to fear Your name.”. If we are going to be representatives, we got be learners of the word of God. We got to be taught in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in purity. A heavenly representative should have these qualities to back up what they confess. It’s one thing to confess, it’s another thing to live according to your confession. I know that even at Awards people talk about the Lord and all that, but I come back to look at their lifestyle and some lead other’s astray and I say, Math 7:16, “Ye shall know them by their fruits”. We too cannot just speak what is right, we got to live by our confession otherwise we will have no fruits to show and we will be deceiving ourselves and others. With your confession, I want to see the fruit to back it up and the same is expected of me. I am an ambassador for Christ therefore I will represent Him and His kingdom down here on earth through the word, in my conversation, in charity, in spirit and in purity.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 37:3, “And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah:, “This is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth”

Christians ought to be plugged in a church to be fed, ministered to and to be used to serve. It’s good to come to receive, then reaches a point where the receiving time ceases and you not give, a time to maximize the gifts inside of you. The bible says that, “It’s blessed to give than receive”. When you give, you are not running dry as someone may want you to believe so. I find that I am more blessed and encouraged in giving encouragements and the reason is, the more I encourage, the more I get encouraged.

You will agree with me that there are many good things that are happening and yet there is less strength to accomplish them. New responsibilities, ministries, positions, converts, seeds to be planted and yet many have no strength to bring them forth. People are scared of moving for they feel they will mess up, feel like they are not able and the like. There are certain gifts you know god has blessed you with, but there is no strength to fully bring them forth. You have desires and dreams, when you look at your current situation and the things that are standing on the way, you just can’t see how in the world you can deliver what has been invested in you.

If it was not invested, it would be another story. I’m talking about something that is tangible, something you can see the signs, something that you know you have but bringing it out becomes the problem. You are now stuck with alive baby inside of you because you have no strength to deliver. Believe me, many are going to end this life still carrying inside what they should have brought forth. King Hezekiah had the king of Assyria bring a lot of threats to his kingdom and the king of Assyria even went ahead to say that even God would not deliver Hezekiah and therefore he shouldn’t trust in Him. King Hezekiah had something inside of him and that is the trust that God was able and would deliver him and his people but I don’t think that there were so many people in his kingdom who had that kind of faith. Not only did he believe, he also confessed it and acted on his confession. He went to the temple with some of the elders and priests. He also sent a message to Isaiah the prophet. This was the message to Isaiah,  Isaiah 37:3, “And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah:, “This is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy;” I paused for a second and wondered why it was a day of trouble and I began to see that the people believed inside it could happen but there was no evidence on the outside to show that they were ready for what the Lord was going to do. It’s good to know it inside, but what is inside has to be practiced outside. You can believe that God is able but until you engage your faith into action and confess it, it will still be inside trapped. Romans 10:10, “For with the heart man believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation”. It’s by the confession that you birth salvation. Believing alone will not help, confession will do you a greater service. The woman with the issue of blood believed inside, that is what kept her pregnant and when she began to confess, she began to push out what was inside of her.

Isaiah 37:3, “…for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth”. There are certain things God has already placed in us, they are ready but the question is, are we ready? The gifting are at the peak of being birthed, the ministries are yet to be birthed but are you ready? there are preachers, prayer warriors, teachers, prophets and prophetess, pastors in our midst. Are you feeling like there is something in you that the Lord could birth but you have no strength, (enough faith to believe it can happen?). Are you still holding onto something that should have been birthed by now? I still have certain things that I’m pregnant with but have less strength to birth them. I have seen the signs, I know they are there and I can’t keep on holding them inside for they are due for birth. Help me Lord, I have new responsibilities I need to birth, moving to greater levels I need to birth, zeal to win souls I need to birth. It’s tough, scary and painful but I can’t die holding onto this thing inside of me. Lord strengthen my faith to birth what is inside. Bring Forth What Is Inside!!!!

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

5 While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him. 6 And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid. 7 And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid. 8 And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

In 1999 I had the privilege of going to visit the Holy Land.  As we traveled around the places that Jesus had once stepped, I noticed that wherever Jesus did something significant, a church was built to commemorate the act.  The famous Church of the Holy Sepulcher had four denominations claiming the church.  This was separated by tiles, which the Greeks, Catholics, Ethiopian Orthodox, and _____________all lay claim to.   There was so much building of religious structures, yet so many that obviously didn’t have Jesus.

Many religious groups seem to claim allegiance to God through religious buildings, tradition, and religious acts.  Has the story of the Transfiguration been somewhat of a mystery to you?    Jesus was transfigured Jesus’ three closest disciples, Peter, James and John, and they were privy to see Moses and Elijah standing with Jesus.  Peter had an idea to build three tabernacles, one for Moses, one for Elijah, and of course one for Jesus.   Was this a bad idea?  It was certainly typical, like many of the acclaimed religious building in Israel.  God seemed to interrupt Peter as the voice spoke from the cloud saying, “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”  God’s emphasized His son, and didn’t even mention His two faithful servants Moses and Elijah.  The men fell on their faces and were sore afraid.  Moses represented the Law, and Elijah represented the Prophets, Jesus of course was the fulfillment of the Law, and the One to which the Prophets spoke of.  Truly with all our traditions in church, and all our attempts to be holy be trying to keep the Law, and all our prophesying (preaching), Jesus must shine.  Jesus said, “Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfill” (Matthew 5:17).  What is it that fulfils the Law and the Prophets?  Think back to the teacher of the Law (a Pharisee) who was testing Jesus after they had heard he silenced the Sadducees with His words.  The question was asked what is the great commandment in the Law.  Jesus answered You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’ 38 This is the first and great commandment. 39 And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ 40 On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.  Is this not the picture at the transfiguration.  Everything the Law was saying and everything the Prophets spoke hangs upon Jesus Christ.   The law of love, the prophetic word of love is what is often not seen.  If we are to honor Christ, we must love God and love people, and stop making our emphasis on building tabernacles for Moses and Elijah.  We don’t need a more elaborate Bible, we need to spend time hearing from God with Word of God.  We don’t need a bigger building, a television ministry, a big revival meeting.  We simply need to obey God to love him and love people.  We need to spend and be spent doing this, as this is what God Himself deemed to be paramount, and so much so it is a command.  It is the Great Commandment, not the great idea, not the great suggestion, and not the great option.  So Christian, do you spend your time loving God and loving people.  If not, then you side with Peter and are perhaps well meaning in building tabernacles to Moses and Elijah, but not touching the very heartbeat of God.  We need to get on our heart what is on the heart of the Father.  In the end God, His Word, and the souls or spirits of people will be all that remains.  If Moses and Elijah hand upon Jesus, and you have Jesus in your life, then where is the shinning of that love emanating from your life?   Make it a point to keep the main thing, the main thing.  Do it today! 

By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 1:8, “A double minded man is unstable in all his ways”

We always want clear sense of direction when making major decisions. There are times we seek advise in situations to help us make better judgments. From my experience, it’s very dangerous to make hasty decisions without weighing things. People can advice and give guidance, final decision should be your responsibility.

With that in mind, we go back to the standard set for us in heaven for us to live by.. James 4:8, “Draw nigh unto God, and He will draw nigh to you, cleanse your hands ye sinners and purify your hearts, ye double minded”. I believe that sin can soil our hearts and minds that we become desensitized to what is clear and required of God and so anything that we do, we do it either ignorantly or we just don’t care. We can be pulled by things that are enticing with a promise to give fulfillment and happiness only to find out later that it was a trap. One side of you pulls you to what is right, the other side pulls you to something that looks right. You are set in the middle trying to make a wise decision as to what path to take. It’s either black or white, no shades of gray in the middle; it’s either right or wrong can’t accept both at the same time and a choice has to be made. I’m amazed that some can have a foot in the church and have another in the world, they worship today tomorrow you see them doing something else, James tells us something interesting, he says that for you to be single minded, you need to draw nigh to God and God will draw nigh to you and as you draw nigh to God, God begins to cause you to see things clearly where you have to make a choice of cleansing your hands and purifying your heart. You will not know what is right until you have encountered with the truth. John 8:32, “And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free”. It’s not just a matter of knowing the truth, many already do, it’s a matter of knowing the truth, walking it, living it, exercising it as it has a way of making you a single minded person.

John 14:6, “Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth and the life, no man cometh to then Father, but by me”. We can see Jesus singling Himself out by calling Himself THE WAY, THE TRUTH, and THE LIFE. If He had used the word A in stead of THE, then He would be another option but when He said HE IS, then this teaches us that the only way we can have a single mind is by trusting in Jesus a lone for salvation, guidance, protection, provision and every other thing that we could ever need. A double minded person will try and have other options, like trust in God today but also have connections to psychic, or trust in God and have his faith on the lottery ticket in his hands.  It’s hard to have focus, direction, purpose, vision, and conviction because he has the ability of changing his mind anytime. Psalm 118:8, “It is better to trust in the Lord than to put your confidence in man”, He says, “Choose ye this day whom you will serve“, “Behold I have set before you curses and blessings, choose wisely“. A single minded person will choose wisely without feeling pressured into something that he knows is not acceptable.

James 1:8, “A double minded man is unstable in all his was”. I could say “Double” word is applying apply equality in the things that come in one’s way and now he or she is set to battle which way to go. The verse concludes by saying that such a person is unstable in all his ways simply because they will be tossed around by everything that comes their way. They will believe any doctrine that comes their way, they will always be convinced by others to take a different direction.

Isaiah 26:3, “Thou shall keep him in perfect peace whose mind stays on thee”, let’s keep our minds to stay (dwell) on Him, Romans 12:2, “And be ye not conformed to this world, but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove that which is good acceptable, and perfect will of God”. The patterns and life style in this world would cause your mind and mine to wonder and that is why the bible says not to be conformed by it. Let our minds be transformed and renewed that we may prove (test) what is good not what we perceive to be good. Jesus had a single mind and Paul encourages us in Philippians 2:5, “Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus…”

See how the mind plays one of the major roles in a human life, the devil attacks the mind and so the Lord deals with the heart first because if He can get to the heart, the heart will transform the entire body including the mind. All defeat, pride, lust, deceptions begin in the mind so we need to guard the mind all cost to think on what is acceptable will of God in Christ Jesus. Let’s have single minds which comes from looking unto Jesus the Author and the Finisher of our faith. Have the mind of Christ, a sound mind and uncorrupted.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
T’was a dark and dreadful night
As we paddled the oars with our might
Pondering over the miraculous sign
When our master fed five thousand a time

In a moment I gazed upon the fighre walking by
“Are you a ghost,” I screamed as I was alarmed
Just then I heard the familiar voice, “It is I”
For I was relieved seeing my master around

I’ve never seen this before though I’ve traded in there
I’d questioned myself about how he got there
Mustering my courage I asked, “Master, bid me to come”
One direct command echoed my ears, “Come”

Stepping out, I looked into my master’s eyes
As I inched my feet, taking baby steps in life
Was it a dream, or am I creating my destiny
The true report, I, Peter: “Walking on the sea.”

A few steps from my master, panic set in
As I was gently tossed and blown by the wind
I questioned myself, would this wind sink me down
And as I thought so, my feet began to sink me down

Struck down by fear, I screamed out “Lord save me”
Instantly, he reached out his hand and caught me
Saving me, he said, “You of little faith, why did you doubt.”
Walking back to the boat, he talked me out of my doubt.

So friends, let not fear cripple your faith
When you’ve reached the end of your dreams
Looking towards the master, lock your eyes onto him
As he watches you till the end of your dreams.
-Sheeju

Adapted from Mathew 14: 22-31

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 16:21&22, “Then the Philistines took him and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza. They bound him with bronze fetters, and he became a grinder in the prison. 22 However, the hair of his head began to grow again after it had been shaven”

If I was take a few words to describe Samson, I would say he was a miracle child number one. The mother was barren and was visited by an angel who promised her that God would touch her barren womb and she would bring forth a son. God had a purpose and a mission for the child to be born and we are told of it in Judges 13:5 For behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. And no razor shall come upon his head, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb; and he shall begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.” Samson was to be a consecrated child and the demonstration of God’s presence in his life was his hair growing and never cut from birth. This was to be an ordinary child with an extraordinary gift bestowed upon him by God. The symbol of his strength was in the 7 long locks of his hair. The parents were instructed on how to raise him after he was born and I believe they did.

Judges 16:24, “…and the child grew, and the LORD blessed him. 25 And the Spirit of the LORD began to move upon him at Mahaneh Dan between Zorah and Eshtaol”. One thing I can say, we were all miracle babies. In the midst of the complications and what could have happened, God sustained each of us because He had a purpose and a mission for us. The great things a parent can do for a child is pray for them, teach them God’s ways, speak God’s destiny in their lives and live by example. I believe that as a child is growing up before they are at the age they know the Lord and I don’t mean know about the Lord, God uses the parents to prepare them to know the Lord. I remember growing up, I was taught the things of God, taught how to live according to God’s ways. I remember at the age of 4 when my dad would take me to mission fields with him. He would preach and we would sing together but I did not know more of what it was all about. He kept on praying for me and his other children that in due time, they will come to know God and God use them. For me when I became of age, I didn’t want anything to do with God, something that I have seen with many kids who came from Christian families.

Proverbs 22:6, says, “Train a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not turn from it.” As we know God’s word is true, and this verse is true even though it may not sound like it, think of it this way, how many kids came from a Christian home, raised according to God’s ways, parents prayed for them, instilled great values, fed and clothed them and when they were of age and should have turned to God, they rebelled against their parents and more so God? How would we apply this scripture to this situation? Here it is, you train the child in the way he/she should go and when he/she is old, what you trained him/her will not depart from his/her life. They may try and go against it but it will always linger in their minds. Samson parents raised him God’s way and when he was of age and God began to use him, he also began to go against how his parents raised him.

If you’ve raised your children in God’s ways, remember that the teachings will not depart from them and God knows how to use those teachings to bring them back to His purpose and mission for their lives, so don’t be discouraged or give up, keep praying. To continue

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 1:1, In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth, John 1:1-5, vs. 1, ” In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God”

To read the bible, you have to believe everything that is written. There are people including Christians who choose what they can believe in the bible and reject the rest. In their mind, they don’t see how such and such a thing could happen and so they sum it up as good stories to teach us something but not necessarily what happened. How many people find it hard to believe God parting the red sea or Noah and the ark? They conclude they are too good to be true. For me to understand that all things are possible, I have to go back to the beginning.

Genesis starts with this line, “in the beginning GOD” and In the gospel according to John, he does not begin with Jesus’ birth, or his genealogy or the beginning of his ministry, he takes us back to creation. If I can go back to the beginning and see how things began, I can understand the future for I know whose hand is on it. John starts his writing with vs. 1, “In the beginning was the Word”, in other words, in the beginning GOD. Before anything was created, God was already existing. Not restricted with time for He is eternal. God is the beginning and your life and my mine starts and ends with Him. If “in the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God”, then the truth is the bible is His Word and His Word has no lies or errors, we can trust His word.

It all started with God who is the Word, He spoke His Word to what did not exist that it may exist. Only God in and of the beginning could create things out of nothing the concept many have a problem with. People can make things out of things, God made things out of nothing. As the Word, He spoke things into existence, that is creation, In Isaiah 55:11, this is strengthen with the bible saying , “So shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth; It shall not return to Me void, But it shall accomplish what I please, And it shall prosper in the thing for which I sent it”. He created everything and there is nothing too difficult for Him.

He created us (man) meaning created our spirit out of nothing but then did something that he did not do with any of His other creation and that is, He formed us out of something, Genesis 2:7, “And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living being”. Of all the creation He spoke into existence, He further reached out to the ground and formed man which distinguishes us from any other creation. His hand has been on man from the beginning till now. That He was so mindful of man that He picked dust from the ground formed which I would say designed, breathed into His nostril the breath of life and man became a living being. What an amazing beginning, this should throw out any doubts you may have had about God of His word. Creating you was a miracle, saving you was the greatest miracle, His hand on your life is a continuous miracle. The beginning changes my destiny for “I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day” 2 Timothy 1:12. If you ever find yourself doubting whether things are possible, whether His hand is upon your life or whether His word is true, just take a trip back to the beginning

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The Lord Is My Everything, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 27:1-14, “Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord”

We looked at David taking time to personalize what the Lord is to him. He is not reducing or trying to make God in his own way, he understands who the Lord is and how the Lord is his help therefore he calls him My strength, My joy, My Hope, My healer, My deliverer, My confidence, My peace, My guide, My light, My redeemer. Lord becomes to us what we are not.
Psalm 27:5, “5For in the time of trouble He shall hide me in His pavilion; In the secret place of His tabernacle He shall hide me; He shall set me high upon a rock”. Where do you first run to when you are in trouble? do you run to your buddies or to the Lord first. When you fall, who do you call on? Psalm 18:3, “I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from my enemies”, Romans 10:13, “For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved”. When we call on the name of the Lord, the strong tower, we give Him permission to hide us in His pavilion (dwelling place) where no enemy enter. Not only will He hide me, He will also shelter me in His tabernacle. When He has blessed me, He shall set me high upon the rock where I can display His goodness. Everything the Lord is doing our lives is to bring Him glory so I give Him glory by praising Him and letting people know of what He has done in my life that someone somewhere can believe in Him too for a blessing.  Set upon the rock is being set on Him for He is the Rock of Ages and what a blessing to know that He has raised me up above my enemies.
The Lord is my everything, He is My mother and My father, my earthly parents are just demonstrating who He is to me. Psalm 27:10, “When my father and mother forsake me, The Lord will take care of me”. Glad know that even if we are forsaken by those who are close to us, He will not leave or forsake us. The bible says that He the Father to the fatherless, He is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
Psalm 27:11, “Teach me You way, O Lord and lead me in a smooth path, because of my enemies”. There is a great difference between knowing the ways of the Lord and knowing the acts of the Lord. The bible says that unto the children of Israel, God showed them His acts but unto Moses, He showed him His ways. When you only know the acts of the Lord, You will only rejoice when things are done but the moment nothing is happening, chances are, you will complain. Knowing the ways of the Lord changes the way you think and how you perceive God for even if He does not do it, does not mean He is not able. He could have delayed it, He could teaching you something, He is building a people with a destiny and so we rejoice in every step because we know His ways.  Psalm 86:11, “Teach me your ways O Lord and I will walk in Your truth, unite my heart to fear you name”, Psalm 37:5, “Commit your ways to the Lord, trust also in Him, and He shall bring it to pass”, Psalm 25:4, “Show me Your ways, Oh Lord, teach me thy paths, lead me in Your truth and teach”. Would you rather know the acts of the Lord or know His ways?
Psalm 27:13, “I would have lost heart, unless I had believed that I would see the goodness of the LORD In the land of the living”, How many times I have felt like giving up, giving in and calling it a quit. KJ says, “I would have fainted”. Christ is our heartbeat, many times we faint because we stopped believing. David says that I was tempted to stop believing but that caused me to almost faint and loose heart. It’s was getting too much and the journey was long and tiring but I could not stop believing in Him to bring me to a place where I could see His goodness in the land of the living, the bible says, “The race is not for the swift neither is the battle for the strong but for those who endure till the end”, rest if you must but do not faint, don’t stop trusting God where you are, keep fighting the good fight of a soldier enduring shame as the elect of Christ. Believe God to bring you to a place where you can see His goodness in the land of the living.
Psalm 27:14, “Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord”, We will wait for the Lord and I don’t mean sit down and keep checking our watch to see if He is coming but doing what the waiter and the waitresses do, they wait on people who come to the restaurant. Their waiting means working, serving, reaching out, making sure that someone has what they need and so is with us, we have to believe God for greater things, but we have to reach out to God by doing something. When He calls me, I will answer for I will be somewhere working for the Lord. Your blessing and my blessings many times comes as a result of service so I wait on the Lord for HE IS MY EVERYTHING.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The Lord Is My Everything, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 27:1-14, “Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord”

This is one of those days I have come in and did not know what the Lord would have me share on but our God is faithful, He’s words never fail for He is the Word and because He is the Word, He will give us His food everyday at the right time and at the right place. Well He has set a table before us therefore lets dine.

The division of Psalms 27 talks about many things as the Psalmist is giving description of what the Lord is to him. The first verse he tells us that the Lord is his light, then his salvation, a strong hold, he mentions the beauty of the Lord, his helper and also mentions the goodness of the Lord. It’s hard to have a hero without knowing his strengths especially when you depend on him, in our case our Hero is Jesus but like David we got to know who He is to us. Many cannot move because they do not know or understand what the Almighty God is capable of handling and if that is not enough, they do not understand when they can call on the Lord, they don’t know whether it’s too late or too early to believe God for something but I would say that Psalm 46:1 says, “God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble”. This verse alone sums it up for number one, God is our refuge to which I would say that we have enemies and overwhelming things but the Lord is our refuge, a place to hide. Not only is He our refuge, He is also “our strength” for He lives in side of us.  We are going in His strength and not anyone’s. He is also “present” any time, all the time, never will He leave, He is always with us. I heard Him say, “Lo I will be with you always” and then He is “our help” in trouble and who does not face troubles?

With this established, David tells us in verse 1&2, “The Lord is my light and my salvation-whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life- of whom shall I be afraid? It is very important to personalize what the Lord is to you and not generalize it. When we generalize, we feel like He can do it for others but us. When we understand who God is to us, we can confidently refer to Him us our light and salvation. The Psalmists knows that he has enemies and an army stationed against him, but with God on his side, he is set even if there are more armies against him. 1Tim 1:12, …For I am persuaded that He is able…” meaning I am more than convinced that He can and He will so I will be confident not in myself but in Him.

Psalm 27:4, “4One thing I have desired of the LORD, That will I seek: That I may dwell in the house of the LORD All the days of my life, To behold the beauty of the LORD, And to inquire in His temple” It’s easy to believe God and do nothing about it, here we have a psalmist who believes God and puts his faith in God to seek the Him.  Seeking the Lord has away of removing all the fears and doubts for the presence of the Lord like a fire consumes everything including that which is wet. When Elijah called fire from heaven, though we know it’s hard for fire to consume water and stones, the fire of God consumed everything. When we seek God, His fire will come down and consume the stones of pride in our lives, stones of doubt, and everything that will try and put off the fire. Yes He is around all the time and many times you may not feel Him but seeking Him gives you a chance to find Him. Then he says, “That I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life”. Mmmm being in the house of the Lord? I wonder whether we all desire to be in the house of the Lord forever, cause to some, during the times they could be in the house of the Lord, they would rather do other things, may I remind you that the house of the Lord is the type of Ship that sails on top of the world. Again it’s the type of ship that sails on top of what the world is sinking in. The church is a place of refuge, yes we can meet God everywhere but I found that there is such a greater connection when I am in His house. David loved the house of the Lord that he gives this line to us in Psalms 84:10, “For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand elsewhere, I’d rather be a door keeper in the house of the Lord than to dwell in the tents of the wickedness”. Imagine one day in the house of the Lord is better than days going parties, camping, vacation.  “To behold the beauty of the LORD, And to inquire in His temple”. Behold is to view, observe, see, watch or take a look at the beauty of the Lord, His holiness, His Majestic splendor, His  Excellency, how precious, gracious, merciful, powerful, present, the beauty of the Lord we behold when we come to seek Him. It’s in the process of beholding His beauty that we discover even more, He is Yahweh who has no beginning or end, He has no birth dates and He does not need anything to make Him complete for He is complete within Himself lacking nothing. In 1John 3:2, “…for we shall see Him as He is”, not as we perceive of Him or thought of Him but as HE IS. I found that the more I beheld His beauty, the more all my fears, doubt, confusion ran away for I allowed all these things to know who the Boss is, this have been the times I was reminded even more that if He does not come through for me, there will be no way out. Seek Him that you may see Him as HE IS.
Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 119:89, “For ever, O Lord, thy word is settled in heaven”, Proverbs 30:5, “Every word of God is pure:…”

I hate being deceived in anyway especially through the word of God preached by someone else. I am becoming very cautious about who preaching the teaching I listen as many today distort the word, preach error and heresy. They sound good and powerful but you find that it’s not in line with the word of God if you study His word. There are people now who are trying to update the word of God thinking part of it is outdated. Just because many revised edition books go through revisions to keep up with the current world does not mean the bible falls under that category, it’s content and meaning have never and will never change. You cannot take out anything or add anything to His word. The bible already states, “FOREVER, O LORD, THY WORD IS SETTLED IN HEAVEN” period. It addresses past, present and future.

The word of God is God Himself revealed to us that to know Him. The word of God is the manual book for believers. His word is our light that guides us through this walk of life. God speaks to us through His to know what He requires of us. How will we know what is acceptable if we are not grounded and reading the word? In as much as we can be inspired through preaching, we have to be in a position where we can also get into the word and read it for ourselves and check it out. 2Tim 2:15, says “Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.”(KJV). The word of God cannot be repaired or changed, it is able by itself to do that which it purposes to do. His word has stood through the test of time. Psalm 119:89, “For ever, O Lord, thy word is settled in heaven”, His word is settled to which I can say it has defended itself and Christians know it’s ability to save, deliver, heal, provide, protect and the like. Over and over and over again we see the word going through the fire and coming out the same for we are told in Proverbs 30:5, “Every word of God is pure: “. His words are not corrupted and never will. Isaiah 40:8, “The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of the Lord shall stand forever”, If we are grounded in the word, we will stand.

If you think the word is not being distorted today, think again. Today people want the bible to mean what they want it to mean rather than what the Author intended for it to mean. There are people who are now going back to the word of God and saying some of the things written were not actually what the bible meant when it said them or the bible was addressing the people of that time and not it’s not applicable to our day so we have books and messages as revised edition to the word of God?. Do you know that there are people who are beginning to believe that David and Jonathan had a homosexual relationship? And so was Naomi and Ruth because the bible says they were close?. What’s next?? We are living in times where if we don’t know the word and grounded in sound doctrine, like many, we will be deceived, living a lie. We as Christians need to be discerning by the help of the Holy Spirit and His word that we may live by the truth that the truth may set us free. Be careful of who feeds you and be careful of those who try to revise the word of God to change the meanings.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Kings 4:38-41, vs. 40, “Then they served it to the men to eat. Now it happened, as they were eating the stew, that they cried out and said, “Man of God, there is death in the pot!” And they could not eat it”

There was famine in the land of Gilgal. It wasn’t famine for truth or love, it was starvation for food. Now Elisha the man of God was with the sons of the prophets who I believe looked up to him as a great prophet and a leader. They knew him as a miracle worker too and even in the midst of this great famine, they believed God could provide a way through his servant Elisha. Elisha therefore tells his servant to Put on the large pot, and boil stew for the sons of the prophet vs. 39, So one went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered from it a lapful of wild gourds, and came and sliced them into the pot of stew, though they did not know what they were”. They were starving for food, in the process of setting the pot for stew, they still needed to find something to cook in that pot. Without knowing what to do, they bumped into some herbs and wild vine and cooked them anyway. Like these men, have you found yourself in the midst of something you knew you had to do, you wanted to do right and tried different things hoping they would work? I have. The bible says that after they cooked and served. It happened that as they were eating the stew, they cried out to the man of God saying, “there is death in the pot”. How is it that what is suppose to be good and sustain life was life threatening? How is it that in the midst of trying to live by the ten commandments to which many do only brings death? We want to live by the golden rule, do good that we may live but the more we eat from the pot of the commandments we find that there is death in it.

Paul desired the stew of the law and when he started to eat from the pot of the law, he ran into a king size problem and he tells us in Romans 7:10, “And the commandment, which was to bring life, I found to bring death, 7:13, “Has then what is good (commandments) become death to me? Certainly not! But sin, that it might appear sin, was producing death in me through what is good, so that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful”. Maybe Elisha would have not been affected by the stew which is a representation of Jesus who could eat from the pot of death and not die. It was to be a pot to restore life only that it brought death. I tried to live by the stew in the pot, it only brought me death because of my sinful nature that reminds me that I do not have a system that can defeat this death in the pot.

2 Kings 4:41 So he said, “Then bring some flour.” And he put it into the pot, and said, “Serve it to the people, that they may eat.” And there was nothing harmful in the pot”, Is this not like what Jesus did for us, while there was death in the pot, he bled and died, rose and again and defeated death, now when we repent and put our trust in Him alone for our eternal salvation, we too have defeated death and we can eat from the pot and live because of what He has done. Elisha did not get rid of the stew and God also not get rid of the law. Elisha had flour put into the pot and served the people and so did God send His son in this pot we call earth and defeated its power over us therefore if you are not saved and are trying to live by the stew of commandments in this pot of life, rest be assured, there is death in the pot and only Jesus Christ has the cure for that stew. Repent of your sins, put your trust in Jesus Christ alone for your eternal salvation and you will pass from death to life, no more will there be death in the pot.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Deut 2:1-4, “…You have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you  northward”

It’s easy to talk about trust and be led of God but when it comes to the actual action it becomes a little bit hard because of what we have trained ourselves to think of ourselves. I don’t know how many times I have talked about trusting in God to lead and then  felt like I was by myself or I did not see how things were going to come out in the long run and if you’ve noticed, the Lord tells us things but He never explains Himself.

When God called the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, the plan was to bring them to the promise land. When the Lord begins to do something, He already has an end result for it and so when He begins to do it, it’s not for Him to try and see if it would work but for Him to finish what He has began. We could start with Him and then give up but He will not. We see Him bring His people through the desert ultimately that He may bring them to the land He promised them. All of a sudden there are obstacles, barriers, partitions, walls, valleys just to mention a few. God did not tell them what it will take to bring them there meaning the process. God does not always tell us the PROCESS but the PURPOSE for if some of us knew the process, we would give up without going far. David was promised that He would be king, God did not tell him that He would wait 17years, be wanted dead by Saul and face many challenges. Joseph received a dream but he was not told the dream would nearly cost him his life (thrown into the pit, sold to Egypt, thrown in jail and then receive it. If these two guys ever knew the process, I bet they would have thought twice about the promise.

While in the desert, the children of Israel were brought by the mountain Sinai and I believe they camped there for many days. The Lord may bring you through the desert but He will not leave you in the desert. That’s why we always need to be reminded that we are nomadic people. If we stop somewhere, we’ll be there for a season and not forever. One preacher said that, “never build a permanent decisions on a temporary situation” As nomadic people, we are always packed up so that we can pass over. If my friends are looking for me where I was yesterday, they will not find me for I am moving on. I may cry for a while, be broken, fall but I am not going to be down forever and don’t look for me down there cause I am passing over. It’s easy to settle at a place where you don’t fight anymore, quite and peaceful the same with the Israelites sitting by the mountain. God then said, “You have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you  northward” meaning it’s time to make a stand and move forward. Yes I brought you to this mountain but this was part of the process to get you ready for the promise land. I know how I struggle with this at times because I tend to be too territorial when I know for sure that God was just using that as a bridge. He may bring me to certain places just to rest and then move me to the next level. He wants me to go Northward as there is something about Northwards, it’s in His plan. Going forward would mean fighting our way through, as you read down in the same chapter, you see how they begun to fight many enemies that they may posses.

They were not told that they would fight but that was part of the process. You and I should be thankful to God for not telling us what the process would be. This gave us the ability to trust Him through it all. Just like a blind man who needs someone else to lead him, we have God to lead us through the process. The process may not be easy but we sure know the promise and that is what keeps us humble. If He promised, sure enough He will accomplish it.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: A Resurrection of Offense by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead. 10 But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death; 11 Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus  (John 12:9 – 11).

A pastor saw a young lady in his church after a summer time of her being away.  Upon coming back from her vacation, the pastor noticed that her stomach was quite large.  He thought that her and her husband were obviously going to have a baby and therefore said, “You’re starting to show.”  However she replied, “I’m not pregnant”.  Needless to say the woman was very offended, in which time that the Pastor said, “I’m sorry, I’ll perhaps need you to forgive me seventy times seven for that one insensitive comment.”

Have you ever offended someone, either purposefully or accidentally? Perhaps you have a humorous story as well.  However, have you ever offended someone, because you were living for Christ?  When Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead, not everyone was happy about this public miracle.

Jesus was in Bethany, with Mary, Martha, and Lazarus, and “Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead. 10 But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death; 11 Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.”  Now that Lazarus is a walking miracle, raised to newness of life, his very life is offensive to many, and they want to kill not only Christ, but Lazarus as well.  If Christ has raised your life from being dead in your sins and transgressions when you repented and put your trust in Jesus Christ, than should your life not offend?  How many get offended as you speak and live for Christ?  There should be those that absolutely despise you for the cause of Christ.  You were just like Lazarus, dead in your sins and trespasses, and also broke God’s Moral Law (The Ten Commandments).

Christ called you by name, “come forth” and at which time you repented and put your trust in Christ.  Others took the grave clothes off you by discipling you in the faith that you might walk closer to, and become more like Jesus.  Lazarus represented Christ, and therefore his life was on the line, he was despised, he was hated, his enemies called for his blood.  It is kind of humorous, as Ravi Zaccharias said, “what are the Jews going to threaten Lazarus with, death?  How can someone like Lazarus actually be threatened by death, he already has been there and done that”?

Christian, if you are truly living your life for Christ, then where are your accusers, where are those that hate you and want you dead because your life is so offensive and repugnant to those in the world?  We don’t desire to offend others with the gospel, that is not our goal, nor should it be, however, the gospel is offensive.  Paul wrote, “For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God…For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom: 23 But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumbling block, and unto the Greeks foolishness; 24 But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.”

Ray Comfort writes “The undertaker’s nightmare”. The Son of God created havoc for undertakers by speaking to their frigid merchandise. His voice was supernatural. A mere “Lazarus, come forth,” spoken to a corpse meant a nightmarish dilemma for the Bethany funeral director, because he was left with no body to deal with. Up until that moment, his business was mortally secure. Four days after the death, he had everything wrapped up, when suddenly, three words unraveled his inanimate toil.

Reimbursement of all funeral expenses was just the beginning of the bad dream. Death was his living,  and if this stranger from Nazareth continued to speak around graves, his business itself would soon be terminal. Jesus Christ was the undertaker’s nightmare because death bowed its vile knee to His voice, and the day is promised when all undertakers will hit the unemployment line!  The raising of Lazarus snatched the profit from the undertaker; but the incident happened for the inestimable profit of humanity. It was the long-awaited fulfillment of what was spoken of by the prophets of old. It was a beam of wondrous and glistening light in the most hopeless and darkest of all caves.

Perhaps if you never offend anyone, perhaps you should check to see if you are walking with Christ.  Share your faith with three people a day, and at the end of the week, see how many were receptive and how many were offended.  Speak boldly and with compassion, for the lost need to hear the truth about Jesus from one he has raised from being dead in their sins, therefore you make a good candidate.   

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: Salvation Is Free, Anointing Will Cost You

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 1:39-45,  Verse 42, “…Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!”

Not sure if the title for this devo is the right for it but I will use it anyway. If any one be in Christ, he is a new creation, old things have passed a way and behold everything has become new, Paul tells us this in 2Cor 5:17. Salvation is the beginning in the life of a Christian. Many think hat once you get saved, then your life is complete. The term being born again, is like starting from the scratch and that requires a lot of growth. Salvation is free, the growth and the anointing you have to pay for it, it requires hard work.

Mary and Elizabeth were both carrying seeds freely deposited in their wombs. The reason why they are carrying the seeds is because they are chosen. The bible says, “Many are called but few are chosen”, in our time it sounds like “many are cold but few are frozen” and that is because we want to stay saved and not ready to be used. We have been chosen by God to carry seeds. Every one has something that they can do for the Kingdom of God. These two have identified the seeds they are carrying, Mary is carrying the Messiah, the Savior of the world on the other hand Elizabeth is carrying the preparer of the way. Both have different gifts but they are significant. Not everyone is called and anointed to be a preacher, pastor, worship leader, manager or the like, you may have been called just to be an encourager, singer, worshiper or prayer warrior. Some have been called to reach out to certain people no one can reach but them. Being faithful in carrying that seed will cause you to be fulfilled. Going before God and trying to find out what He has planted in you will cost everything, you will linger longer before Him, He will put you at a place where He will strip your and begin to stir up the hidden anointing but it’s worth having it.
The two women get to meet together and after greeting each other, Elizabeth’s baby in womb leaped with joy and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit. There is something about getting yourself close to those who challenge you in your walk. My growth has always been through being challenged.  Whether in prayer, reading the word, doing memory verses, preaching, I had someone somewhere provoking me to get to where I needed to be. They may have not told me but their life challenged me and I had to reposition myself.  I had to adjust my life style, cut down some things that would hinder the anointing, I had to get more stuff that would help grow as I prayed more for the anointing. I haven’t reached where I believe I need to be but God is working it through me. “Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, Phil 2:12.”

Do you realize you are not a cheerleader in the kingdom? you are a team player, put on your uniform, find the position in the field and be the player God wants you to be. Not every one can play defensive, some play offensive. Find your place in the kingdom and be active in it. Carry the seed, carry the fruits and change your entire surrounding cause you have the seed. Be pregnant with destiny that heights, depths, principalities, rulers of darkness, spiritual wickedness, things present not even the things to come will abort the seed inside of you. Use your talents God has given you because God has chosen you for a time like this. These are all hard work. Though Elizabeth and Mary had free gifts of babies, after giving birth, they had the task of raising those babies and of course there was hard work involved in raising them but they accomplished it because they were chosen and worked hard.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: And The Brook Dried Up, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Vs 6, “The ravens brought him bread in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening; and he drank from the brook, vs. 7, “And it happened after awhile that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land”.

There are jobs, positions, ministries that God allowed us to be in for a while. He fed us, ministered to us, provided for us and the like and we knew for sure that it was God’s will to be in that place, but we need to understand that there are times when the brook dries up meaning that which you thought would always be there is gone. The zeal you had for that position dried up, the patience you had for that thing dried up. At this time it’s very easy to say it may have not been God’s will for you to be there but the truth of the matter is, it was His will but for a season. When you are getting comfortable, He will relocate you so as to depend on Him even more. Change causes us to see God in different dimensions and change also allows us not to limit God in any way. If God provided away for you in this, believe that He has already provided another way for He is the way maker.

Guys, the brook can dry up, your spiritual brook can dry up, zeal to serve others can dry up, finances can dry up, and jobs and positions can also dry up for we the believers are nomadic people always on the move climbing from glory to glory. Don’t expect to find some of us in the previous brooks for when they dried up, it was time to trust God for the next move.. Don’t be trying to revive a brook that dried up for what God has closed can no man open and what God has opened can no man close. Ask the Lord what direction to take, He has a lot of ways of blessing His people.

My question to God is, why allow a brook to dry up while the three year period of no rain is still on? read from vs. 8 and you will see that God was providing another way and this time Elijah is to meet a widow who will provide for him. I bet Elijah went happy for God had provided a way but God did not tell him that the widow had only little oil and little flour to which she was just going to make the last bread for her and her son and thereafter die. Greater levels, greater service to others, greater miracles to be expected and so are greater challenges. At the brook he wasn’t serving and yet he had enough, at the widow’s, he is expected to serve while there is less than enough but the good news is that he is sent to rescue someone else. Thank God that when He relocates you, He has someone or some people in mind He desires you to reach. As He blesses them, He will bless you too. The bible says that “don’t be weary in well doing for in time you will reap if you don’t faint”. At first it was about his needs, now it’s about other people’s needs and his. Lord when the brook has dried up, send me to another place for there is still much to be done.

Have a blessed weekend

* Keep my wife and I in prayers, I fly out on Wednesday night to pick her up to come home after being away in college. She graduated with a degree in nursing.

Thanks
Evans
