title.rendered: And The Brook Dried Up, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 17:1-7, “And it happened after a while that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land”

It’s very easy to talk about God providing but waiting for Him to provide can be very difficult. We know this for sure for the word of God says that in Isaiah 55:8&9, “for my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my way, for as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways” says the Lord. When you think that everything is out of control, He is in control, nothing escapes Him. Eccle 3:11, “He has made everything beautiful in His time”. We need to understand that it’s His time that counts and not my time.

Elijah the prophet in 1Kings 17 has just prophesied to king Ahab that there would be no rain in Israel for a period of three years. If you look at chapter 16 of 1Kings vs. 33, “And Ahab made a wooden image. Ahab did more to provoke the Lord God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him”. Ahab was bad news, he had married a wicked woman by the name of Jezebel who turned his heart away from God. Anytime God is getting ready to do something in a land, He will always provide a way for escape for His children. Though the wickedness of Ahab provoked God to shut the heavens from providing rain, everyone in the land of Israel had to be affected by that circumstance regardless of whether they were righteous or not. It’s true even today people do things that cause others to suffer and yet they are innocent (I use that word loosely).

I thank God that Romans 8:1, there is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, Psalm 91, ” for in times of trouble God will hide us under His pavilion in the secret of His tabernacle shall He hide me for in the absence of everything that I need daily, Phil 4:19, He will provide according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus. Elijah has prophesied and the prophesy also affects him for he lives in Israel but He is faithful to take God at His word. 1Kings 17:2&3, “Then the word of the Lord came to him, saying, “Get away from here and turn eastward, and hide by the Brook Cherith, which flows into the Jordan. And it will be that you shall drink from the brooks, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there”. Praise God for His plans and provisions, in as much as there is drought in the land, God had preserved a brook for His chosen man, and on the other hand, He has commanded the ravens to feed him with bread and meat. I would pause here for a sec. I understand something about the brook for it must have been flowing from the river Jordan, but how do you explain the bread, where was the bread and meat coming from? who was baking the bread? and how come the raven could not eat the bread? and to make it even interesting, the raven knew who Elijah was?.

We will never fully grasp how God works but we sure love when He does the impossible. He is the God who takes less and does much with it. He is the God who does things that leaves you wondering how He did it and it’s for us also to understand that our ways are not His ways. How we see things are not how He sees them. When you least expect Him to move that is the time He will move. When you think that there is nothing around He can use, that is the time He will surprise you by taking that little thing and making something great out of it. There could be something around you, at your job, an idea, a seed at home you never thought He could use, but don’t be surprised to see the things you despised being used to get you to the next level.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Seek Ye First The Kingdom of God

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Math 6:33, “But Seek ye first the Kingdom of God and His righteousness and all these things shall be ADDED unto you”

Wanted to share a message I shared on back in 2002 that was a blessing
to me. I needed to be challenged again by it this morning. I pray you
are too. Be blessed as you read it

Prayer is not reserved for when we are in trouble, prayer is a daily communication with the Creator whether we are in need of something from Him or not. Prayer is the backbone that keeps him or her standing strong. It’s one thing to talk about prayers, it another thing to do it. We are told in James 1:22, “Be ye doers of the word not just hearers only deceiving your own self”. The word is not complete when it’s heard, it can only be complete when what has been received is put into practice. We could talk about faith, healing, provisions but unless we put it into practice we will be deceiving ourselves.

Math 6:33, “But Seek ye first the Kingdom of God and His righteousness…”. This is one of the scripture verses people know by heart, it has be used in the songs, quoted, used in sermons and the like but it’s kind of interesting how it started with a “BUT”. Any time someone uses the word “BUT”, there must have been something communicated earlier related to it and the “BUT” becomes a condition that comes with what had been said earlier. Let’s go back to vs. 31, “Therefore do not worry, saying, “what shall we eat? or drink? or what shall we wear? vs. 32 For after all these things the Gentiles seek. Your Heavenly Father knows that you need all these things, vs. 33 BUT”. It’s already been established that God knows what we need and desire even before we look to Him but He says SEEK YE FIRST which means put God first, call on Him first, before you worry about anything and before you begin to bring things before Him, PUT HIM FIRST. You cannot confidently come to someone and ask them for something if you are not close to them, that just puts you in an awkward position. The word SEEK is very powerful, seek is to look for, search for, try to find, hunt for and that tells me that seeking God’s Kingdom is not an easy task for you have to search for it, you got to find it, you got to linger longer, you got to hunt for it. That is why prayer is not easy I struggle with it myself and even sharing on prayers becomes tough.

We’ve looked at SEEK and now it says FIRST the Kingdom of God and His righteousness, mark the way it puts it, it doesn’t say bring all your requests, questions, and desires first, it says seek His Kingdom first meaning find God’s presence by worshipping Him, giving Him glory, honoring Him, Exalting Him for you are not seeking a small thing you are actually seeking a KINGDOM. There is more to the kingdom than the give me list we are prepared with. Seeking the Kingdom of God first humbles me as the awesome presence of God who presents and represents the Kingdom shows up and we are engulfed by the kingdom principles and all our fleshly ambitions and desires are consumed by the presence of God and now we pray “thy kingdom come, thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven”. I have been to prayer services and even heard people pray and the first things I heard was the give me list being presented to God. Where is seeking the Kingdom of God first and His righteousness? Our prayers can never be answered if we haven’t confessed our sins before God and therefore when we pray for righteousness, we are praying for purification, sanctification, washing and mercy, Heb 4:16, “let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need”. We have to obtain mercy before grace can abound and the only way we can obtain mercy is by admitting that we have sinned against heaven and are humbled by the fact that we have failed, then mercy is given and then when we are in need to which we always are, grace is offered. Now grace is not given to the qualifiers but to the ones who have been shown mercy. I believe that if we can develop how we come before God so seek His kingdom and His righteousness, at times the things that we were going to bring before Him would just be added even before we mention them. For if you go back to vs. 31&32 it says, He knows that you need these things then shall be added to you. Hold here for a sec, it says all these things will be “ADDED” not “GIVEN”. Why added and not given? because in  the process of seeking, you are changed, touched, forgiven, convicted, transformed and these are given as priority for we need them and now the other things we were bringing before Him are just additions to what we desired of Him.

Mark 11:24, “What things so ever you desire when you pray, believe you receive them and you shall have them”. Remember we talked about the desires of our hearts? the more you spend time with God, the more He reveals to you and the more that becomes your desires. When you and I seek Him first, He will give us the Kingdom stuff, reveal to us more and we can begin to desire them and now we can pray for them to be fulfilled.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 12:24, “…unless the grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it produces much grain”

It’s easy for People to go to church on the basis of what they will gain, what God can do for us. And as my pastor mentioned not too long ago, even our today praise and worship songs they mostly talk about what we can gain from God. Always eager to hear, receive and be ministered to but what about us ready to give? and I’m not talking about finances but give time, help that is needed and more so bring people to the Kingdom?. We always come for us, I have seen this even with small ministries, everyone is trying to find out who is going to be there and what to expect and receive instead of what can I give or what can I do in this ministry. How about worship, many are waiting for God to give them a spirit of worship before they can worship. When I read the bible, we are the ones to worship God. David says, “I will not offer to the Lord what cost me nothing”, it’s our duty to give Him all the praises and not do it when we feel like. “We bring sacrifices of praise”, at times it will cost us.

Jesus served the disciples in the last supper. He knew who will betray Him, deny Him and doubt Him yet He served them anyway. He knew He did not come to receive but came to give. He girded Himself with a towel, went down on His knees and washed His disciples feet regardless of who they were and what He knew about them, read it in John 13.

We have been called to service, we are being raised for a time like this not just to be receivers but givers too. “Unless the grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it produces much grain”. There is no resurrection without death. The grain of wheat is very small but we are told of how significant it is when planted. We too as believers may be very small in the church and might not be known but the truth of the matter is, we are very significant. Your prayers, presence, support does make a difference because you are significant in the body of Christ. Look at the verse closely, it says unless the grain of wheat  which refers to only one grain (individual), God calls His people as individuals, He does not call us as a group. We are called to die to self as the grain needs to fall on the dirt and die. Most of those who go up and stay up have had an experience of going down first.

One has to fall on the ground and die, it’s because when anything falls into the ground, the outward appearance (shell) is consumed by the ground and real seed which is on the inside begins to show forth. We have to be stripped of self righteousness and feeling that we are a little bit better and be brought to a place where the ground consumes what we perceive ourselves and allow the Lord to transform the inside. This might not happen overnight as when it falls on the ground it remains by itself for a season before it shoots from the ground and later produces much grain. I don’t know about you but for me, preparation takes place in the closet and like the seed which is not seen when it begins to go through the process, results is all the other people will see.

We cannot  be effective in reaching if we are not willing to die to self, sacrifice or give time, money, talents etc. I was never anointed to sit on it but to utilize in reaching others.

What do you have and what can you give?, are you always on the verge of receiving and never giving? Pray today that God will teach you how to fall on the ground like the grain seed  and die to things that hinder your step to give. Give your time, talents, gifts, energy, experiences, knowledge, wisdom, love, patience, understanding and the list goes on.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Exodus 20:3, “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain”

We have an awesome opportunity to be called the children of God. We a people who were once alienated because of our sinful nature were bought with a price that we might become heirs and joint heirs with the Father. Actually the bible says we were adopted. Anytime a child is adopted into a family, a process of documentation takes place that the child may officially belong in that family then he or she becomes an heir too.

As an heir, we do not take things lightly and casually. We do not waste, manipulate or kid around with certain things we need daily especially when in trouble. It does bug me to hear people use the name of the Lord in vain while we believers use the name when we need help. Constantly I hear people use the name of the Lord as a disgust word when something happens to them and that does grieve me because it sounds like someone taking his father’s name and using it as a filth word. The bible says, “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain”. This name cannot be misused just because it’s available, it’s a special name. I have come to discover that even Christians can use His name in vain when we say things like “oh my God…” or “oh God” in things not suggesting calling His name but using it to express something.

I want to use that name of the Lord in meaningfully. See we are told that just mentioning His name is enough to get the job done. Psalm 124:8, “our help is in the name of the Lord who made the heaven and earth”, Psalm 18:3, “I will call upon the name of the Lord who is worthy to be praised, so shall I be saved from my enemies”, Prov 18:10, “The name of the Lord is a strong tower, the righteous run into it and they are safe”, Romans 10:13, “Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved”. When enemies come like a flood, I will call upon His name, and so is when I am overwhelmed, I will run to His name for there is safety there. There is something about the name of the Lord that makes one want to pause for a second and begin to cherish it. That is the name that is above every name and at the mention of that name, every knee shall bow and every tongue shall confess that Jesus Christ is Lord. It’s not a disgusting name but a powerful name, when that name is mentioned demons tremble for they don’t mess with that name. So if the demons tremble at the mention of that name, how much more should we tremble at the mention of His name?.

One day I was coming from school and it was snowing heavily in fact the classes were canceled. So driving down the hill from school, the car I was driving lost control and started skidding off the road down the hill heading towards the trees. Everything I tried to do to bring it back to control failed. Right before me there were so many trees I was heading to hit and all I could think of was the name of Jesus. I began to shout that name and believe it, the car missed those so many trees and landed in between two trees. It’s calling that name that saved me and the car that day. I left the car there that cold night to walk a couple of miles to make a phone call but I had every reason to praise Him. The car was towed out of the ditch the next day and believe it or not, the car did not have even a scratch on it. I’m glad that I called on that name.

I want to cherish that name, I want reverence that name for in time of need I can call on Him. See I walk with Him, talk to Him, live for Him and worship Him so I don’t feel guilty when I call His name when I need Him. Let’s not wait until we are in trouble to know and call Him, let that be our daily routine and have His name reserved for those times when we really need Him. The bible says that blessed is he that comes in the name of Lord. I have come to work in His name, I will stand in His name, I will overcome in His name and I will not sit without saying anything to those who take His name in vain. There is something about His name!!!!

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Don’t Bury The Dead Yet, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 4:8-37, “… it is well…”

The Shunammite’s son is dead, she may have been the only one who knew that the child was dead. Maybe she wanted to keep it to herself for now till she had the man of God say there was no more to hope for beyond facts. Maybe if everyone else knew including her husband, they would overwhelm her by their reaction to the situation, the reason she kept the news to herself. I have shared something things I was hoping for from God with some people, and their reaction was so discouraging that I wondered why I did not keep to myself and when God did it, then I would testify about it. I can now understand why some miracles Jesus, Elisha, Peter and the rest did, they kicked everyone out of the room. There are people who can be a distraction to what hoping for.

When a person dies, the next move is to bury the person, it’s a simple as that. I would think this woman would notify the family and do the same as the fact remained, her son was dead. It’s not mentioned to us whether she began to mourn or anything of the sort, but we see her in motion and action. She remembers the promise and how the promise is a sign of abundance. Thank God for the great victories He gave you in the past, this will cause you to trust in Him again cause if He did it then, He can do it again.

She takes upon herself to go into the man of God’s room and places the child there and leaves to find the man of God. God desires us to put our burdens before Him, in the sanctuary, in His house and then seek Him. In as much as the fact is my situation, dreams, desires have died before my eyes, I want God have the final say in it, UNTIL THEN I REFUSE TO BELIEVE WHAT I SEE AND CHOOSE TO SEE WHAT I BELIEVE AND THAT IS SEEING IT FROM GOD’S WAY. While looking for Elisha, I believe she was encouraging herself in the midst of her troubled soul, full of sorrow yet speaking these words, “It is well with my soul” Because she could see the beam of light through hope at the end of the tunnel. That the same God who blessed her with a son through his servant, is the same God who would restore her son through the same man. She finally meets the Elisha the Man of God and the first question she is asked, “Is it well with you? is it well with your husband? is it well with your son? and she said it is well”. Not that “it SHALL be well” she says, “it is WELL”. The Man of God sends his servant to raise the child by putting Elisha’s stuff on the boy but that did not bring him back to life. There are some miracles God will not send any of the angels to do it, but He will show up Himself and do it. Finally Elisha shows up and the story line ends with a resurrection and once again the family is happy again because of a woman had concrete facts she did not deny yet chose to see truth in the midst of it by pushing her faith to see what she believed in the midst of believing what she saw.

Why do we sometimes bury the dead quick? I’m a victim. We give up to quick even before involving God, we are too quick to get hold of the shovel to bury that which is hurting us simply because the things we thought would work out are dead. Many times we have no one to stand with us, pray with us or even encourage us. I want to encourage myself to day by speaking the same words, “It is well with my soul”, God is in control. If I can’t get someone to encourage me, I will encourage myself. Be your best encourager and let God take over. Let God be the final judge in your condition. In your ministry, finances, work, relationships, dreams and desires, let it go. I don’t know what would have happened if she buried the son, thank God she did not. As you read in other chapters through series of events, this woman was blessed even more because of her testimony. DON’T BE QUICK TO BURY THE
DEAD YET

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Don’t Burry The Dead Yet, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 4:8-37, “… it is well…”

Yesterday we looked at a life of a woman who is doing all she can to make the man of God comfortable without any agenda on the side. She does not know that she is opening channels for blessings just because of her faithfulness. Her character towards her husband and people has opened doors for her to exercise the biggest faith in her life and after a season, she is receives the promise. Promise is always a sign of abundance.

Today let’s explore more on the life of the Shunammite woman as we see how her faith gets boosted again after a series of things that causes her not to live by facts but by truth fueled by faith. It happened that after a couple of years when the boy was old enough he would go to the field to work with his father. One thing I need to point out is that whenever God blesses one person, someone else will also benefit from that blessing. You may not have much to share, but sharing your testimony would cause someone to trust God for their miracle. Her faithfulness causes the husband to have someone he can call his son. If you asked for it or was just bestowed on you, I would say, you are the first one the blessing and so the more you disperse and share the more you receive. Blessed is the hand that gives than the one that takes or receives.

While in the field one day, the boy complained of headache and the father decides to bring him home. Something amazing is that the father does not know what to do and perceives that the wife would know what to do. I do respect women, for their courage (Esther), persistence (The woman with the issue of blood), prayers (Hannah), followers and teachable (Ruth) and they don’t give up until they have attained it. Thank God for the women, they know how to get blessings from the Lord. They linger longer, go to churches today and you will find that in the intercessory ministry are dominated by women (I’m in one). They stick with something till the end. There are so many women in the bible I could use as examples.

The Shunammite woman has been given the boy and like the husband, she may have not known what to do, so she let the boy on her laps till noon and then he died. Oh my God, the promise is gone, how can this been? how did this happen?, wasn’t this suppose to be good forever? Should I hold my fist at God? With all these, fear grips, deception feelings find their way in, doubts replaces faith if allowed to. Our attitude and action at this hour matters a lot for what is over to you may not be over for the Lord. “Hold your peace, be still and know that I am God”, Psalm 46:10. Have you ever received a promise from above and people around you enjoyed them and the moment things started going wrong, they threw words back at you like, “didn’t I tell you this will not work?” Everything is laid back on your lap and only you with faith in God has the power to change it’s destiny. You will be the only one to have a passion to see it come to life again and that could mean going an extra mile to seek God for you. The fact is, you have something dead in your lap, the truth is, it’s not over till God says so. So don’t burry the dead yet until you have consulted the giver of the promise. To finish

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Are you living in the web of shattered dreams
As every ounce of strength drains down the stream
While gusty winds toss you upon the raging storm
Yet I will wait in hope for the bright new morn

When you see the fig tree having no bud within
And the vine with no grapes to lean on
When every dream project failed to take its shape
There is a still hope that you can lean on

Are you living a lie when your heart’s all bruised
Feeling the sting of the wounds you’ve been through
Even when true friends have deserted and strayed
Yet I know my God will see me through

Despite the storms I know for sure
I will rejoice in the Lord evermore
Ever so joyful in God my Saviour n hope
As he channels my life through and through

So no matter what you’re going through in life
Be the trouble or the shadows of death that chase
For the Sovereign Lord is the strength of your life
For he comforts you with his breath of hope.

title.rendered: Don’t Bury The Dead Yet, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 4:8-37, “… it is well…”

In the story we are about to look at deals with both FACTS and TRUTHS. We are going to be seeing a lot of facts and less of truths in the natural but as we go deeper, we will begin to see more truths than facts. Facts are reality, can be seen and if not, there are proofs for them. Truths negates the facts seeing potentials in the midst of facts. Fact is, we are sinners, truth is, He has redeemed us from the curse of sin through His shed blood on the cross.

In 2 Kings, the Shunammite woman is the type of woman than any man would desire to wife because of her character. She is the type that desires the best and is more concerned about other people’s welfare than hers. If that is not enough, she respects her husband to the extent that she will not execute any plans without consulting him. The greatest of all is that she is a woman of Faith, she is a history maker.

It happens that a man of God (Elisha) often times came to town (Shunem) and she perceived that he was a man of God. She consults her husband about preparing a place for the man of God so that whenever he is in town, he can find a place to sleep, have rest and have good meal prepared for him. Over and over again this happens and the man of God chooses to bless her for her kindness her by calling those things which are not as though they were. She is promised a son despite the odds and facts that she could have been barren. The other fact is that her husband is old. A person’s character opens doors for greater miracles if that person can withstand truths that fuels faith in the midst of facts he or she cannot deny. Heb 11:1, “Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen”. Here is a woman who is about to receive what she did not ask for and her faith has to be boosted to believe it and receive it in spite of the fact that it’s nearly impossible. She has a promise to hope in the season in which it was promised.

Has God promised you blessings through His word while serving Him?. Don’t give because He will elevate you in due season. His promise could be coming in the midst of concrete facts. And your faith is going to have to go beyond the facts to receive the promise. God is the only ONE can defy the laws of nature (facts) and demonstrate His Truths. The bible says that you shall know the truth and the truth shall set you free as something could be a fact and not be the truth. Trust God for the biggest thing you could ever think of according to His will and ask Him to help your unbelief by giving you increasing your faith in the midst of concrete facts To continue…

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 61:1-8, “…From the end of the earth I will cry to You, when my heart is overwhelmed; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I…”

People get overwhelmed by things especially responsibilities on a day to day basis. While you are still working on this, here comes another one; while trying to work on another one, here comes a new one. I tend to believe that everything has its season and how we deal with a situation during a certain season will determine the outcome. It’s easy to allow overwhelming situations to chock out peace, confidence and courage, as the weeds chock out good plants. Here is our encouragement.
 
Vs. 1 Hear my cry, O God, attend to my prayer, the first thing is prayer, have you prayed in and over your situation or did you wait for someone to come and lay hands and pray over you? Lay your own foundation and let someone else help you build the walls. I have met people that wanted some things happen in their lives and the first question I asked them, “Have you laid your foundation?”, you can help build the walls but foundation has to be laid by an individual. What is the foundation, faith. Vs. 2 From the ends of the earth I will cry to You, When my heart is overwhelmed, Lead me to the rock that is higher than I, of course our hearts will get overwhelmed and so will our minds and our bodies but what happens when they get overwhelmed? Please don’t lead me to temptation, friends, neighbors, and programs, lead me to the rock not just any rock, But the Rock that is higher than I. Why the rock?, the rock cannot be overwhelmed, moved or shaken and if the rock is higher than I, I will make it my dwelling place while hiding under it. Vs. 3 For you have been a shelter for me, A strong water from the enemy, It’s encouraging to know in Prov 18:10, that “The name of the Lord is a strong tower, the righteous run into it and they are safe”. Just His name alone is a strong tower in other words a strong rock. When you find yourself overwhelmed, calm your nerves, speak peace to yourself and find the rock that is higher than you. The bible says in Nehemiah 8:10, “…for the joy of the Lord is your strength.”

The unbelievers ask me why I always have this joy even when things at times don’t go right or when I am overwhelmed, it’s because I have learnt the secret which  is the joy of the Lord is my strength. Vs. 8, So I will praise Your name forever, That I may daily perform my vows. The writer concludes the chapter with this line as in the process of hiding under the rock, he will continue to praise and be glad and daily perform his vows. We have vowed to be the best we can be at our jobs, in our homes by God’s grace without complaining or murmuring “for it is God which works in you both to will and to do of His good pleasure”, Phil 2:13. So keep on fighting the good fight of a soldier, enduring for He is your Rock of Ages, Strong Tower, Firm Foundation, Solid Rock, Anchor of you Life,

To sum up, we are all children in warriors gear. God is our armor therefore we make it. There are times when it gets too much that we have to cry. But when they all see how we survive and make it, they don’t know that beneath that armor, the warrior is just a child. Twila Paris had this line in her song, “The warrior is a child” , “They don’t know that I would go running home when I fall down, they don’t know who picks me up when no one is around, I drop my sword and cry for a while, cause deep inside this armor, the warrior is just a child”

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
James 1:17

Whatever is good and perfect comes to us from God above, who created all of heaven’s lights.  Unlike them He never changes or casts shifting shadows.

 

Praise the Lord!  Sometimes people will turn on you but God is faithful.  He never changes.  He is not for you today and against you tomorrow.  Thank God.  He will never leave you or forsake you.  You can depend on Him.  He is trustworthy.  You can trust Him and You can tell Him anything.  And no matter what He will still love you.  You can show him who you really are and He won’t run away scared. (TD Jakes) 

 

Deuteronomy 7:7 Says the Lord did not set His love upon you, nor choose you, because you were more in number than any people, for ye were the fewest of all people.  God didn’t choose you because of who you were but because of His love for you.  This is not about your works.  Romans 3:10 There is none righteous, no not one.  But we are made righteous by His blood.  And after we receive Him we are the righteousness of God in Christ Jesus. 

 

God doesn’t cast shifting shadows.  When I was a little girl I often played he loves me he loves me not.  Have you ever done that?  Little girls would pick flowers and pull off the petals one by one.  Each petal would alternate.  He loves me, He loves me not, He loves me, He loves me not, He loves me… and the last petal would decipher if you were loved or not.  Let me tell you the Lord loves you.  You don’t have to wonder about His love.  He isn’t confused or unsure about His love for you.  He doesn’t need some space to figure out His feelings.  He loves you.  More than anyone will ever love you.  You can be sure of His love because He told you that He loves you and He never changes or casts shifting shadows. 

 

And He doesn’t just love you when you are who He wants you to be.  He loves you even when you don’t do everything He wants you to do.  His love is not fickle.  His love is forever and I want you to know today He has good things in store for you.  His plans for you are good and not evil.  Trust Him and you will see great and glorious things you know not of.  Amen.

title.rendered: Stick-to-it-TIve-ness, by Bob Brubaker submitted by John Bell

content.rendered:
Good morning,

I wanted to finish but I wanted to quit. I was in a great deal of pain, so much pain that I couldn’t stand upright. As I got closer to the finish line I knew I had to keep pressing on and not quit. Thankfully, I made it and finished Ironman Arizona on April 15 by the grace of God. I fought through many difficulties and the biggest, coming back from being one breath from death just two years ago. LOOK WHAT GOD CAN DO!

There’s something about practicing the principle of stick-to-it-tive-ness in everything so it carries over the big things of life. Let’s look at this principle:

Sometimes it takes sticking it out to the end in order to win the battle. You can call it perseverance, you can call it patience, or you can call it stick-to-it-tive- ness – it’s a matter of finishing what you have started no matter what the cost. Self discipline is the artillery for battle within. The more we stick to the plan we set out to do and bring ourselves in line the more we’ll enjoy the sweet victories along the way. But there’s always a temptation in the loneliness of self discipline to give in and give up.

There’s an account in the Old Testament where David is reviewing the people in his life that have really meant something to him. Stuck in the middle of the list is a guy named Eleazar. Eleazar’s claim to fame in the eyes of King David was his “stick-to-it-tive-ness.”

2 Samuel 23:9-10 Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite. As one of the three mighty men, he was with David when they taunted the Philistines gathered at Pas Dammim for battle. Then the men of Israel retreated, 10 but he stood his ground and struck down the Philistines till his hand grew tired and froze to the sword. The LORD brought about a great victory that day. The troops returned to Eleazar, but only to strip the dead.

David and his men went out and taunted the enemy. Can you hear them? “Here we are come and get us.” When the enemy decided they heard enough and started after David and his men – everyone retreated but Eleazar. It says he stood his ground. And did he ever. He stayed put until the job was done. He had every opportunity to run like the rest. He had every reason to give up. But he didn’t give up. He didn’t run away from the challenge. He stayed until the job was complete. Even when his hand grew tired he just held on all the more tightly and did not quit.

What a lesson! You and I can find every excuse in the book to leave whatever we know we should do. We can find every reason to give up and join others not engaged in the job we are doing. We can allow our weariness to overcome us and give in to giving up. Or we can be like Eleazar and grip a little tighter, go on a little longer, until the job is done.

It makes me think of the discipline it takes to compete as an athlete. It’s amazing how many people you see doing other things when you set out to train. There’s no glory in training and the distractions are many. Self discipline is a lonely job. Weariness can get the best of you if you let it. Or you can stick to it and know it will pay off in the long run.

Paul in the New Testament was quite impressed with the discipline of athletes as he wrote: 1 Corinthians 9:24-27 Do you not know that in a race all the runners  run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. 25 Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last; but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. 26 Therefore I do not run like a man running aimlessly; I do not fight like a man beating the air. 27 No, I beat my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.

There’s that “stick-to-it-tive-ness” again. Paul is not going to give up on the battle of self discipline. He knew he had to hold on just like Eleazar, and just like we do. Don’t let go. Stick to it. Keep your grip tight and you like Eleazar, and like Paul can find victory in your life too. When it comes to life – your walk with God, your marriage, your daily work, your training, your parenting, church life, etc. there’s no substitute for “stick-to-it-tive-ness.”

title.rendered: The World’s Worst Famine Ever – Part 2 By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good Morning!

 “The days are coming,” declares the Sovereign LORD, “when I will send a famine through the land—not a famine of food or a thirst for water, but a famine of hearing the words of the LORD.  Men will stagger from sea to sea and wander from north to east, searching for the word of the LORD, but they will not find it. “In that day “the lovely young women and strong young men will faint because of thirst. Amos 8:11-13

Destruction was to come upon the city of Samaria which would be the cause of bitter mourning. Amos described the event in terms of a funeral for an only son.  He continued the use of metaphorical language as he depicted a coming famine. It was no ordinary famine but one of the words of the Lord (v.11). He pictured men longing and searching for God’s Word as starving people seek food or water (vv.12-13). But despite their search they received no word from the Lord. They had rejected the word, not realizing its great value, and had lost it forever (cf. Luke 17:22; John 7:34).

Isn’t it amazing the magnitude of this famine?  The Scriptures point out that even the lovely young women and strong young man would be affected by it.  Young people are known for their strength.  In Proverbs 31:3 King Lemuel’s mother gave him and an oracle his mother when she said to him: “do not spend your strength on women, your vigor on those who ruin kings.”  Now even though this was a warning against sensual lust, the fact still remains that this king’s mother was warning this young man not to allow his inner strength of character or virtue to be drained by an outside force.  1 John 2:14 reads “…I write to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God lives in you, and you have overcome the evil one.  The young were characterized by being strong, and having the Word of God living within them, and therefore overcoming the evil one.  But, if there is a famine of the Word of God, not even the young will stand based on their youth alone!  These need the Word of God flowing through their very veins!  Just as one gets vaccinations and booster shots to keep up with their immunizations so to does one need to be vaccinated by the Word of God, and have daily booster shots of daily time reading, memorizing, and mediating on it.

Illustration – Water or Money?

If you were offered a handful of $1,000 bills or a glass of cool water, which would you choose? The $1,000 bills, of course—anyone in his right mind would. However, if you were crawling through a desert, dying of thirst, and you were offered a glass of water or a handful of $1,000 bills, which would you take? The water, of course—anyone in his right mind would. That’s called “circumstantial priorities.” Your priorities change according to your circumstances. If there were a way to find everlasting life, would you want to know about it? The answer is “yes,” of course—anyone in his right mind would. What the Bible contains may surprise you.  The Scriptures speak of riches beyond our wildest dreams—the “riches” of everlasting life—and they are offered in the form of cool, clear water: “Let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely” (Revelation 22:17). At the moment, you may not be interested in the offer, but on Judgment Day your circumstances will radically change. Then it will be too late.

The church must realize the preciousness of the Word of God. We must obey and honor it, because it points to the source of life.  Look at our society that tries to keep God’s Word out of our institutions, government, and judiciary system.  Without God’s Word you have no choice but to spiritually die. 

Application:  Are you spiritually eating or starving?  You can only live so long on a verse here and there; eventually Satan will easily steal, kill, and destroy you.  Be on guard, and lift daily the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God, to fight for God against the schemes of the enemy.

title.rendered: Marks of a Disciple By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good Morning!

“A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.  ﻿By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.﻿” (John 13:34 – 35)

How can one tell is someone is a fan of a particular sports team?  Perhaps is one wears a  teams clothing, jersey, hat, etc….  However if I put on a NY Yankee jersey does that mean that I am on the NY Yankees?  Of course not!  How then can one know if one is a disciple of Christ?  One way to know if you belong to Christ is that His disciples would have love one to another.  This sounds very quaint, loving, caring, and mushy.  Love as many have said is perhaps the most abused word in language.  Jesus spoke to His disciples and gave them a new commandment, and that was to love one another as Jesus had loved them.  Many feel that the love Jesus was speaking of here, is the demonstration of love that Jesus had shown them up to this point He was speaking to them.  Jesus had shown them love, but He did not display His greatest act of love at the time He was instructing them to love on another.  That display would be shown at the cross.  Jesus would die for His twelve and for the whole world.  This was the love that He was commanding them to love one another with.  He said a new command, not a new idea, suggestion, or option I give you, but a new command.  Jesus further said, “Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.”  Jesus was calling them to lay their lives down for one another.  When is the reason that Jesus wanted His disciples to love one another as He had loved them?

  1. Christ’s Love is pure. John wrote, “How great is the love the Father has lavished on us, that we should be called children of God!”  God is the source of love, and He lavishes that love upon His children as a mother lavishes love upon her child.  His pure love, not love as the world gives, needed to be in their hearts if they were going to be Christ-like. 
  2. Christ’s Love is demonstrative.  The world sits in condemnation and judgment.  The world is guilty of breaking God’s Law, they love the darkness and hate the light.  Jesus said that when His disciples shine their love toward one another, that the world would see it and know who Christ’s disciples are.  The world can only see this kind of love if Christians step out of the four walls of the church building and live it out among all men. Many non-Christians have seen televangelists manipulate people for their money.  Christ didn’t die in a church, He died in plain view of the people, in the sight of all men.  Oh that we would die to ourselves that He would live in us, and we would be His feet and hands extended.  I laugh when people say I love God, it’s the church I have a problem with.  That is like saying I love you but I hate your husband or wife.  Husbands and wives are one, and so is Christ and His body.  His body must love one another, the church needs that love to flourish, and the world needs to see it as a living tangible witness.
  3. Christ’s Love is evidential evidence.  Jesus said “…by this all men will know that you are my disciples….”  When you live his love out loud, it shows that Jesus is real.  Why would go out of your way to help, give, bless, provide, even sacrifice for another brother or sister in Christ, because Christ is real.  Why would you display the fruit of the spirit, bless those who persecute you, love your enemies?  Practical Christian lives points to the reality that Christ is real, and the Savior of the world.  Demonstrate his pure love today as evidence that Jesus is Savior, Lord, and soon and coming King!
    Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: The World’s Worst Famine Ever – Part 1 By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good Morning!
“The days are coming,” declares the Sovereign LORD, “when I will send a famine through the land—not a famine of food or a thirst for water, but a famine of hearing the words of the LORD.  Men will stagger from sea to sea and wander from north to east, searching for the word of the LORD, but they will not find it. “In that day “the lovely young women and strong young men will faint because of thirst. Amos 8:11-13

Destruction was to come upon the city of Samaria which would be the cause of bitter mourning. Amos described the event in terms of a funeral for an only son.  He continued the use of metaphorical language as he depicted a coming famine. It was no ordinary famine but one of the words of the Lord (v.11). He pictured men longing and searching for God’s Word as starving people seek food or water (vv.12-13). But despite their search they received no word from the Lord. They had rejected the word, not realizing its great value, and had lost it forever (cf. Luke 17:22; John 7:34).

Illustration – The Bible and All it Contains
A young man once received a letter from a lawyer stating that his grandmother had left him an inheritance. To his astonishment, it was $50,000 plus “my Bible and all it contains.”  The youth was delighted to receive the money. However, he knew what the Bible contained, and because he wasn’t into religion he didn’t bother to open it. Instead, he put it on a high shelf. He gambled the $50,000, and over the next fifty years he lived as a pauper, scraping for every meal. Finally he became so destitute, he had to move in with his relatives. When he cleaned out his room, he reached up to get the dusty old Bible from the shelf. As he took it down, his trembling hands dropped it onto the floor, flinging it open to reveal a $100 bill between every page.  The man had lived as a pauper, simply because of his prejudice. He thought he knew what the Bible “contained.”  The Bible has treasures, and spiritual nourishment you need for your survival.

Can you imagine having a famine of the Word of God?  Imagine Bibles taken off the shelves of stores all around the world.  It is illegal in some countries to even own a Bible.  What happens if and when that happens in this country?  Which one book takes a definite stand against abortion, homosexuality, postmodernism, and a host of other controversial issues without compromise, but the Word of God?  With the way the USA is going, I can see the continual moral decay, and the word of man taking more and more precedence over the Word of God.  Postmodern thought desires to rob words of their meaning yielding the definition of words to the one that uses the word.  Hence words therefore would have no meaning, while using words to define postmodernism thought.  If words have no meaning then, the Word of God would also fall victim to this epidemic, and every devotion, sermon, conversation you’ve had with a loved one would be empty and void of any meaning.  Do you have the Word of God so settled in your heart, especially through Scripture memory (not memorizing the whole thing) that should that day come you know how to live God’s Word without the thin lined pages of your Bible so easily accessible?  Imagine the worst famine the world has ever seen, “ a famine of hearing the words of the LORD.” It certainly happened in the Scriptures, perhaps it will happen again.  It’s interesting that the famine wasn’t one of food or water.  Yet Job said, “I have treasured the words of His mouth More than my necessary food (Job 23:12),” and Jesus said in John 4:32-34, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.  Then his disciples said to each other, “Could someone have brought him food?”  “My food,” said Jesus, is to do the will of him who sent me and to finish his work.” Furthermore in speaking with the women at the well “Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again, 14 but whoever drinks the water I give him will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give him will become in him a spring of water welling up to eternal life (John 4:14).”  You see when you have God’s Word in you the water and food for your spirit will nourish you.  Just as the physical body would die without physical food and water, so too the spirit would die without spiritual nourishment.  That the Word of God in you.  C.S. Lewis said as a car is mean to run on Gas, people are meant to run on the Holy Spirit.”

Application:  Be in God’s Word consistently and daily.  The King has set the table but if you don’t sit and eat then you will be the one with a spiritual famine in your life.  Read Matt. 5:6, and Psalm 1.

content.rendered:
Have you found hope in the dreams you’ve seen?
Have you felt the heartbeat when it’s broken n thrown?
Do you know how it feels when they’re shattered and gone?
Do you know when they come back shuddered and torn?
You bet. It’s like chasing rainbows in the wild.
Sounds like going after the stars in the skies
Now all’s I’ve left are a few shattered glasses
Hanging on the doorway of this bruised heart.

E’er looked up to someone and shared out your dreams?
E’er talked your life, with the friend of your dreams?
Have you felt lost hope at the lifeless soul?
When he fell dead in your arms for all!!!
Together we’ve gone through the valley of tears
Thru tempest and darkness, and hopeless despair
Times when I’ve longed for a friend to hear,
Until the day I’ve found an answer to prayer

Suddeny I heard a gentle voice O so clear
Whispering my name with such tender care
Son I’ve seen your shattered dreams and tears
Son I’ve come to lift you hope so dear.
I’ve held your tears in my bottle at hand
Engraven your life on the palm of my hand
Though I marshalled out the heavens for you
Would I not make your dream come true

Listen my son, to my word every day
I’m with you always guiding your way
Trust me son, and put your hope in me
I’m about to make a new thing your day.
I’m here to carry you on eagles wings
Shielding always as the apple of my eye
I’m here for you son, to restore your dreams
Trust me my child, holding your head up high.

From then on, I’d found out I wasn’t alone
With Jesus around I’d counted on him alone
To this faint heart, he restoreth my stength
My trust my hope, he’s renewed it again.
With boldness I stand, pursuing my dreams
Every path that I take, gently he beams
For out, he lifted me from the valley of grief
As he turned the tide on my shattered dreams

content.rendered:
Good Morning!
“Then David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin. But I come to you in the name of the Lord of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied. 46 This day the Lord will deliver you into my hand, and I will strike you and take your head from you. And this day I will give the carcasses of the camp of the Philistines to the birds of the air and the wild beasts of the earth, that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel (1 Samuel 17:45 – 46).”

Have you ever looked back at your life and saw that God’s divine handprint was upon the battles that you faced?  As we mature in the Lord we begin to discover that God is truly the One that is winning and bringing the victory.  Even though you look back and see victory in your life, did you see victory when you were in the midst of battle?  I’ve heard it said that hindsight is 20/20, meaning that we seem to see so clearly when looking back but not as clearly when we are going through something, because we are in the midst of a situation.  Are you able to use the situations that God has brought you through as a springboard to propel you on to future victories.

David remembered that the Lord God had delivered him from the lion and the bear when he battled with them for the sake of his sheep.  Now David is using his perception of preparation to give him courage to not just talk about facing Goliath, but actually engaging him in battle.  The weapons of Goliath were sword, spear, and javelin.  Goliath didn’t even hold his shield in hand because his armor bearer was holding it for him.  Perhaps Goliath felt that he had no need to hold a shield for protection.  David proclaimed that although Goliath came to him with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin, David was coming to Goliath in the name of the Lord of hosts.  David didn’t even mention his weapons:  his staff, his sling and the rocks.  Deut 33:29 states, “The LORD is your saving shield, and his sword is your glory. Your enemies fawn upon you, as you stride upon their heights.”  Does this not describe the faceoff between David and Goliath?  The enemy mocked him, mocked his weapons, but Goliath couldn’t see that David had a sword and shield in the Lord.  David’s offense and defense was the Lord Himself.  David not only killed Goliath but cut off Goliaths head with Goliath’s own sword.  By challenging God’s people Israel, the Philistines were in effect challenging the Lord Himself, and the Lord would have the victory enveloping the natural (sling and sword) in the supernatural.  “Who is this King of glory?  The Lord strong and mighty, The Lord mighty in battle (Psalm 24:8).”  David’s perception of preparation wrought him the victory by the Hand of the Lord.  Paul wrote, “For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty in God for pulling down strongholds, 5 casting down arguments and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ, 6 and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is fulfilled.

When you are in battle, trust in the Lord who has a track record of victory every time He engages in battle.  You may be fighting in the natural, but the Lord is your glorious sword and shield in the supernatural.  Be encouraged today that you are on the Lord’s side and keep your perception of preparation focused on the Lord of Hosts.

  Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

38So Saul clothed David with his ﻿﻿armor, and he put a bronze helmet on his head; he also clothed him with a coat of mail. ﻿39David fastened his sword to his armor and tried to walk, for he had not tested them. And David said to Saul, “I cannot walk with these, for I have not tested them.” So David took them off. ﻿40Then he took his staff in his hand; and he chose for himself five smooth stones from the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag, in a pouch which he had, and his sling was in his hand (1 Sam 17:38-40).” 
My wife and I went to a marriage retreat one year where the speaker shared a story from his marriage about how he cut carrots verse how his wife cut carrots.  Whenever he would see his wife cutting carrots he would correct her, and instruct her to cut the carrots his way.  She would do it for a time although feeling uncomfortable doing it his way.  When he left the room, she usually returned to the way that she initially was cutting the carrots.  There are certainly times that one will tell another how to do something based how the first one has always done it.  Looking throughout Scripture, how should one fight a battle, walk around a wall seven times (if one is present), fight with 300 men only, or sling stones at the enemies head?  There were numerous battles in Scripture, and each army won the battle in a different way.  Joshua marched around the Jericho walls, Gideon fought with 300 men, and of course David would slay Goliath with a sling and stone.  There were different tactics used to bring about victory, but each victory was the battle plan by God’s leader and God gave the victory.  The only times Israel lost battle is when they did not go according to God’s plans, or because there was sin in the camp.  How should one fight a battle?
When David convinced Saul and the others that he would fight Goliath in battle, Saul began to suit David up in Saul’s armor.  However when David tried to walk he couldn’t move well in them. “The king’s tunic and armor would have been very distinctive. If David went out dressed in them, many would have thought that the king himself was going out. Perhaps such a misidentification would have seemed attractive to Saul, who had been sought out by the Israelites to lead them forth in battle. In the Iliad a similar switch occurred when Patroclus went out in the armor of Achilles, hoping to intimidate the Trojans. David’s refusal would have reflected his recognition that without being trained on how to use the armor and weapons to his advantage, they would become a detriment (The IVP Bible background commentary : Old Testament).”
David chose to wear what he knew and fight with a weapon that he was familiar with.  The sling was used in organized warfare therefore Goliath should have known its deadly potential.  David perceived that if he used this weapon in the past, he could fight with it now.  There are many that we can learn from, but God has uniquely wired each of so differently.  We must be wise about putting on Saul’s armor.  Battles are won and lost based on yielding ourselves to God.  Look back to the battles you have won, and you too will acknowledge God’s hand brought the victory.  If you trusted Him in times past, can you not trust Him now?  Remember Paul’s words, “And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose,” and thank God right now.”  Let God prepare you in His way, and respond obediently, and see God will never let you down.
Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God. 37 David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and the LORD be with thee (1 Sam 17:36-37).”

Growing up, I lived about fifteen minutes away from a Seeing Eye dog training center called Guiding Eyes for the Blind.  Now certain dogs are being trained to one day be prepared to serve as “eyes” for a blind person.  Of course the dog doesn’t know this while it is going through the training, but one day it will walk in its purpose.  Have you ever experienced a season of difficult times, unknown times, unsure times, whereby you truly did not realize at the time why you were going through the situation that you found yourself in?  David was a shepherd tending his flock in the field.  One day David would be summoned to meet with the prophet Samuel who would anoint David as King of Israel.  After David is anointed King, although at this time he is truly a king without a kingdom at this time (Gen 16), David volunteers to step up to the challenge of facing the Philistine Champion Goliath. 

What was it about David that cause him to believe that he could actually defeat, not just step up to the challenge, Goliath?   David had a perception of his preparation.  David thought back to the times that vicious animals attacked his sheep, and David recalled how God delivered him out of the paws of those that attacked his sheep.  Once again even though David is a King without a kingdom at this time, David perceived that God was preparing him to defeat Goliath back when David was fighting in the field protecting his sheep.  Like a ferocious animal with sharp paws attacking David’s sheep, so was Goliath with a sharp sword attacking the sheep (Israel).

David would become the under-shepherd (the shepherd, under the Shepherd [God]), but would David fight for Israel?  David didn’t realize until it was time to volunteer for the challenge against Goliath, that God had prepared him in times past for present and future battles and challenges.  Are you facing something at this time that you feel that you cannot accomplish?  If you believe that, you are right, you can’t accomplish it, or anything work alone.  Jesus said, “apart from Me you can do nothing (John 15).”  Notice David proclaimed that even though David fought, it was God who delivered.

Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.”  Saul had man’s perception in mind, while David had a godly perception knowing God prepared him for such a time as this. What giant are you facing or about to face in your life?  Can you like David look back in your life and have a perception of preparation for what lay ahead of you?  God has brought you through so much, can He not bring you through whatever you are facing or about to face.  Why not take time to write down some of the major battles God has brought you through and thank Him for those times.  Then write down those battles you are facing or know you are about to face and thank God He also has the same power to bring you through them.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: The Power Of Tongue, by Lorraine White

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 3:5-6, “Even so the tongue is a little member and boasts great things.  Behold how great a matter a little fire kindleth!  And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity:  so is the tongue among our members that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

Almost everyday we hear of a fire which could have been accidental or intentional and so many lives lost or damage caused due to the fire. Likewise, sparks from hot tempers or careless words start fires which consume millions of lives in beautiful relationships. Once began, these fires move unrelentingly through self-esteem and trust – nothing is safe from the fury of the tongue.

Our tongue has incredible power to build up and encourage, comfort and counsel, as well as tear down, abuse and destroy.  It is so strange that at times we can be very gentle in our talk and, at times we can be very rude and harsh. “Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.” (James 3:10).

When we place our trust in Jesus, our sins are eternally forgiven; but the day will come when our careless words are revealed and we see the full extent of the damage we’ve done.  “But I say unto you, that every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgement. For by thy words thou shall be justified, and by thy words thou shall be condemned.” (Matthew 12:36-37).

In the Bible we read that David prayed that God would “set a watch O Lord, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips” (Psalms 141:3). Once our words escape they can almost never be fully recovered. We must strive to control the sparks at the true source.  (Here, I’d like to quote an old nursery rhyme- Eggs and Words should be handled with care, Once eggs are broken and words are spoken, They can never be repaired again.)

In order to speak well, our heart and our thoughts need to be clean. Rather, we must fill our heart with the ways of God and allow our mouth to overflow with His love; “Thy word have I hid in my heart that I might not sin against You” (Psalms 119:11).

Have we, at any time, been the cause of some raging fires or smoldering members? If so, we must pray for healing and believe that “with God all things are possible” (Matthew 19:26). We must fill our heart with the power of His Word and let not any defamation or rubbish or blasphemy be spoken. Let’s stop the destructive fires. Let’s begin today to fill our heart with His Word and prevent the sparks.

Very few people realize the importance of the words they speak. Most people give it almost no thought – usually speaking without even thinking.

Jesus came from Heaven and revealed to us that words are very important. Only when we understand the importance of our tongue and the power of words, we can use them for good. Our tongue can be used to say appreciative things about somebody or something and also to praise and give glory to God.

The Bible says,  “death and life are in the power of the tongue (Proverbs 18:21). Just as fire can cause great destruction, if tamed and controlled it can be a great blessing to us. So it is with words. Life is in the power of the tongue. That means life is controlled by words.

God’s blessings be with you today and always.  Have a great day.

Lorraine White.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 100:4, “Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, and into His courts with praise: be thankful unto Him, and bless His name”

It’s good and recommended that we call on God when we are in need, He has promised to be  help us. The bible says,” God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble”, Psalm 46:1. He is our present help when we face tough situations in life. He is the only one whom we can run to.

Many times we become experts in asking and fail to come back to truly give thanks. In the bible there were ten lepers who came to Jesus crying for healing. After Jesus told them to go and show themselves to the Priest as sign of healing, they became healed on their way but only one came back to give thanks to the Lord. Jesus asked him what happened to the other nine who also received healing. The man who came back to give thanks was completely made whole meaning that his healing was not for a season but forever. How many times does God do things for us and we forget to give Him thanks and if we do, it’s one of those quick thanks. Remember when you went before Him to ask for that thing for days and when He finally came through for you, a quick two minutes thanks is all He got. I believe that when we give thanks, we are creating more channels for more blessings and not only that, when we give thanks, the blessing is sealed (completed)

At times it’s not easy to give thanks when what you desire has not been released to you. What do we do when we apply for jobs, at the end we say, “Thanking you in advance” not knowing whether we will get it or not. I thank God in advance as a sign that I trust that He can do it and He will according to His will and in His time, so I thank Him in advance. He is the God who calls those things that are not as though they were because He knows that by the time He is done making it, it will become what He said it will be despite what it is today.

David learnt the secret of giving thanks to the Lord and many places in the bible you hear him talking about giving thanks. Psalm 92, “It’s is good to give thanks to the Lord and sing praises unto my God” Oh give thanks to the Lord for His mercies endures for ever.

You may say that you have nothing to thank God for, well you are a live today, you have a job, you have a place to live, you drive, the most important thing, you are saved. We have a reason to thank Him today, even when I thought that today I would ask Him for more stuff, I feel like I need to thank Him for many things that He has done, some of them haven’t come to pass yet but I thank Him for them. Let’s enter into His gates with thanksgiving in our hearts and into His courts with praise. Have a blessed day. Blessings Ev
